And of course within the Danish travel rules. Then we can now say it out loud to both tourists and business travelers: Come to Denmark if you want to feel everyday life again. Denmark is ready for the future. Unemployment is lower than before the crisis. Production is higher than before the crisis. Employment beats all records. Growth is expected to be the highest in 15 years. Not 5 years. Not 10 years. But 15 years. I am glad that the government and a majority here in the Folketing stood firm. Because while there were discussions along the way. And disagreement. Then it is now beyond any doubt. It was responsible to borrow. It was responsible to invest us through the crisis. It was right to pursue an expansive and active crisis policy. I would like to say to business and to the trade union movement: You have confirmed that you are a strong and responsible part of Danish society. Denmark is based on solid and well -run companies. We need to address the problems you have right now to get the employees you need. The government, the social partners and KL are in full swing negotiations on a tripartite agreement that is about just that. Lack of labor must not slow us down. Therefore, more Danes need to work. Only how we become more proficient, greener and richer. It is said that one must never let a good crisis go to waste. I have always had a little strained with that speech. After all, we have seen before how the political crisis management left a bill in those who had the most difficulty in paying it. Greater inequality. In a time of high unemployment. Unreasonable reforms. This is not the case this time. We still need to pay attention to the consequences of the corona. Loneliness. Lost learning. A cultural life that still has a hard time in some places. But Denmark is solid. And now we must not let a potential boom go to waste. I am convinced that we have to take some very basic conversations about where we want to go. About how we solve the big problems that have been unresolved for too long. This is true of too many who do not have a job. Never really got a foothold. Standing outside the community. It's been wrong for decades. Even more now that we really need everyone. Last month, the government presented played - "Denmark can more 1". A reform that is both financially responsible and social justice. Which first and foremost has to get more Danes to work. Too many, especially women with a non-Western background, go home on passive support. Therefore, we will introduce a new 37-hour work logic, where you have a duty to contribute, to benefit if you receive public benefit. When we have to solve our community's biggest challenges, it is not done with one reform. We've only just started. Denmark can do more. The government has presented ten progress for the next ten years. The ten progress will require a long cool move and a persistence. We will present new reform proposals in the coming year. Today I want to focus on three challenges. First, Denmark's responsibility for the green transition that I started my speech with. Secondly, the programs. I will come to them in a little while. And thirdly, the context of our country. The necessity of slowing down centralization. Strengthen proximity. Make the big cities even better to live in. * * Recently I visited the company Polytech in Bramming. They produce protection for wind turbine blades. And that is doing so well that - almost six out of ten of all the world's wind turbines from Shanghai to California, Polytech is so good. There is progress. New people are hired. If otherwise they are to get. It can pinch. And that led that day in Bramming to a good talk about why many young people attend high school, and too few choose the business school. Director Mads Kirkegaard is himself a craftsman. He goes to schools and tells how important it is to choose a professional education. But in reality, we need to get hold of the parents, he said. For they are the ones that are below the fact that the high school is finer. And it infects the young. It leads me into the other big theme I want to talk about today: Education. The Danes' journey through the education system is a huge success. Denmark is poor in raw materials. We live by being skilled. But the question is whether we educate too much for the past and too little for the future? When we have to navigate a new time with robots, artificial intelligence, digital revolution, global outlook, green transition and at the same time need presence and community - what demands do it make for our education? I would like to invite that debate. We need talented researchers. Green technologies. New medicine and vaccines. Knowledge of our history and culture. Knowledge is progress. And it is a big step forward that thousands of young people today read at university. Once closed country for most. Today an open road for many. But it also means that where the programs used to be for the few who typically had to teach or research - then more highly educated people today have to work in private companies. How do we educate for a labor market in ten or twenty years? Many of the small and medium -sized businesses are not used to hiring academics. And the academics are not used to working there. It demands everyone. And requires innovation. This also applies to primary school. Almost every sixth student leaves the school without being able to read, write and count. Thousands of cute, smart, lovely children and young people. Annual. Which does not get the foundation they need. I was told the following story by a relieved father of a boy in one of the elementary school's oldest classes. After a deeply worrying message about how it went to school, the father arranged for the son to come out on a business one day a week. The boy who was more than difficult to get to school jumped on the bus at six in the morning to get to work. Work clothes and community gave him an identity. The new energy infected the homework. Now he could see what to use. And the story is even better than that. The company offered the boy an apprenticeship. A pure sunbeam story. Or what? The father's point to me was another one. Namely, it must never depend on a parent or student responsibility. But first and foremost must be a social responsibility. For what about all the other school -weary boys and girls who don't have a father with the right contacts? I agree. I think we need a greater interaction between education and jobs all the way up in the education system. For the school-weary, 14-year-old boy in 8th grade, who can learn much more if he is allowed to replace the school with a workplace-one day or two a week. And wider than that: What about, for example, we think the electrician and engineering profession closer together. Clothing craftsmen and design. Carpenter and architect. At the Royal Academy, which also contains the architectural study, over the past ten years, only about 16 students have been admitted a year on a different basis than a high school exam. You will change that now. With a new, two -year master's program for building engineers. Where more people have a skilled background. I think it's exciting. We have to move on along that path. * * Today, society spends many billions of dollars on the education we take first in life. We spend far less money on the adult and continuing education we get later in working life. Almost half of the 20-24 year olds are undergoing an education. For us who are filled forty, it is only one percent. Why do we still think of education as something you get over early in life - when we know that so many of us are going to be a long time in a labor market in rapid development? It is a clear goal for the government that more people should work. The programs are an important part of it. Therefore, we must also ask ourselves if the quality of our education - both the long and the short - is good enough. Is more teaching needed? More feedback from the teacher? We have already allocated almost a billion dollars for primary school. Raised youth education. Removed re -prioritization contribution. Abolished the education ceiling. On top of all that, the government will invest DKK 2.5 billion every year. It is the biggest extra investment in education as long as I can remember. We will involve students, students, educators, trade union movement and business. And of course, the parties here in the Folketing that take responsibility for funding. You must all help prioritize. And thus also to choose from. So the investments are aimed at solving the long -term challenges. We started the dialogue four days ago with a meeting at Marienborg. Thanks to you who were involved and contributed. Mille Borgen Mikkelsen, chairman of Danish School Students, hit the day well with the words: "All students must be allowed to be a success." * * * I experience many places in Danish society - a new courage. A strong willingness to create development yourself. An optimism for the future. I have no doubt that Denmark can do more. But it requires greater openness. We need to see old issues in a new light. The same goes for the government. All of you here in the parliamentary hall. We have to ask ourselves how we have been able to agree with the recognition of major problems for decades - without getting them resolved? Time and time again, we experience an unfortunate spiral of individual cases and rushed legislation - which steals the attention of what we are here for - to solve real problems for the benefit of the citizens. Can you recognize the picture? First, the government will present a law program for the new parliamentary year, which is less extensive than usual. Less hasty legislation. Rather fewer and, in turn, better elaborate proposals. And not least - more time for everyone in who will make the bills work for citizens and businesses - are not overturned by the law mill. Secondly, we will prioritize the implementation of the legislation in a much more visible way. Today, a good agreement text contains sections on the legislative process, about finances - there should also be a section on how the agreement is implemented. Implemented. Is going to work for citizens and businesses. Third, the democratic conversation needs new vitamins. Fragmented. Shallow. Probably too hard. We all know the feeling. Especially on social media. We must create space for reflection and reflection. And therefore also increased awareness of the parts of society that carry it thoughtfulness. Which gives us the opportunity to live us into the lives of other people. And thus the nerve in understanding ourselves and our world is better. The art and culture. We need Danish art and culture to challenge us. Create the framework for our common memory. The connection between our history, our present and our common future. Brings us meaning and understanding. Wonder and curiosity. And formation. After all, that's what we have to strive for. To become spiritually stronger. Understanding. Knowing. And thus more robust. Here we need the literature, the music, the visual arts, the drama, the film. And the framework for the democratic conversation must be set by ourselves. Not by multinational corporations. Therefore, we must have a common European regulation of the tech giants. And National Public Service with quality and versatility. * * * In a world of split. And polarization. Should we in Denmark insist on the opposite. Our community. Denmark must be connected. With good opportunities both in the countryside and in the cities. That's the third big theme in my speech today. Copenhagen is a fantastic capital. A beautiful city where towers and spiers rise over the old houses. The bridge neighborhoods, where the urban renewal has given way to green farms. In recent years the development along the harbor. New bicycle bridges. New districts at Holmene. And first and foremost is the capital - its population. The people who live here. The Copenhageners. That jumps in the water all year round. And cycles the streets thin in sunshine and sleet. The capital of Denmark is a city where people actually live and live. It is well. And when you look around the world, it's far from a matter of course. But there is a problem anyway. A big problem. Many can no longer afford to live in the capital of all. What does a three -room condominium cost at Nørrebro? Often more than four million kroner. Maybe more than five million. What about the school teacher, the educator, the police officer, the SOSU assistant, the shop assistant, the hairdresser, the carpenter or the young academic? If they are first -time buyers, then it is difficult. Really hard. Hear what a dedicated Copenhagener has written about the city, as it once was: “Of course there was a difference between living in Sydhavnen and Frederiksberg Allé, but in very large parts of the 70s Copenhagen people lived by all types and from all social groups in between each other in fertile confusion: In the same rise, academics, clerks lived and strangely transparent existence (who first began to move, Søren Ulrik Thomsen, who longs back to his youth's mixed neighborhood. I can follow him. As I grew up in Aalborg in the 1980s, we lived together. I played with, went to school with and shared neighborhood with children from many different families. Maybe some of you can also recognize that picture? Bo dying around door provides an understanding of other people's conditions. But today we unfortunately live more separately. Some call it globalization or urbanization. And it gets a sound of something you can't avert. A nature power that is impossible to stop. I see it as one of my most important tasks as prime minister. To go against that thinking. Whether it is increasing inequality. A labor market that is being less organized. Or that centralization - just something we have to accept. The government will soon present an ambitious housing. Basically, families with ordinary incomes must have the opportunity to live in the cities. A lot is being built in these years. Also many public housing. But we need even more homes that are payable. Therefore, the government will make it possible to build 22,000 more public housing over the next 10-15 years. Most will be built in the larger cities. In Greater Copenhagen alone, our upcoming housing play can mean a tripling of the new construction of public housing. Three times as many newly built family homes in Copenhagen. Typically 80-90 square meters. With a rent of about DKK 8,000 a month. It will be felt in the cityscape. We should not divide ourselves. The cities must be able to accommodate everyone. We will also bring that quality from old Copenhagen - that architectural value must be united with solid craftsmanship. We will let the new generation of talented architects continue the strong Danish tradition. To draw and build to people. So housing is both good to live and live in. And beautiful to look at. * * * I am proud of our whole country. We need all parts of Denmark. Therefore, it is sad when parts of the country are emptied of important functions. Education, police, shops close in a vicious spiral. The strong centralization of Denmark has not only been tacitly accepted. It is also a result of political decisions. We have a strong welfare society. There is a lot that succeeds every single day. But there are also noticeable challenges. There is a lack of time for care and relationships. And for many public servants, they find that they lack space for their professionalism. Just ask in the Prison and Probation Service, where a lift and a new direction really need to be needed. There are hospital departments where too strong is run. Elderly people who do not experience a dignified old age. Children who do not have enough adult contact. For far too many years, the mantra was efficiency and optimization. Since the government took office, more funds have been added in agreement by agreement to children, the elderly, the education and the health field. But obviously that's not enough. We need deeper change. We would propose a welfare law to ensure that the money follows when we fortunately become more children and the elderly. There must be enough time and employees. Both in the children's and the elderly. And in the hospitals. It also means more colleagues. It is important. But that's not enough either. There must be more time for the core task. To birth. To the care of the elderly affected by dementia. To the relationship with the child. Therefore, time must be released. From processes, management and paperwork. To the citizen. Today, a nurse employed in a municipality must not give an elderly man two Panodils if he has a headache. It is an example of lack of common sense. Time that is used incorrectly. And management instead of leadership. We need a close health care system where the patient is not lost between the hospital and the municipalities. Where we trust the professionalism of the employees. And where there are enough colleagues for the tasks that are. It requires that we choose welfare rather than tax cuts. That we take further steps in a proximity reform. And gives room that the most important thing is also the highest priority. And that other tasks lapse. * * At the same time, we need to secure more options. Also in the province. Not as a conflict between country and city. Centralization strikes us all. There are also citizens of Copenhagen's West Bank who miss the local police, and here are also challenges with medical coverage. More needs to be closer. We are at it. Moving education so that young people can stay. Tax centers with local jobs. Better option for loans to the home where it is now difficult. 20 new local police stations. I was allowed to join when the local police opened in Struer and the new local officer walked around the streets and inquired, "What are you dealing with?" It makes so good sense. As the proprietor of the Limfjord Ice House said, "It gives some security." Exactly. That's good for the stores. It is safe for the elderly. It is preventative for young people who risk getting into crime. It must be good to be young in Denmark. In the big city, in the province and in the countryside. More young people in Denmark must have a youth education close to where they have grown up. * * * The next place we take hold is health. In the coming years, the super hospitals will be aware of the entire country. With highly specialized cancer treatment. Heart surgery. That's common sense. It saves life. It was a real decision. But at the same time, close health has been neglected. It is particularly serious in a situation where we become more with chronic illnesses, more with mental disorders and more elderly people. Today there are many elderly people who have many and long trips to the hospital. Maybe to have a blood test one day. To conversation the other day. X -ray check on the third day. It is important. But also cumbersome. Yes, sometimes completely incomprehensible. As something new, we will establish local hospitals. Where municipalities, regions and general practitioners can work closer together on the patient. It becomes more safe. We also address the problem that too many people do not have access to our own GP. And there must be access to quick emergency assistance everywhere. * * At the same time, the epidemic control has continued the full attention of the authorities. For if Corona runs from us. Then everything else can quickly get back into the background. Denmark is far in vaccination efforts, thanks to the support of the Danes. We need even more. The vaccines are our super weapons. And here too we take responsibility internationally. We have doubled Denmark's donation of vaccines to other countries from 3 million to 6 million. We are only sure when everyone is safe. * * * I started my speech today with Denmark's responsibility in the international climate crisis. I will end my speech with another important area where Denmark has to take a responsibility in the world. An area that the situation in Afghanistan has made unhappy. Girls and women's rights. The development is deeply worrying. I fear that the Afghan girls and women are slowly but surely replacing free life at universities and on the football field with the darkness of the burka. Denmark will do what we can to help the hard -tried Afghan population. Along with our allies. And via the EU. Humanitarian to help more. And to avoid a refugee crisis like the one in 2015. It is not only in Afghanistan that the rights of girls and women are brutally under foot. More and more places we see that the progress and the equality that women have fought for themselves are being rolled back. This applies to education. And that applies to free abortion. Women's right to decide on our own bodies, decide and when we want to have children - is crucial. Denmark and Europe have an obligation to respond. Insist that the EU is also a collaboration between countries with common values. Violation of the very fundamental rights is also happening at home. In some immigrant communities and religious environments, many girls and women fight for the freedom to live their lives as they themselves wish. Too often they have to fight alone. As a society, we must step much stronger in character. Stand clearly that our values ​​- equality, freedom - apply to everyone in Denmark. The government will therefore set up a commission for girls and women's freedom and rights. Every girl and woman in Denmark must live without violence. Without social control. Have the freedom of choosing his spouse. Have the right to work. Have the right to an independent income. Rights and freedom. No matter where you or your family come from. Here we will also be a pioneering country. * * * Finally a special thanks to SF, Radical Left and the Unity List for a good collaboration throughout the first two years. Collegial confidentiality. Political impatience. Together we have set a new direction for Denmark. Also a thank you to all of you here in the Folketing, who contribute to the broad cooperation. And thus to accountability, progress and stability. Today I will invite a broad dialogue about the upcoming reforms. More in work. Denmark's responsibility in the climate crisis. Education for the future. Housing that is at paying. Health closer. Freedom and equality for everyone in Denmark. Our amazing country can do more. Denmark Live. Hurray! Hurray! Hurray!

topics_dk: Mette Frederiksen tale ved Socialdemokratiets kongres
speeches_dk: Kære alle her i salen. Kære jer, der ser med hjemmefra. Kære socialdemokrater. Kære alle. For kort tid siden udkom første del af FN’s sjette klimarapport. Vi vidste godt, at klimakrisen er vores generations allerstørste udfordring. Men rapporten er alligevel dyster læsning. Klimaforandringerne vil ske hurtigere, end vi troede. Konsekvenserne er større, end vi troede. Og udviklingen bliver sværere at begrænse, end vi troede. Klimaforandringerne er ikke et fjernt mareridt. De er her lige nu – og det vil kun blive værre. Højere temperaturer. Isen der smelter. Vandstanden der stiger. Ørkenen der breder sig. Skovbrande nogle steder. Senest i Grækenland. For få år siden i Australien. Andre steder regn i mængder, vi ikke har set før. I Tyskland. I sommer. Hele bydele blev skyllet væk. Vi mærker de voldsomme ændringer i vejret. Det er ikke kun isbjørnen i nord, der mister sine naturlige livsbetingelser. Også mange mennesker kan i fremtiden ikke blive boende, hvor de har boet i generationer. Vi bor på en klode, der forandrer sig med en ødelæggende hast. Klimakrisen kræver politisk handling. Grøn energi, forskning, biler, madvaner. Men vigtigst af alt. Det starter og slutter med ansvar. Om vi er klar til at se os selv som en del af naturgrundlaget. Acceptere, at dyrene, planterne og den luft vi lever af ikke er noget andet end os selv. Men tværtimod en betingelse for vores fortsatte eksistens. Og om vi er klar til at acceptere konklusionen: At vi skal leve, forbruge og transportere os, så vi passer på kloden og hinanden. Og vi skal bruge klodens ressourcer med respekt for dem, der kommer efter os. Det burde egentlig ikke være så svært. Det er jo vores egne børn og børnebørn. Vi skal tage ansvar. Hver især. Og især sammen. Med regeringsskiftet kom helt nye ambitioner ind i lovgivningen. Danmark er et af de lande i verden, der vil mest for klimaet. På kortest tid. Jeg tror på den danske strategi. En ambitiøs, grøn omstilling båret af en bred folkelig opbakning. Tak for det. --- At vi i 2030 skal udlede 70 pct. mindre er vores konstante ledetråd. Derfor har vi på få år fremlagt forslag og truffet vigtige beslutninger, som bringer os næsten halvdelen af vejen. Jeg er glad for, at vi lige nu har et politisk flertal på Christiansborg, der evner at træffe de svære beslutninger. Med rapporten fra FN’s klimapanel IPCC står det klart, at selv de lande, der er nået langt. Skal gøre mere, end de gør i dag. Det gælder også for Danmark. Vi ved godt, at vi ikke er i mål endnu. Vi har nu sat en slutdato for produktionen af olie og gas i Nordsøen i 2050. Vi er i gang med en omfattende elektrificering af Danmark. Vores elproduktion skal være grøn. Vi etablerer to nye energiøer. Vi har besluttet en markant omlægning af vognparken. 775.000 grønne biler. Mindst. En ensartet CO2-afgift. Med det mål, at det bliver dyrere at producere og forbruge sort og billigere at producere og forbruge grønt. Og landbruget. Ja, landbruget skal også være med. Vi lever i et af de mest intensivt dyrkede lande i verden. I Danmark producerer vi fødevarer, der kan brødføde næsten 3 gange så mange mennesker, som vi selv er. Det skaber eksport og masser af arbejdspladser. Det giver os også et endnu større ansvar for faktisk at passe på klimaet og naturen. Nu går de politiske forhandlinger om landbruget ind i sin afsluttende fase. Og lad mig i dag gøre det helt klart: Landbruget skal – selvfølgelig – omfattes af et bindende reduktionsmål. --- Jeg er stolt af, hvor langt vi er nået i Danmark. Og jeg er stolt af, at Danmark leverer de løsninger, som resten af verden efterspørger. Kloden rundt findes danske vindmøller, dansk design, pumper, vandsystemer og vinduer. Tænk, at Danmark er det første land i verden, der indgår et grønt strategisk partnerskab med Indien. Vi har meget at bidrage med, når 1,3 mia. indere skal forbruge grønt el, bygge grønt og have adgang til rent drikkevand. Om lidt mere end en måned mødes verdens ledere til COP26 i Skotland. Det er nu, der skal handles. De rige lande skal levere på deres løfter. De store vækstøkonomier skal løfte mere. Den danske regering vil arbejde intensivt for at fremme et ambitiøst resultat i Glasgow. Blandt andet derfor rejser jeg selv allerede i morgen til New York i forbindelse med FN’s generalforsamling for at deltage i et globalt klimatopmøde. Vi gik til valg på, at Danmark igen skulle være en grøn stormagt. Det leverer vi nu. Samtidig gør vi klar til de næste store beslutninger. For lidt over en uge siden fremlagde regeringen vores store reformforslag: Danmark kan mere I. Også her spiller klima en rolle. Vi sætter elafgiften ned, så strøm – der om få år vil være 100 pct. grøn – bliver billigere. Vi afsætter en milliard om året til yderligere klimainvesteringer. Som noget nyt foreslår vi, at Danmark skal have 3 splinternye, hypermoderne og virkelig attraktive klimaerhvervsskoler. Og her en særlig hilsen til jer, der er unge: Hvis du drømmer om en bæredygtig fødevareproduktion i Danmark og at arbejde med afgrøder på en miljø- og klimavenlig måde – så er der her en uddannelsesvej for dig. Hvis du drømmer om cirkulær økonomi og at bygge og renovere boliger med gammelt genbrugsmateriale, jordvarme og ren energi – så er der her en uddannelsesvej for dig. Og hvis du drømmer om et moderne fjernvarmesystem fyldt med nye grønne løsninger. At sætte vindmøller op på havet. At producere affaldssystemer uden ressourcebelastning – så er der her en uddannelsesvej for dig. De unge har vist os andre, at klimaet skal være helt i toppen af dansk politik. Det er jer. Og det er danske lønmodtagere. Forskere. Selvstændige. Kreative. Iværksættere. Pensionskasser. Erhvervsledere. Hverdagsaktivister. Det er jer, der skaber forandringens grønne vinde. Giv dem en stor hånd. --- Regeringen har fremlagt 10 fremskridt for Danmark de næste 10 år. Et grønnere Danmark er ét af dem. Fælles er en fornyet tro på, at politik betyder noget. Når vi kan bekæmpe en global pandemi. Fordi vi beslutter os for det. Så er der så meget andet, vi også kan. Det har fået nogle til at sige, at vi er magtfulde. Men der er én ting, der er helt sikkert. Man kan ikke bekæmpe klimakrisen. Man kan ikke tackle de helt store udfordringer. Hvis man er magtesløs. Kald det hvad I vil. Socialdemokrater. Vi er aldrig bange for at tage ansvar. Slet ikke i kriser. Coronakrisen har lært os, at der altid er et valg. Da pandemien ramte med ekstrem styrke – stod vi over for en skæbnesvanger beslutning. Vi kunne lade pandemien rasere. Tage sine ofre. Både i menneskeliv og arbejdsløshed. Vi valgte det modsatte. Hver især satte vi vores egne behov til side. Blev hjemme. Holdt afstand. Fik styr på smitten. Den nødvendige infrastruktur for værnemidler, test og vacciner blev opbygget. Et enigt folketing vedtog historisk store hjælpepakker. Indførte lønkompensation. Fagbevægelse og arbejdsgivere trådte til. Tog ansvar gennem 17 trepartsaftaler. På en dag som i dag kan jeg godt sige det, som det er: Vi førte ekspansiv, socialdemokratisk krisepolitik. Det var det, vi gjorde. Ikke med de ord. Men med det indhold. Og resultatet? Det kan I se, når I kigger jer rundt i Danmark. Vi holdt arbejdsløsheden nede. Det samme med konkurserne. Og fordi vi aldrig lukkede den private industriproduktion ned, så er der nu fuld damp på både forbruget og eksporten. Vi har styr på gælden. Dansk økonomi er holdbar. Og beskæftigelsen? Den har aldrig været højere. Vi forventer nu den højeste vækst i 15 år. Ikke i 5 år, ikke i 10 år – men i 15 år. Vi har et imponerende dygtigt erhvervsliv. I snart 150 år har Socialdemokratiet stået på samme side som danske arbejdere og lønmodtagere. I de næste 150 år. Der står vi på samme side som både lønmodtagere og virksomheder! Tak til hele Danmark for jeres indsats. For det I valgte at undvære for det fælles bedste. Tak til de unge der passede på de ældre. Tak til alle jer, der gik en kilometer ekstra, så vi i fællesskab kunne redde liv og få os så stærkt igennem krisen. Og tak til jer her i salen. Det var mig, der stod med det ultimative ansvar i de mørkeste uger og måneder. I var der. I bakkede op. Og ikke én eneste gang skulle jeg forsvare regeringen internt her i Socialdemokratiet. Vi fik arbejdsro til at løfte det ansvar. Til at stå fast, når det var nødvendigt. Kære kongres. I skal vide, hvor taknemmelig jeg er for det. --- Det er vores forventning, at den mest alvorlige fase i coronakrisen nu ligger bag os. Langt de fleste danskere har ladet sig vaccinere. Vi har en stærk epidemikontrol. Derfor er Danmark åbent. Hverdagen er tilbage. Og hold nu op, hvor har vi savnet den! Med en buldrende økonomi på bundlinjen kan vi nu for alvor løfte blikket og se frem. Danmark kan mere. Vi skal mere. Først og fremmest skal vi investere mere i uddannelse. Vi har alle sammen brug for at blive dygtigere. Derfor foreslår vi et markant løft af uddannelserne. For at få råd til det, er der noget, vi må undvære. Derfor foreslår vi at stramme dimittendreglerne. Så man ikke går markant op i ydelse i det øjeblik, man afslutter sine studier og ikke har et job. Vi foreslår også at indføre en 37-timers arbejdspligt for folk, der ikke er integrerede i Danmark. Og ja, lad os bare lige tage værdispørgsmålet med det samme. Som samfund er vi dybt afhængige af hinanden. Undervejs i krisen så vi det meget konkret. Men det gælder også i ikke-krisetider. Det universelle velfærdssamfund med fri og lige adgang både til sundhed og uddannelse kan kun hænge sammen, hvis alle voksne som udgangspunkt går på arbejde. Jeg mener af hele mit hjerte, at det altid er bedre at have et arbejde end ikke at have et arbejde. Og jeg mener af hele mit socialdemokratiske hjerte, at alle mennesker er forbundet og forpligtet. Til at bidrage med alt hvad vi hver især kan. Til gengæld har samfundet – og virksomhederne – også et ansvar for dem, der har behov for omsorg og særlige rammer for at kunne være på en arbejdsplads. Og vi har et ansvar for dem, der gerne vil arbejde, men som desværre er for syge til det. De har krav på vores alles respekt og hjælp. Også derfor er det så afgørende, at de der kan arbejde også går på arbejde. Sådan er det for langt de fleste. Selvfølgelig. Men en del særligt kvinder med ikke vestlig-baggrund lever af passiv forsørgelse. Det er uholdbart. For integrationen. For deres børn. Og for dansk økonomi. Og for sammenhængskraften. Jeg møder rigtig mange mennesker med indvandrerbaggrund, der hver eneste dag – eller nat – knokler. For dem selv, for deres børn og for Danmark. Mange af dem har da en forventning om, at alle andre gør det samme. Derfor en ny arbejdspligt for borgere med et integrationsbehov. Det bedste er selvfølgelig, at du får et helt almindeligt arbejde. Men hvis ikke det lykkes med det samme, så skal du i fremtiden arbejde 37 timer om ugen for din ydelse. Jeg ved godt, at nogle borgmestre er kritiske over for det her forslag. Jeg ved også godt, at der nok skal være praktiske besværligheder. Men hvis vi lige løfter blikket engang. Og det er det, der er vores opgave som socialdemokrater. Så er det desværre et faktum, at der igennem de seneste fire årtier er kommet flere mennesker hertil, end hvad integrationen har kunnet bære. Mange bidrager positivt. Går på arbejde. Uddanner sig. Men der er for mange, der ikke gør. Kriminaliteten er for høj. Det er den sociale kontrol også. Og alt for mange går ikke på arbejde. Vi har over årene fået bedre styr på antallet og tilstrømningen. Det er fortsat afgørende. Men det kan ikke stå alene. Alle der er i Danmark skal bidrage positivt. Også til samfundsøkonomien. I år fejrer Socialdemokratiet 150 års jubilæum. Tillykke med en imponerende historie og rejse. Til de modige der dengang gik forrest. Dem der udbyggede, og til jer der løfter ansvaret i dag. Fra begyndelsen har vi samlet os under den røde fane. Sunget med på Oskar Hansens sange og kæmpet for de værdier, der har forandret sig i ordlyden, men aldrig i dybden. En af de værdier er samtidig en af de vigtigste forklaringer på, at Danmark er et af de bedste lande at leve i. Nemlig: Gør din pligt. Og kræv din ret. I den rækkefølge. En værdi, der samlede Danmark og som fortsat bør samle os. En værdi, som alle kan efterleve. Hvis vi vil. --- Når vi strammer reglerne for dimittender, indfører en arbejdspligt, hæver skatten i toppen af samfundet og omlægger erhvervsstøtten – ja, så har vi råd til andre vigtige ting. Så har vi i fremtiden råd til at investere 2,5 mia. kr. om året i uddannelse. Om året! Det kommer oveni, at denne regering allerede har fjernet omprioriteringsbidraget. Afskaffet uddannelsesloftet. Tilført midler til folkeskolen. Løftet taxametrene på ungdomsuddannelserne. Og sikret en bedre fordeling af uddannelser i hele landet. Jeg tror, de færreste gør sig begreb om, hvor meget vi egentlig investerer i unge og i uddannelse. Og derfor en invitation. Til elever og studerende. Undervisere. Ledere. Og ja, også til erhvervslivet. Kom med jeres bud på, hvordan vi skaber den største forandring. Vær med til at prioritere. Vælge til – og fra. Så de milliarder, vi fremover kan investere, kommer til at gøre en reel forskel. Uddannelse er ikke det eneste, vi får råd til, hvis et politisk flertal tager ansvar for finansieringen. Vi kan skabe et nyt og varigt grønt råderum. Og vi kan gøre noget, som jeg ved, ligger rigtigt mange mennesker på sinde. Både her i salen og ude i stuerne. Et konkret forslag, som vil give en række danske familier markant flere penge mellem hænderne. Nemlig jer, der er på førtids-, senior- eller folkepension. Som har en partner med en arbejdsindtægt. Som måske betyder, at I bliver trukket i pensionen. Vi foreslår nu at afskaffe de modregningsregler. Det gør det mere attraktivt for jeres partner at tage en ekstra tjans. Og det gør jeres pension mere værd. Vi foreslår også at styrke vores unikke samfundsmodel. Gode overenskomster. Høj organisationsgrad. Det giver tryghed og fleksibilitet. Men i dag er forskellen på løn og dagpenge blevet for stor. Mange mennesker oplever en stor nedgang i deres månedlige ydelse, hvis de mister deres arbejde. Derfor foreslår vi at hæve dagpengene i de første 3 måneder for folk, der har været i arbejde og en a-kasse længe. Lægger I alt det her sammen. Så har vi muligheden. For et rigere, grønnere og dygtigere Danmark. For en udvikling, hvor vi får råd til at investere i det, vi vil have mere af. Det kan lade sig gøre at føre politik, der er både økonomisk ansvarlig og social retfærdig. Det beviser vi nu. Det viser vi nu. Og som vi sagde i sommer: Vi skal ikke hjem. Vi skal videre. --- Lad mig her nævne 3 ting. Decentralisering. Sikkerhedspolitik. Ånd og sjæl. Alle ved, at vi socialdemokrater er meget optaget af decentralisering. Derfor er regeringen godt i gang med at træffe beslutninger, der skal skabe en bedre balance i Danmark. Så de områder, der har mistet mange af deres naturlige samfundsfunktioner, får nogle af dem tilbage. At den voldsomme centralisering nu endelig udfordres. En udligningsreform, der sikrer stabilitet og forudsigelighed om den lokale økonomi. Det er godt for velfærden lokalt. En stor infrastrukturaftale, der skaber større sammenhæng og mindre trængsel. Ikke mindst: 20 nye nærpolitistationer. Jeg har selv for nylig besøgt det kommende nærpoliti i Struer. Byen er glad. Det er det lokale handelsliv også. For slet ikke at tale om dem, der arbejder med udsatte unge. De er rigtigt glade. Det giver god mening. Det er min klare overbevisning, at uniformeret politi flere steder i Danmark giver tryghed. Og forebygger. Og næste runde er i gang. Nye uddannelser i byer som Hjørring, Holstebro, Esbjerg, Svendborg og i Næstved. 8 nye skattecentre og tusind lokale arbejdspladser. Bedre lånemuligheder i de egne af Danmark, hvor det ellers kan være svært at finde finansiering til en bolig. Centraliseringen af Danmark har stået på i mange år. Og det er så stærk en samfundsudvikling. Eller samfundsafvikling, at den ikke bare lader sig ændre. Vi ved godt, det er et langt sejt træk. Vi er startet. Og vi fortsætter. Men der er et par ting, jeg har lyst til at understrege. Vores ønske om et mere decentralt Danmark er ikke den konflikt mellem hovedstaden og provinsen, som det ofte italesættes som. Lad mig give et eksempel. Jeg ved, hvor meget det betyder for Struer med et lokalt politi. Men ved I hvad? Det betyder ligeså meget på Amager. Også her er politiet lukket ned. Nu bringer vi det tilbage. Tryghed og forebyggelse. Fordi de lokale betjente kender de udsatte familier. De ved, hvilke lillebrødre de skal holde ekstra øje med. Centraliseringens stærke kraft ses på landet. Men den ses også i byen. Det gælder i forhold til politiet. Og når det handler om sundhed. Der har været en del fokus på, at der mangler læger i eksempelvis Nordjylland. Og på Lolland. Men der mangler også læger på den københavnske vestegn. Så når vi i Socialdemokratiet taler om et Danmark, der er tættere på. Så gælder det mellem landsdelene. På tværs af det lille og store bælt. Men det gælder også i hovedstaden. København er en fantastisk by. Havnen, man kan bade i. Kulturen. Arkitekturen. Den afslappede atmosfære. Cykelstierne. Kære Danmark. Der er grund til at være stolte af vores hovedstad! Men der er også nogle meget konkrete problemer, som vi vil løse. I København og på Frederiksberg mangler der fodboldbaner og svømmehaller. Jeg kommer meget rundt i hele Danmark. Og kan se forskellene. Jeg tror, at mange jyder vil blive overrasket over at se, hvor lidt plads der er til ungerne i København. Derfor skal der investeres i nye idrætsfaciliteter. Og selvom København er en by, der i modsætning til mange andre storbyer stadig huser sin egen befolkning med liv og boliger midt i byen. Så gælder det også her, at det er blevet sværere for mennesker med almindelige indkomster at købe en bolig. Derfor vil regeringen præsentere et boligudspil, der skal sikre flere boliger, der faktisk er til at betale. Når Folketinget åbner, så vil vi også fremsætte vores forslag til en velfærdslov. Velfærdsloven skal sikre, at pengene følger med, når der kommer flere børn og ældre. Egentlig skulle man jo tro, at det gav sig selv. Men sådan har det ikke altid været. Der var engang, hvor et andet politisk flertal hellere ville have penge til skattelettelser end sikre en bund under velfærden. Alt i vores velfærd handler ikke om penge. Langt fra. Men det dur ikke, hvis børnehaver, plejehjem og sygehuse skal starte hvert år med at skære ned. Da vi socialdemokrater gik til valg på at indføre en velfærdslov. Da blev det kaldt ”luftig snak” af Venstre. Alligevel påstod Venstre, at de skam også ville prioritere velfærden... Kære Venstre. Hvis I mener de flotte ord fra dengang. Så stem for velfærdsloven, når den kommer til afstemning i Folketinget. --- I mere end 2 år har Danmark haft et nyt politisk flertal. Tak. Til Sofie. Til Pia. Og til Mai. For et tæt og tillidsfuldt samarbejde. For jeres indsats for Danmark. For jeres brændende engagement. Og ja, for jeres utålmodighed. Vi er ikke altid enige. Men skridt for skridt trækker vi Danmark i en mere retfærdig retning. Præcis som vi aftalte med hinanden i forståelsespapiret. Det betyder også noget, hvem der leder vores kommuner og regioner. 46 borgmestre er socialdemokrater. 4 regionsformænd er socialdemokrater. Vi er det eneste parti, der er repræsenteret i alle landets kommuner. For snart 4 år siden fik vi et fantastisk flot valg. Bedre end vi overhovedet havde håbet på. Vi blev Danmarks suverænt største parti. Vi genvandt de 4 store byer. Vi vandt 13 nye borgmesterposter. Flere end 3 mio. danskere har i dag en socialdemokratisk borgmester. Flere end 4 mio. danskere har en socialdemokratisk regionsformand. Det er et stort ansvar. Det forpligter. 16. november skal I vælgere til kommunal- og regionsrådsvalg. Her vil vi igen bede om jeres tillid. Kære kongres. Giv vores kandidater en hånd! --- Fra lokalpolitik til udenrigspolitik. Situationen i Afghanistan er tragisk og har gjort et kæmpe stort indtryk på os alle sammen. Jeg gruer for fremtiden for Afghanistans piger og kvinder. Om de igen vil forsvinde fra foldboldbanen, skolerne, universiteterne og fra vægmalerierne og ind bag burkaens blå fængselsvægge. Danmark, Europa og verdenssamfundet skal sikre den humanitære bistand, som den afghanske befolkning har brug for. Og vi skal lægge det hårdest mulige pres på Taleban. Bruge både udviklingsbistanden og udenrigspolitikken til at kæmpe for menneskerettigheder. Samtidig skal vi være stolte over alle de modige danske kvinder og mænd, der har bragt store ofre ved udsendelser igennem årene. Det er dem, der har kæmpet for vi andres frihed og sikkerhed. Det var rigtigt at gå ind i Afghanistan. Det var den eneste beslutning, vi kunne træffe, da USA blev angrebet. I NATO aktiverede vi for første gang musketereden. Og reagerede kollektivt og sammen. Ved modangrebet på Al-Qaeda og på det regime, der husede terrorister. Efter 20 års indsats vil der opstå mange diskussioner. Det er både forståeligt og nødvendigt. Men jeg vil gerne fremhæve 2 ting. Vi vil også i fremtiden få brug for at slå hårdt tilbage mod den militante islamisme. Og alliancen med amerikanerne er fortsat helt afgørende. Terrorismen har godt fat i vores verden. Vi så det herhjemme i 2015. Vi har set det i mange europæiske lande. På Sri Lanka. I Nairobi. Og konflikterne i Mellemøsten. Når vi bliver angrebet. Fordi vi er frie. Demokratiske. Vestlige. Ligestillede. Så svarer vi igen. Ellers kan vi ikke leve op til det, der er det vigtigste for en regering: At passe på sin egen befolkning og sit land. Vi kan kun sikre frihed. Tryghed. Og sikkerhed. Hvis Europa og USA vedbliver med at være hinandens nærmeste. Den transatlantiske alliance, som blev bygget på 2. verdenskrig, har været danskernes garant for tryghed og sikkerhed i mere end 70 år. Danmark vil altid leve op til vores internationale ansvar. --- Min tale og min politiske beretning nærmer sig sin afslutning. Reformer, uddannelse, udlændingepolitik, klima, sikkerhed og velfærd. Til sidst et par ord om det øjet ikke altid kan se. Vores sprog, traditioner, kunst og kultur. Danskernes samfundssind. Vores samfundssind. Er den vigtigste enkeltstående forklaring på, at vi er kommet så godt igennem krisen. Vi er ikke ligeglade med hinanden. Vi er forbundet. Føler os forbundet. Det har så stor en værdi. Større end nærmest alt andet. Forbundetheden mellem os kommer ikke af sig selv. Det er skabt af, og i det vi er fælles om. Når fællessang bliver til fælles sprog. Oplevelserne vi deler i sporten. Nysgerrigheden der vækkes i billedkunsten. Erindringen der filmatiseres. Empatien vi får fra den sublime litteratur. Dansk kunst og kultur skaber sammen med os, som udøvende eller lyttende og seende, alt det vi er fælles om. Det var Socialdemokratiet, der i sin tid oprettede Kulturministeriet. Vi gav kunsten og kulturen en særlig plads i det politiske maskinrum. Den forpligtigelse er vi klar til at løfte. Nu talte jeg om uddannelse før. Men på mange måder er det jo ordets sidste halvdel, der er noget af det allervigtigste. Dannelse. At vi hver især efterstræber aldrig at afslutte vores egen rejse henimod at fordybe os, blive klogere og være nysgerrige på andre mennesker, og det der er ukendt. Vi står overfor at forhandle en ny medieaftale. Her kan det hurtigt komme til kun at handle om støttekroner til det ene eller andet medie. Der er en diskussion, der er endnu vigtigere. Hvad er mediernes rolle i dag? Hvordan bidrager de bedst muligt til dannelse? Til nysgerrighed? Til at udvikle vores demokrati? Til at facilitere en offentlig samtale mellem oplyste mennesker? Hvordan sikrer vi proportionalitet i mediedækningen? Og derefter; hvordan sikrer vi at tech-giganterne. Facebook og andre. Begynder at påtage sig et større demokratisk ansvar? Den opgave og mange andre går vi nu for alvor i gang med at løse. --- Danmark er et fantastisk land. Jeg er så stolt over, hvordan vi håndterede det, der skulle vise sig at være den værste krise siden krigen. Jeg er stolt over at stå i spidsen for et land, hvor ligegyldighed for andre fortrænges til fordel for ansvarlighed, omsorg og fællesskab. Jeg er stolt over de konkrete resultater. En samtykkebaseret voldtægtslov. En sociallovgivning med flere rettigheder til de mest udsatte børn. Pensionen til Arne. Og jeg er stolt af vores parti. I 150 år har vi kæmpet for retfærdighed, udvikling og frihed. I dag er vi danskernes foretrukne parti, og vi nyder mange menneskers tillid og opbakning. Den tillid svigter vi aldrig. Tak.
topics_EN: Mette Frederiksen speak at the Social Democracy Congress
speeches_EN: Dear everyone here in the hall. Dear you who look away from home. Dear Social Democrats. Dear All. A short time ago, the first part of the UN's sixth climate report was published. We knew full well that the climate crisis is our generation's biggest challenge. But the report is still bleak reading. Climate change will happen faster than we thought. The consequences are greater than we thought. And development is becoming more difficult to limit than we thought. Climate change is not a distant nightmare. They are here right now - and it will only get worse. Higher temperatures. The ice that melts. The water level that rises. The desert that spreads. Forest fires in some places. Most recently in Greece. A few years ago in Australia. Elsewhere rain in quantities we haven't seen before. In Germany. In the summer. Whole districts were washed away. We feel the rapid changes in the weather. It is not only the polar bear in the north that loses its natural living conditions. Also, many people in the future cannot stay where they have lived for generations. We live on a globe that changes with a devastating haste. The climate crisis requires political action. Green energy, research, cars, eating habits. But most important of all. It starts and ends with responsibility. Whether we are ready to see ourselves as part of the natural basis. Accept that the animals, plants and the air we live on are nothing other than ourselves. But on the contrary, a condition of our continued existence. And whether we are ready to accept the conclusion: that we must live, consume and transport ourselves so that we look after the globe and each other. And we need to use the globe's resources with respect for those who come after us. It shouldn't really be that hard. After all, it's our own children and grandchildren. We need to take responsibility. Each. And especially together. With the change of government, brand new ambitions came into the legislation. Denmark is one of the countries in the world that wants the most for the climate. In the shortest time. I believe in the Danish strategy. An ambitious, green transition carried by a broad popular support. Thank you. --- that by 2030 we will have to emit 70 per cent. Less is our constant clues. Therefore, in a few years we have presented proposals and made important decisions that bring us almost half the road. I am glad that right now we have a political majority in Christiansborg who are able to make the difficult decisions. With the UN Climate Panel report IPCC, it is clear that even the countries that have come a long way. Have to do more than they do today. The same goes for Denmark. We know we are not in the finish yet. We have now set a final date for the production of oil and gas in the North Sea in 2050. We are in the process of extensive electrification of Denmark. Our electricity generation must be green. We establish two new energy islands. We have decided a marked change of fleet. 775,000 green cars. Least. A uniform CO2 tax. With the goal of becoming more expensive to produce and consume black and cheaper to produce and consume green. And agriculture. Yes, agriculture must also join. We live in one of the most intensively cultivated countries in the world. In Denmark we produce foods that can feed almost 3 times as many people as we ourselves are. It creates exports and lots of jobs. It also gives us an even greater responsibility to actually look after the climate and nature. Now the political negotiations on agriculture are entering its final phase. And let me do it clear today: Agriculture must - of course - be covered by a binding reduction target. --- I am proud of how far we have come in Denmark. And I am proud that Denmark provides the solutions that the rest of the world demands. The globe around there are Danish wind turbines, Danish design, pumps, water systems and windows. Think that Denmark is the first country in the world to enter into a green strategic partnership with India. We have a lot to contribute when 1.3 billion Indians must consume green electricity, build green and have access to clean drinking water. In a little more than a month, the world's leaders will meet for COP26 in Scotland. Now is the time to be traded. The rich countries must deliver on their promises. The large emerging economies need to lift more. The Danish government will work intensively to promote an ambitious result in Glasgow. Among other things, I myself travel to New York tomorrow in connection with the UN General Assembly to attend a global climate summit. We went to the election that Denmark should again be a green superpower. We deliver that now. At the same time, we are getting ready for the next big decisions. Just over a week ago, the government presented our big reform proposal: Denmark can more I. Here, too, climate plays a role. We lower the electricity tax so that power - which in a few years will be 100 per cent. Green - becomes cheaper. We set aside a billion a year for additional climate investments. As something new, we suggest that Denmark should have 3 brand new, hypermodern and truly attractive climatic schools. And here a special greeting to you who are young: If you dream of a sustainable food production in Denmark and to work with crops in an environmentally and climate-friendly way- here is an educational path for you. If you dream of circular economy and to build and renovate housing with old recycled material, geothermal heat and pure energy - here's an educational path for you. And if you dream of a modern district heating system filled with new green solutions. To put wind turbines up on the sea. To produce waste systems without resource load - here is an educational path for you. The young people have shown us others that the climate must be at the top of Danish politics. It's you. And these are Danish employees. Researchers. Self -employed. Creative. Entrepreneurs. Pension funds. Business leaders. Everyday activists. It is you who create the green winds of change. Give them a big hand. --- The government has presented 10 progress for Denmark for the next 10 years. A greener Denmark is one of them. Common is a renewed belief that politics matters. When we can fight a global pandemic. Because we decide on it. Then there is so much else we can too. It has made some people say that we are powerful. But there is one thing that is for sure. One cannot fight the climate crisis. You can't tackle the big challenges. If one is powerless. Call it what you want. Social Democrats. We are never afraid to take responsibility. Not at all in crises. The corona crisis has taught us that there is always a choice. When the pandemic hit with extreme strength - we faced a fateful decision. We could let the pandemic rage. Take his victims. Both in human life and unemployment. We chose the opposite. Each one set aside our own needs. Stayed home. Kept distance. Got control of the infection. The necessary infrastructure for protective equipment, testing and vaccines was built. A united Folketing adopted historically large relief packages. Introduced salary compensation. Trade union movement and employers joined. Took responsibility through 17 tripartite agreements. On a day like today I can say it as it is: We led expansive, social democratic crisis policy. That's what we did. Not with those words. But with that content. And the result? You can see that when you look around Denmark. We kept unemployment down. The same with the bankruptcies. And because we never shut down private industrial production, there is now full steam on both consumption and exports. We are in control of the debt. Danish economy is durable. And employment? It has never been higher. We now expect the highest growth in 15 years. Not for 5 years, not for 10 years - but for 15 years. We have an impressively talented business community. For almost 150 years, the Social Democracy has been on the same page as Danish workers and employees. For the next 150 years. There we are on the same page as both employees and businesses! Thanks to all of Denmark for your efforts. For what you chose to do without the common good. Thanks to the young people who looked after the elderly. Thank you to all of you who went an extra kilometer so that we could together save lives and get ourselves so strongly through the crisis. And thanks to you here in the hall. It was me who stood with the ultimate responsibility of the darkest weeks and months. You were there. You backed up. And not once should I defend the government internally here in the Social Democracy. We got the work peace to lift that responsibility. To stand firm when needed. Dear Congress. You need to know how grateful I am for it. --- It is our expectation that the most serious phase in the corona crisis is now behind us. The vast majority of Danes have been vaccinated. We have a strong epidemic control. Therefore, Denmark is open. Everyday life is back. And now stop where we missed it! With a roaring economy on the bottom line, we can now seriously lift our eyes and look forward. Denmark can do more. We need more. First of all, we need to invest more in education. We all need to become more proficient. Therefore, we suggest a significant boost of education. To afford it, there is something we must do without. Therefore, we suggest tightening the graduates. So you don't go into performance in the moment you finish your studies and don't have a job. We also propose to introduce a 37-hour work obligation to people who are not integrated in Denmark. And yes, let's just take the value question right away. As a society, we are deeply dependent on each other. During the crisis we saw it very concrete. But this also applies in non-crisis times. The universal welfare society with free and equal access to both health and education can only be connected if all adults go to work as a starting point. I mean by all my heart that it is always better to have a job than not to have a job. And I mean by all my Social Democratic heart that all people are connected and committed. To contribute everything we each can. On the other hand, society - and businesses - also has a responsibility for those who need care and a special framework to be in a workplace. And we have a responsibility for those who would like to work, but who are unfortunately too sick for it. They are entitled to our everyone's respect and help. This is why it is so crucial that those who can work also go to work. This is how it is for most people. Of course. But some special women with non-western backgrounds live on passive support. It's unsustainable. For the integration. For their children. And for the Danish economy. And for the cohesion. I meet a lot of people with immigrant backgrounds who, every single day - or night - knuckle. For themselves, for their children and for Denmark. Many of them then have an expectation that everyone else is doing the same. Therefore, a new work obligation for citizens with an integration need. The best thing, of course, is that you get a very ordinary job. But if you do not succeed right away, then in the future you will have to work 37 hours a week for your service. I know some mayors are critical of this proposal. I also know that there will probably be practical difficulties. But if we just raise our gaze sometime. And that is what is our task as Social Democrats. Unfortunately, it is a fact that over the past four decades more people have come to this than what integration could have been. Many contribute positively. Going to work. Educates. But there are too many who do not. The crime is too high. So is the social control. And too many do not go to work. Over the years we have gained better control of the number and influx. It remains crucial. But it can't stand alone. Everyone who is in Denmark must contribute positively. Also to the social economy. This year, the Social Democracy is celebrating its 150th anniversary. Congratulations on an impressive story and travel. To the brave who then went ahead. Those who expanded and to you who lift the responsibility today. From the beginning we have gathered under the red tab. Sung with Oskar Hansen's songs and fought for the values ​​that have changed in the wording, but never in depth. At the same time, one of the values ​​is one of the most important explanations that Denmark is one of the best countries to live in. Namely: Do your duty. And require your right. In that order. A value that brought together Denmark and that should continue to gather us. A value that everyone can live. If we will. --- When we tighten the rules of graduates, introduce a work obligation, raise the tax at the top of society and reschedule business support-yes, we can afford other important things. Then we can afford to invest $ 2.5 billion in the future. DKK per year in education. Per year! In addition, this government has already removed the re -prioritization contribution. Abolished the education ceiling. Added funds to primary school. Lifted the taximeters of youth education. And ensured a better distribution of education throughout the country. I think most people are thinking about how much we actually invest in young people and in education. And therefore an invitation. To students and students. Teachers. Leaders. And yes, too for business. Make your suggestions on how to create the biggest change. Help prioritize. Choose to - and from. So the billions we can invest in the future are going to make a real difference. Education is not the only thing we can afford if a political majority takes responsibility for funding. We can create a new and lasting green space. And we can do something that I know a lot of people are on their mind. Both here in the hall and out in the living rooms. A concrete proposal that will give a number of Danish families significantly more money between the hands. Namely, you who are on early, senior or public pension. Which has a partner with a work income. Which may mean that you are being pulled in pension. We are now proposing to abolish the set -off rules. It makes it more attractive for your partner to take an extra chance. And it makes your pension more worthwhile. We also propose to strengthen our unique social model. Good agreements. High organization degree. It provides security and flexibility. But today the difference between wages and unemployment benefit has become too great. Many people experience a great decline in their monthly benefit if they lose their work. Therefore, we suggest raising the unemployment benefit for the first 3 months for people who have been in work and an a-box for a long time. Puts in all this together. Then we have the opportunity. For a richer, greener and more proficient Denmark. For a development where we can afford to invest in what we want more of. It is possible to pursue politics that are both financially responsible and social justice. We prove that now. We show that now. And as we said this summer: We are not going home. We need to move on. --- let me mention here 3 things. Decentralization. Security policy. Spirit and soul. Everyone knows that we Social Democrats are very concerned with decentralization. Therefore, the government is well in the process of making decisions that will create a better balance in Denmark. So the areas that have lost many of their natural social functions get some of them back. That the violent centralization is now finally challenged. An equalization reform that ensures stability and predictability of the local economy. It is good for welfare locally. A large infrastructure agreement that creates greater coherence and less congestion. Not least: 20 new local police stations. I myself recently visited the upcoming local police in Struer. The city is happy. So is the local commercial life. Not to mention those who work with vulnerable young people. They are really happy. It makes good sense. It is my clear conviction that uniformed police in several places in Denmark provide security. And preventing. And the next round is in progress. New education in cities such as Hjørring, Holstebro, Esbjerg, Svendborg and in Næstved. 8 new tax centers and a thousand local jobs. Better loan options in the parts of Denmark, where it can otherwise be difficult to find financing for a home. The centralization of Denmark has been going on for many years. And it is such a strong community development. Or community settlement that it can't just be changed. We know it's a long cool move. We have started. And we continue. But there are a few things I want to emphasize. Our desire for a more decentralized Denmark is not the conflict between the capital and the province, as it is often articulated as. Let me give an example. I know how much it means to Struer with a local police. But do you know what? It means much on Amager. Here, too, the police are shut down. Now we bring it back. Security and prevention. Because the local officers know the vulnerable families. They know what little brothers to keep an eye on. The strong power of centralization is seen in the countryside. But it is also seen in the city. That applies to the police. And when it's about health. There has been some focus on the lack of doctors in, for example, North Jutland. And on Lolland. But doctors are also missing from the Copenhagen West Bank. So when we talk about a Denmark that is closer in the Social Democracy. Then it applies between the regions. Across the small and big belt. But this also applies in the capital. Copenhagen is a fantastic city. The harbor you can bathe in. The culture. Architecture. The relaxed atmosphere. The bike paths. Dear Denmark. There is reason to be proud of our capital! But there are also some very specific problems that we will solve. In Copenhagen and Frederiksberg there are missing football fields and swimming pools. I get around Denmark a lot. And can see the differences. I think many Jews will be surprised to see how little space is for the kids in Copenhagen. Therefore, investing in new sports facilities must be invested. And although Copenhagen is a city that, unlike many other major cities, still houses its own population with life and housing in the middle of the city. Then it is also true that it has become more difficult for people with ordinary incomes to buy a home. Therefore, the government will present a housing proposal to secure more homes that are actually paying. When the Folketing opens, we will also make our proposals for a welfare law. The Welfare Act must ensure that the money follows when more children and the elderly arrive. Actually, one would think it gave itself. But it was not always so. There was a time when another political majority would rather have money for tax cuts than secure a bottom under welfare. Everything in our welfare is not about money. Far from. But it is not possible if kindergartens, nursing homes and hospitals have to start every year with cutting back. When we Social Democrats went to election to introduce a welfare law. Then it was called "airy talk" by the left. Still, the Left claimed that the shame would also prioritize welfare ... Dear Left. If you mean the great words from that time. So vote for the Welfare Act when it comes to a vote in the Folketing. --- For more than 2 years, Denmark has had a new political majority. Thanks. To Sofie. To Pia. And to Mai. For close and trusting cooperation. For your efforts for Denmark. For your burning commitment. And yes, for your impatience. We do not always agree. But step by step we pull Denmark in a fairer direction. Exactly as we agreed with each other in the understanding paper. It also means who is leading our municipalities and regions. 46 mayors are Social Democrats. 4 regional chairmen are Social Democrats. We are the only party represented in all the municipalities in the country. Almost 4 years ago we got a great choice. Better than we had hoped for at all. We became Denmark's largest party. We regained the 4 big cities. We won 13 new mayoral posts. More than 3 million Danes today have a Social Democratic mayor. More than 4 million Danes have a Social Democratic regional chairman. It is a great responsibility. It commits. November 16, you will be voters for municipal and regional council elections. Here we will again ask for your confidence. Dear Congress. Give our candidates a hand! --- from local politics to foreign policy. The situation in Afghanistan is tragic and has made a huge impression on us all. I dread for the future of Afghanistan's girls and women. Whether they will again disappear from the folding field, schools, universities and from the murals and in behind the Burka's blue prison walls. Denmark, Europe and the world community must ensure the humanitarian assistance that the Afghan population needs. And we have to put the hardest possible pressure on the Taliban. Use both development assistance and foreign policy to fight for human rights. At the same time, we must be proud of all the brave Danish women and men who have brought great victims of broadcasts over the years. They are the ones who have fought for the freedom and security of others. It was right to go into Afghanistan. It was the only decision we could make when the United States was attacked. In NATO, we activated the musketeer for the first time. And responded collectively and together. At the counter-attack on al-Qaeda and on the regime that housed terrorists. After 20 years of efforts, many discussions will occur. It is both understandable and necessary. But I would like to highlight 2 things. In the future, we will also need to hit hard against militant Islamism. And the alliance with Americans remains crucial. Terrorism has a good grip on our world. We saw this at home in 2015. We have seen it in many European countries. In Sri Lanka. In Nairobi. And the conflicts in the Middle East. When we are attacked. Because we are free. Democratic. Western. Equals. Then we answer again. Otherwise, we cannot live up to what is the most important thing for a government: to look after its own population and its country. We can only ensure freedom. Safety. And security. If Europe and the United States continue to be each other's closest. The transatlantic alliance, which was built in World War II, has been the Danes' guarantee of security and security for more than 70 years. Denmark will always live up to our international responsibility. --- my speech and my political account are nearing its end. Reforms, education, foreign policy, climate, security and welfare. Eventually a few words about what the eye can't always see. Our language, traditions, art and culture. The Social Society of the Danes. Our social mind. Is the most important single explanation that we have come through the crisis so well. We don't care about each other. We are connected. Feeling connected. It has such a great value. Greater than almost everything else. The connection between us does not come by itself. It is created by, and in what we share. When community singing becomes common language. The experiences we share in the sport. The curiosity that is awakened in the visual arts. The memory that is filmed. The empathy we get from the sublime literature. Danish art and culture together with us, as a performing or listening and seeing, creates everything we share. It was the Social Democracy that created the Ministry of Culture. We gave the art and culture a special place in the political engine room. We are ready to lift that obligation. Now I talked about education before. But in many ways, it is the last half of the word that is one of the most important. Formation. That we each strive to never end our own journey towards immersing ourselves, becoming wiser and being curious about other people, and what is unknown. We are facing negotiating a new media agreement. Here it can quickly be to only be about support crowns for one or the other media. There is a discussion that is even more important. What is the role of the media today? How do they best contribute to formation? For curiosity? To develop our democracy? To facilitate a public conversation between enlightened people? How do we ensure proportionality in media coverage? And then; How do we ensure that the tech giants. Facebook and others. Starting to assume a greater democratic responsibility? We are now in the process of solving this task and many others. --- Denmark is a fantastic country. I am so proud of how we handled what should turn out to be the worst crisis since the war. I am proud to be at the forefront of a country where indifference to others is displaced in favor of accountability, care and community. I am proud of the concrete results. A consent -based rape law. Social legislation with multiple rights to the most vulnerable children. The pension to Arne. And I'm proud of our party. For 150 years we have fought for justice, development and freedom. Today we are the Danes' favorite party and we enjoy many people's confidence and support. We never fail that confidence. Thanks.

topics_dk: Mette Frederiksens tale ved flagdagen for Danmarks udsendte
speeches_dk: Deres kongelige højheder. Kære pårørende. Kære udsendte. Kære veteraner.  Siden 1948 har omkring 60.000 af vores bedste mænd og kvinder været udsendt i Danmarks tjeneste. I her på pladsen. Jer, som vi hylder i dag. Står skulder ved skulder i den lange og ubrydelige kæde af stærke og modige udsendte. Det er jer, der gør det muligt for Danmark – at tage ansvar for danske værdier ude i verden. Vi herhjemme kan sætte en retning. Det er jer, der gør den helt konkrete forskel.  For mennesker ude i verden. For os herhjemme. For Danmark. Lige nu oplever vi en dybt ulykkelig situation efter næsten tyve års internationalt engagement i Afghanistan. En katastrofe. For Afghanistan. For afghanerne. For piger. For kvinder. For os alle. De billeder, vi ser. De historier, vi hører. Det er så brutalt. Og forkert. Og smerteligt. Særligt for jer, der selv har været udsendt. Nogle af jer er vendt stærkere hjem, end I tog ud. Modnet af ansvar og erfaring. Andre er kommet hjem med ar på krop eller på sjæl. En særlig tanke skal i dag gå til jer, hvor de frygtelige billeder og historier fra Afghanistan kan rive op i gamle sår. Ingen af jer er glemt. Bag hver udsendt. Bag hver veteran. Står de pårørende. Derfor vil jeg sige til jeres børn. Ægtefæller. Forældre. Søskende: Danmark skylder jer en særlig tak. Jeg kan godt huske min mors bekymrede blik, da min egen storebror var udsendt. Især rædslen, hvis der uventet blev banket på døren. Min bror kom hjem igen. Men det gjorde alle ikke. I år vil og skal vi særligt mindes dem, der ikke kom hjem fra Afghanistan. Ord kan ikke lindre smerten hos jer, der sidder tilbage med det tunge savn. Det ved jeg. Mit hjerte græder. Må I – smerten til trods – være stolte af jeres søn eller datter. Af jeres bror eller søster. Ægtefælle. Forældre. Af jeres ven. Må Danmark være stolt. Og må vi aldrig glemme. I lyset af de seneste ugers ulykkelige udvikling – rejser sig der sig uundgåelige spørgsmål. Og jeg hører det igen og igen: Var tyve års indsats det hele værd? Jeg kan selvfølgelig godt forstå, at tvivlen melder sig, når man kigger på Afghanistan i disse dage. Og ingen forstår helt, tror jeg, hvor smerteligt det er i mange gode danske familier. Jeg vil sige til alle jer, der henover årene har arbejdet, kæmpet og bragt store ofre i Afghanistan. I har, hver enkelt af jer, bidraget til den nødvendige kamp mod terrorisme. I har været med til at sikre andres sikkerhed – i Danmark og hos vores allierede.  I har ydet jeres til, at en hårdt prøvet afghansk befolkning i en periode har oplevet noget af den frihed og det liv, som alle mennesker på jordkloden bør have. En ny generation er vokset op med skolegang, lægehjælp, pigers rettigheder, kvinders rettigheder. I har vist, at der er en anden vej. Et andet liv. Det håb kan ingen tage fra afghanerne igen. Kampen mod terrorisme og for frihed. Det er den kamp, I har kæmpet. Den kamp har ikke været forgæves. Det siger jeg, fordi jeg som landets statsminister mener det. Men jeg har også lovet at sige det på vegne af nogle af de veteraner og pårørende, jeg har talt med i den seneste tid. På vegne af mange af de veteraner og pårørende, jeg har lyttet til. Jeg har også lovet at sige, at mange er klar til at tage af sted igen. Og jeg har lovet at sige, at andre er i tvivl om både det, der er sket. Og det, der måtte ske i fremtiden. Fordi verden hverken er sort eller hvid. En ting er jeg ikke selv i tvivl om. Når vi inde på Christiansborg og i medierne diskuterer Danmarks krigsdeltagelse, så bør det, og så skal det, ske på en mere respektfuld måde end det, jeg synes jeg oplever lige nu. For de faldne, for dem, der overlevede. For dem der stadig er klar til at tage ud med Dannebrog på skulderen. For deres familier. Ordentlighed og respekt. Det er det mindste, vi andre kan udvise. Lad os gøre det. Ordentlighed og respekt. Derfor vil jeg også i dag rette en særlig tak til jer, der har bistået med evakueringen fra Kabul under stadigt mere vanskelige vilkår. Danmark har i kraft af jeres store indsats evakueret hundredevis af mennesker fra et Afghanistan i opløsning. Danske statsborgere. Tolke. Lokalt ansatte. Familier. Menneskerettighedsforkæmpere. Og oven i det været i stand til at hjælpe vores allierede med deres evakuering. Det er en stor bedrift i en uhyre vanskelig situation. Den virkelighed, som vores udsendte fra Forsvaret og Udenrigsministeriet har arbejdet under, har været både ekstrem svær. Og menneskeligt nærmest umulig. Og jeg bliver nødt til i dag at rette endnu en appel. Når Danmarks udsendte står i verdens brændpunkt med andres menneskers liv og død mellem hænderne, så skal de have arbejdsro, og de skal have fuldstændig opbakning. Det fortjener I. Jeg er stolt af jer. De seneste ugers udvikling giver naturligvis anledning til refleksion. Der er svære overvejelser foran os. Og sikkert også svære drøftelser. Men for mig er spørgsmålet ikke, om Danmark skal tage ansvar. Men hvordan vi gør det bedst. Danmark er og skal være et aktivt og stolt medlem af verdenssamfundet. Vi tager et vigtigt ansvar mange steder i verden. Takket være jer, der står her i dag. Nogle af jer, der er her på pladsen i dag, har været på afgørende patruljer i Hormuz-strædet. Danmark er en stolt søfartsnation. I er med til at sikre den frie sejlads, vi er så afhængige af. Andre af jer er soldater og politifolk, som har samarbejdet ved den europæiske grænse- og kystbevogtning. I har bjærget mennesker, som usle bagmænd sendte ud på overfyldte både. I, som er fra flyvevåbnet, har taget del i missioner i Irak. Levet med at ”være i shelter” med pulsen oppe hver gang. I, der er læger og sygeplejesker, har hjulpet verden under coronakrisen. Humanitær støtte i Sudan. Bistand efter den voldsomme eksplosion på havnen i Beirut sidste år. Etablering af lejre i Grækenland. Soldater. Læger. Sygeplejersker. Rådgivere. Politifolk. Beredskabsfolk. Udenrigsministeriets udsendte. Og alle I andre.  Der står stor respekt om Danmarks rolle i verden. Det er i høj grad jeres fortjeneste. Og derfor er det med stor ydmyghed, at jeg står foran jer i dag. I har Danmarks opbakning. På vegne af alle i Danmark vil jeg sige til hver og en af jer: Af hjertet tak.
topics_EN: Mette Frederiksen's speech at the flag day of Denmark's broadcast
speeches_EN: Their royal highness. Dear relatives. Dear broadcast. Dear Veterans. Since 1948, about 60,000 of our best men and women have been posted in Denmark's service. In here in the square. You that we pay tribute to today. Stands shoulder to shoulder in the long and unbreakable chain of strong and brave emissaries. It is you who enable Denmark - to take responsibility for Danish values ​​around the world. We at home can set a direction. It is you who make the very specific difference. For people out in the world. For us at home. For Denmark. Right now, we are experiencing a deeply unhappy situation after almost twenty years of international commitment to Afghanistan. A disaster. For Afghanistan. For the Afghans. For girls. For women. For all of us. The pictures we see. The stories we hear. It's so brutal. And wrong. And painful. Especially for you who have been posted themselves. Some of you have turned stronger home than you took out. Matured by responsibility and experience. Others have come home with scars on body or on soul. Today, a special thought should go to you where the terrible pictures and stories from Afghanistan can tear up old wounds. None of you are forgotten. Behind each posted. Behind each veteran. Stands the relatives. That's why I want to say to your children. Spouses. Parents. Siblings: Denmark owes you a special thank you.
