I remember my mother's worried gaze when my own big brother was posted. Especially the horror if unexpectedly knocked on the door. My brother came home again. But everyone didn't. This year we will and will be particularly reminded of those who did not come home from Afghanistan. Words cannot relieve the pain of you who are left with the heavy need. I know. My heart is crying. May you - the pain despite - be proud of your son or daughter. Of your brother or sister. Spouse. Parents. Of your friend. May Denmark be proud. And must we never forget. In light of the unhappy development of recent weeks - there are inevitable questions. And I hear it over and over again: Was twenty years of effort all worth it? Of course, I can understand that the doubt is signing up when looking at Afghanistan these days. And no one understands completely, I think how painful it is in many good Danish families. I will say to all of you who have worked, fought and brought great victims in Afghanistan over the years. You have, each of you, contributed to the necessary fight against terrorism. You have helped ensure the safety of others - in Denmark and with our allies. You have given you to the fact that a hard -tried Afghan population has for a period experienced some of the freedom and life that all people on the globe should have. A new generation has grown up with schooling, medical attention, girls' rights, women's rights. You have shown that there is another way. Another life. No one can take that hope from the Afghans again. The fight against terrorism and for freedom. That's the struggle you've fought. That fight has not been in vain. I say that because, as the country's prime minister, I mean it. But I have also promised to say it on behalf of some of the veterans and relatives I have been talking to lately. On behalf of many of the veterans and relatives I have listened to. I have also promised to say that many are ready to leave again. And I have promised to say that others are in doubt about both what has happened. And what had to happen in the future. Because the world is neither black nor white. One thing I myself have no doubt. When we at Christiansborg and the media discuss the participation of Denmark, then it should, and then it should happen in a more respectful way than what I think I experience right now. For the fallen, for those who survived. For those who are still ready to go out with Dannebrog on the shoulder. For their families. Decency and respect. That's the least we others can expel. Let's do it. Decency and respect. Therefore, today I would also like to thank you a special thank you to you who have assisted with the evacuation from Kabul under increasingly difficult conditions. Due to your great efforts, Denmark has evacuated hundreds of people from an Afghanistan in disarray. Danish citizens. Interpret. Local employees. Families. Human rights defenders. And on top of that, it has been able to help our allies with their evacuation. It is a great achievement in an extremely difficult situation. The reality under which our emissary from the Defense and the Ministry of Foreign Affairs has been working has been both extremely difficult. And humanly almost impossible. And I will have to fix another appeal today. When Denmark's emissary stands at the world of the world with the lives and deaths of others between their hands, then they must have work and they must have complete support. IT deserves I. I am proud of you. Of course, the development of recent weeks gives rise to reflection. There are difficult considerations ahead of us. And probably also difficult discussions. But for me, the question is not whether Denmark should take responsibility. But how we do it best. Denmark is and must be an active and proud member of the world community. We take an important responsibility in many places in the world. Thanks to you standing here today. Some of you who are here in the square today have been on crucial patrols in the Hormuz Strait. Denmark is a proud maritime nation. You help ensure the free sailing we are so dependent on. Others of you are soldiers and police officers who have cooperated at the European border and coast guard. You have salvaged people who, poor bakers, sent out overcrowded boats. I, who are from the Air Force, have taken part in missions in Iraq. Lived by "being in shelter" with the pulse up every time. In, who are doctors and nurses, have helped the world during the corona crisis. Humanitarian support in Sudan. Assistance after the violent explosion at the port of Beirut last year. Establishment of camps in Greece. Soldiers. Doctors. Nurses. Advisors. Police. Emergency personnel. The Ministry of Foreign Affairs' emissary. And everyone in others. There is great respect for Denmark's role in the world. It is to a great extent your profits. And that is why it is with great humility that I am in front of you today. You have Denmark's support. On behalf of all in Denmark I will say to every and one of you: by heart please.

topics_dk: Mette Frederiksens tale ved parade for Danmarks udsendte
speeches_dk: Deres kongelige højheder. Kære pårørende. Kære udsendte. Kære veteraner.  Siden 1948 har omkring 60.000 af vores bedste mænd og kvinder været udsendt i Danmarks tjeneste. I her på pladsen. Jer, som vi hylder i dag. Står skulder ved skulder i den lange og ubrydelige kæde af stærke og modige udsendte. Det er jer, der gør det muligt for Danmark – at tage ansvar for danske værdier ude i verden. Vi herhjemme kan sætte en retning. Det er jer, der gør den helt konkrete forskel.  For mennesker ude i verden. For os herhjemme. For Danmark. Lige nu oplever vi en dybt ulykkelig situation efter næsten tyve års internationalt engagement i Afghanistan. En katastrofe. For Afghanistan. For afghanerne. For piger. For kvinder. For os alle. De billeder, vi ser. De historier, vi hører. Det er så brutalt. Og forkert. Og smerteligt. Særligt for jer, der selv har været udsendt. Nogle af jer er vendt stærkere hjem, end I tog ud. Modnet af ansvar og erfaring. Andre er kommet hjem med ar på krop eller på sjæl. En særlig tanke skal i dag gå til jer, hvor de frygtelige billeder og historier fra Afghanistan kan rive op i gamle sår. Ingen af jer er glemt. Bag hver udsendt. Bag hver veteran. Står de pårørende. Derfor vil jeg sige til jeres børn. Ægtefæller. Forældre. Søskende: Danmark skylder jer en særlig tak. Jeg kan godt huske min mors bekymrede blik, da min egen storebror var udsendt. Især rædslen, hvis der uventet blev banket på døren. Min bror kom hjem igen. Men det gjorde alle ikke. I år vil og skal vi særligt mindes dem, der ikke kom hjem fra Afghanistan. Ord kan ikke lindre smerten hos jer, der sidder tilbage med det tunge savn. Det ved jeg. Mit hjerte græder. Må I – smerten til trods – være stolte af jeres søn eller datter. Af jeres bror eller søster. Ægtefælle. Forældre. Af jeres ven. Må Danmark være stolt. Og må vi aldrig glemme. I lyset af de seneste ugers ulykkelige udvikling – rejser sig der sig uundgåelige spørgsmål. Og jeg hører det igen og igen: Var tyve års indsats det hele værd? Jeg kan selvfølgelig godt forstå, at tvivlen melder sig, når man kigger på Afghanistan i disse dage. Og ingen forstår helt, tror jeg, hvor smerteligt det er i mange gode danske familier. Jeg vil sige til alle jer, der henover årene har arbejdet, kæmpet og bragt store ofre i Afghanistan. I har, hver enkelt af jer, bidraget til den nødvendige kamp mod terrorisme. I har været med til at sikre andres sikkerhed – i Danmark og hos vores allierede.  I har ydet jeres til, at en hårdt prøvet afghansk befolkning i en periode har oplevet noget af den frihed og det liv, som alle mennesker på jordkloden bør have. En ny generation er vokset op med skolegang, lægehjælp, pigers rettigheder, kvinders rettigheder. I har vist, at der er en anden vej. Et andet liv. Det håb kan ingen tage fra afghanerne igen. Kampen mod terrorisme og for frihed. Det er den kamp, I har kæmpet. Den kamp har ikke været forgæves. Det siger jeg, fordi jeg som landets statsminister mener det. Men jeg har også lovet at sige det på vegne af nogle af de veteraner og pårørende, jeg har talt med i den seneste tid. På vegne af mange af de veteraner og pårørende, jeg har lyttet til. Jeg har også lovet at sige, at mange er klar til at tage af sted igen. Og jeg har lovet at sige, at andre er i tvivl om både det, der er sket. Og det, der måtte ske i fremtiden. Fordi verden hverken er sort eller hvid. En ting er jeg ikke selv i tvivl om. Når vi inde på Christiansborg og i medierne diskuterer Danmarks krigsdeltagelse, så bør det, og så skal det, ske på en mere respektfuld måde end det, jeg synes jeg oplever lige nu. For de faldne, for dem, der overlevede. For dem der stadig er klar til at tage ud med Dannebrog på skulderen. For deres familier. Ordentlighed og respekt. Det er det mindste, vi andre kan udvise. Lad os gøre det. Ordentlighed og respekt. Derfor vil jeg også i dag rette en særlig tak til jer, der har bistået med evakueringen fra Kabul under stadigt mere vanskelige vilkår. Danmark har i kraft af jeres store indsats evakueret hundredevis af mennesker fra et Afghanistan i opløsning. Danske statsborgere. Tolke. Lokalt ansatte. Familier. Menneskerettighedsforkæmpere. Og oven i det været i stand til at hjælpe vores allierede med deres evakuering. Det er en stor bedrift i en uhyre vanskelig situation. Den virkelighed, som vores udsendte fra Forsvaret og Udenrigsministeriet har arbejdet under, har været både ekstrem svær. Og menneskeligt nærmest umulig. Og jeg bliver nødt til i dag at rette endnu en appel. Når Danmarks udsendte står i verdens brændpunkt med andres menneskers liv og død mellem hænderne, så skal de have arbejdsro, og de skal have fuldstændig opbakning. Det fortjener I. Jeg er stolt af jer. De seneste ugers udvikling giver naturligvis anledning til refleksion. Der er svære overvejelser foran os. Og sikkert også svære drøftelser. Men for mig er spørgsmålet ikke, om Danmark skal tage ansvar. Men hvordan vi gør det bedst. Danmark er og skal være et aktivt og stolt medlem af verdenssamfundet. Vi tager et vigtigt ansvar mange steder i verden. Takket være jer, der står her i dag. Nogle af jer, der er her på pladsen i dag, har været på afgørende patruljer i Hormuz-strædet. Danmark er en stolt søfartsnation. I er med til at sikre den frie sejlads, vi er så afhængige af. Andre af jer er soldater og politifolk, som har samarbejdet ved den europæiske grænse- og kystbevogtning. I har bjærget mennesker, som usle bagmænd sendte ud på overfyldte både. I, som er fra flyvevåbnet, har taget del i missioner i Irak. Levet med at ”være i shelter” med pulsen oppe hver gang. I, der er læger og sygeplejesker, har hjulpet verden under coronakrisen. Humanitær støtte i Sudan. Bistand efter den voldsomme eksplosion på havnen i Beirut sidste år. Etablering af lejre i Grækenland. Soldater. Læger. Sygeplejersker. Rådgivere. Politifolk. Beredskabsfolk. Udenrigsministeriets udsendte. Og alle I andre.  Der står stor respekt om Danmarks rolle i verden. Det er i høj grad jeres fortjeneste. Og derfor er det med stor ydmyghed, at jeg står foran jer i dag. I har Danmarks opbakning. På vegne af alle i Danmark vil jeg sige til hver og en af jer: Af hjertet tak.
topics_EN: Mette Frederiksen's speech by parade for Denmark's emissary
speeches_EN: Their royal highness. Dear relatives. Dear broadcast. Dear Veterans. Since 1948, about 60,000 of our best men and women have been posted in Denmark's service. In here in the square. You that we pay tribute to today. Stands shoulder to shoulder in the long and unbreakable chain of strong and brave emissaries. It is you who enable Denmark - to take responsibility for Danish values ​​around the world. We at home can set a direction. It is you who make the very specific difference. For people out in the world. For us at home. For Denmark. Right now, we are experiencing a deeply unhappy situation after almost twenty years of international commitment to Afghanistan. A disaster. For Afghanistan. For the Afghans. For girls. For women. For all of us. The pictures we see. The stories we hear. It's so brutal. And wrong. And painful. Especially for you who have been posted themselves. Some of you have turned stronger home than you took out. Matured by responsibility and experience. Others have come home with scars on body or on soul. Today, a special thought should go to you where the terrible pictures and stories from Afghanistan can tear up old wounds. None of you are forgotten. Behind each posted. Behind each veteran. Stands the relatives. That's why I want to say to your children. Spouses. Parents. Siblings: Denmark owes you a special thank you. I remember my mother's worried gaze when my own big brother was posted. Especially the horror if unexpectedly knocked on the door. My brother came home again. But everyone didn't. This year we will and will be particularly reminded of those who did not come home from Afghanistan. Words cannot relieve the pain of you who are left with the heavy need. I know. My heart is crying. May you - the pain despite - be proud of your son or daughter. Of your brother or sister. Spouse. Parents. Of your friend. May Denmark be proud. And must we never forget. In light of the unhappy development of recent weeks - there are inevitable questions. And I hear it over and over again: Was twenty years of effort all worth it? Of course, I can understand that the doubt is signing up when looking at Afghanistan these days. And no one understands completely, I think how painful it is in many good Danish families. I will say to all of you who have worked, fought and brought great victims in Afghanistan over the years. You have, each of you, contributed to the necessary fight against terrorism. You have helped ensure the safety of others - in Denmark and with our allies. You have given you to the fact that a hard -tried Afghan population has for a period experienced some of the freedom and life that all people on the globe should have. A new generation has grown up with schooling, medical attention, girls' rights, women's rights. You have shown that there is another way. Another life. No one can take that hope from the Afghans again. The fight against terrorism and for freedom. That's the struggle you've fought. That fight has not been in vain. I say that because, as the country's prime minister, I mean it. But I have also promised to say it on behalf of some of the veterans and relatives I have been talking to lately. On behalf of many of the veterans and relatives I have listened to. I have also promised to say that many are ready to leave again. And I have promised to say that others are in doubt about both what has happened. And what had to happen in the future. Because the world is neither black nor white. One thing I myself have no doubt. When we at Christiansborg and the media discuss the participation of Denmark, then it should, and then it should happen in a more respectful way than what I think I experience right now. For the fallen, for those who survived. For those who are still ready to go out with Dannebrog on the shoulder. For their families. Decency and respect. That's the least we others can expel. Let's do it. Decency and respect. Therefore, today I would also like to thank you a special thank you to you who have assisted with the evacuation from Kabul under increasingly difficult conditions. Due to your great efforts, Denmark has evacuated hundreds of people from an Afghanistan in disarray. Danish citizens. Interpret. Local employees. Families. Human rights defenders. And on top of that, it has been able to help our allies with their evacuation. It is a great achievement in an extremely difficult situation. The reality under which our emissary from the Defense and the Ministry of Foreign Affairs has been working has been both extremely difficult. And humanly almost impossible. And I will have to fix another appeal today. When Denmark's emissary stands at the world of the world with the lives and deaths of others between their hands, then they must have work and they must have complete support. IT deserves I. I am proud of you. Of course, the development of recent weeks gives rise to reflection. There are difficult considerations ahead of us. And probably also difficult discussions. But for me, the question is not whether Denmark should take responsibility. But how we do it best. Denmark is and must be an active and proud member of the world community. We take an important responsibility in many places in the world. Thanks to you standing here today. Some of you who are here in the square today have been on crucial patrols in the Hormuz Strait. Denmark is a proud maritime nation. You help ensure the free sailing we are so dependent on. Others of you are soldiers and police officers who have cooperated at the European border and coast guard. You have salvaged people who, poor bakers, sent out overcrowded boats. I, who are from the Air Force, have taken part in missions in Iraq. Lived by "being in shelter" with the pulse up every time. In, who are doctors and nurses, have helped the world during the corona crisis. Humanitarian support in Sudan. Assistance after the violent explosion at the port of Beirut last year. Establishment of camps in Greece. Soldiers. Doctors. Nurses. Advisors. Police. Emergency personnel. The Ministry of Foreign Affairs' emissary. And everyone in others. There is great respect for Denmark's role in the world. It is to a great extent your profits. And that is why it is with great humility that I am in front of you today. You have Denmark's support. On behalf of all in Denmark I will say to every and one of you: by heart please.

topics_dk: Mette Frederiksens tale ved konference om fremtidens Danmark
speeches_dk: Hjertelig velkommen. Og tak, fordi I har ryddet kalenderen en hel dag for at diskutere fremtidens Danmark.  For halvandet års tid siden. I de mørkeste uger. Var jeg ikke sikker på, at vi i august 2021 ville kunne være sammen her i Fredericia – i et Danmark, hvor hverdagen og økonomien var så stærkt på vej tilbage.  Vi sagde, at god og konsekvent epidemihåndtering ville være det bedste for dansk økonomi. Vi vidste ikke, om vi ville få ret. Det fik vi.  Dansk økonomi er tilbage og buldrer derudaf. De fleste er i arbejde igen. Vi står langt stærkere, end vi havde turdet håbe.  Men. Og der er et men. De grundlæggende udfordringer, Danmark stod overfor inden krisen. De er her stadigvæk.  Og de fleste har desværre det til fælles, at vi har talt om dem i årtier. Forsøgt at løse dem. Uden at komme i mål.  Jeg og regeringen har masser af ideer. Også nogle gode af slagsen. Men vi har også vores begrænsninger. Blinde vinkler om man vil.  Når vi nu ikke valgte polariseringen – som folk ikke valgte splittelsen – men valgte fællesskabet som en vej gennem krisen. Hvorfor så ikke se, om vi kan blive enige om, hvilken vej vi skal gå med vores samfund de næste ti år?  Det kræver en bedre demokratisk samtale.   Der er mange ord i dansk politik. Og i det offentlige rum. Men samtale – det er næsten forvundet.  Hvornår har vi sidst hørt en politiker sådan rigtigt give en modstander ret?  Hvis ikke vi snart får gang i samtalen, gør vi os skyldige i, at vi og vores samfund bliver dummere, end vi behøver at være.  Vi har brug for at gøre hinanden klogere. Flytte os. Flytte Danmark.  ”Sagen er nemlig den, at demokratiet aldrig lever i kraft af love og paragraffer. Det lever i og ved levende mennesker.” Sådan skrev Hal Koch i 1945. Dengang skulle Danmark og verden rejse sig efter Anden Verdenskrig.  Nu skal vi videre efter den værste krise siden dengang.  Corona bekræftede styrken i vores samfundsmodel.   En oplyst og viljestærk befolkning, som passer på hinnden. Et konkurrencedygtigt erhvervsliv. En ansvarlig fagbevægelse. Dygtige myndigheder. Omstillingsparate institutioner.  Oveni det har vi en sund økonomi.  Holdbare offentlige finanser. Styr på gælden. Ledigheden har ikke bidt sig fast under krisen.  Og selvom der desværre er brancher, som stadig har det svært. Så er det generelle billede, at dansk økonomi er tilbage på niveauet før pandemien. Beskæftigelsen er rekordhøj. Eksporten vokser. Der er optimisme.  Vi kunne stoppe her. Men Danmark kan mere.  Og vejen fremad er nødt til at være: Reformer. Uddannelse. Flere i arbejde. Vækst. Innovation.  Når jeg ser tilbage, så synes jeg ærlig talt, at vi i de seneste årtier har været for afmægtige over for de store udviklingstendenser.  På den ene side blander vi politikere os i alt. En anekdote, jeg har fortalt før: Da jeg blev beskæftigelsesminister, ville jeg have dagpengelovgivningen med hjem at læse. Men det ville nærmet tage tre døgn at printe den ud og to lastbiler at bringe den ud.    På den anden side har vi nærmest givet op. Over for centralisering. Bureaukratisering. De negative konsekvenser af globaliseringen.  Danskernes reaktion på coronakrisen var i mine øjne det første, største og mest opmuntrende eksempel på det modsatte.  Vi kunne have ladet pandemien rasere vores land. Vi valgte det modsatte.  Når man kan det. Så kan man, hvad man vil.  * * *  Det er vores fælles positive udgangspunkt, når vi nu skal se frem.  Med konferencen i dag vil vi starte en bred debat om fremtidens Danmark.   Hvis nogen af jer forventer konkrete initiativer. Millioner af kroner til gode formål. Så må jeg skuffe jer.  Det kommer ikke i dag.  Vi vil derimod løbende fremlægge store og sammenhængende udspil. Det første inden længe. Andre senere. De kommende års arbejde bliver at reformere Danmark skridt for skridt.  Og i den proces vil vi engagere så mange som muligt i visionen for Danmark om ti år. Jo flere, der er med til at forme vores fremtid, jo bedre bliver den.  Og vi vil bestræbe os på selv at lægge automatreaktionerne væk.  I den publikation, som vi offentliggør i dag, er der flere spørgsmål end svar.  Det er en åben invitation til jer.  * * *  Vi er afhængige af hinanden. Vi har brug for hinanden. Det har pandemien også vist os.  Derfor skal vi se socialpolitikken, uddannelserne og kulturen, arbejdsmarkedet, integrationen, skattepolitik, erhvervspolitik, klimapolitik, sikkerhedspolitik, beredskabet, samfundets sammenhængskraft – det hele samlet.  Vi har opstillet ti fremskridt for Danmark de næste ti år.  De står på skærmen bag mig.  For det første grønnere.  FN’s seneste klimarapport er dyster læsning. Klimakrisen er den største globale udfordring i vor tid.  Klimakrisen skal løses. Det kræver akut handling fra verdenssamfundet. Danmark skal presse på for ambitiøse, bindende klimaaftaler internationalt og i EU.  Vi skal videre herhjemme. Næste stop bliver en ny landbrugsaftale.  Danmark skal gå foran. Den grønne omstilling skaber nye arbejdspladser – ikke færre.   Dermed er det grønne også en vigtig byggeklods til at gøre os rigere – det andet fremskridt. Men kun hvis vi uddanner til de behov virksomhederne har.  Mit bedste bud er, at den største forhindring for, om vi når 70 procent, er en helt anden end den, de fleste peger på.  Vi skal nok træffe de nødvendige beslutninger. Men jeg tror, den største forhindring er, at vi kommer til at mangle de faglærte, der skal få det til at ske i virkeligheden. Hvis ikke vi har elektrikere. Så kommer der ikke vindmøller op.  Digitalisering, ny teknologi, automatisering og grøn omstilling vinder frem og ændrer jobfunktioner, forretningsmodeller og måder at drive virksomhed på.  Det stiller enormt store krav til arbejdsmarkedet.  Det er også en fremtid, der ligger godt for Danmark. Og skaber nye muligheder.  Men hvordan giver vi bedre vilkår til jer virksomheder?  Ikke mindst til de små og mellemstore virksomheder, som står for to ud af tre job i den private sektor?  Og hvordan sikrer vi, at der forskes i mere ude på virksomhederne? Og hvad med risikovillig kapital?  Det tredje fremskridt er dygtigere.  Danskernes rejse gennem uddannelsessystemet er en kæmpe succeshistorie.  Men når jeg skal dvæle ved problemerne. Som jeg har sagt, jeg vil. Så er der også nok at tage fat på.  45.000 unge i alderen 15-24 år, som ikke laver noget. Som hverken har en uddannelse eller et arbejde efter folkeskolen – 45.000.  Det er en kæmpe katastrofe.  Jeg tror ærlig talt, at det tal kommer bag på mange.  Det svarer til, at alle indbyggere her i Fredericia Kommune hverken var i job eller uddannelse. Ikke har noget at stå op til. Vi kan ikke være det bekendt.   Hovedvejen i vores uddannelser er blevet, at de fleste tager en gymnasial uddannelse og derefter en videregående uddannelse.  Men det er faglært arbejdskraft, virksomhederne kommer til at mangle.  Tænk, hvis vi kan få de unges klimaengagement, uddannelserne, produktion og arbejdspladser til at gå op i en højere enhed.  Det leder frem til det næste – Flittigere.  Vi skal arbejde. Flere skal arbejde. Og gerne mere.  Vi skal se arbejde som meget mere end økonomi og forsørgelse. Måske sågar blæse til en ny værdikamp.  At gå på arbejde og tjene sine egne penge skal være et omdrejningspunkt for vores samfund. For kommende reformer. For vores kultur.  Vi har bygget Danmark på arbejde. På at sætte en ære i at arbejde. Værdighed. Selvstændighed. Fællesskab.   Vi må aldrig opgive mennesker, forvente for lidt og stille for få krav.  Det er også min indgang til en ansvarligere integrationspolitik. Der er desværre mange især kvinder med ikke-vestlig baggrund, som ikke har et arbejde at stå op til.  Det problem har regering efter regering erkendt. Men ingen har hidtil formået at løse det.  Det er uholdbart. Eneste rimelige krav er, at kommer man til Danmark, så gør man alt for at lære vores sprog, komme i arbejde, forsørge sig selv og sine børn.  Det sjette fremskridt sikrere har fået en ulykkelig aktualitet med katastrofen i Afghanistan.  En katastrofe, som giver anledning til en bredere refleksion – ikke om vi skal tage ansvar, men hvordan vi skal tage ansvar. Det er en drøftelse, vi skal tage med vores allierede i NATO og i EU.  Danmark er og skal være et aktivt og stolt medlem af verdenssamfundet. Vi har en lang tradition for at kæmpe for vores værdier i verden: Folkestyre. Solidaritet. Kvinders rettigheder.  Og herhjemme skal vi være beredte på sikkerhedsspørgsmål. Ikke mindst i forhold til nye dagsordener. Sundhed. Teknologi. Cyberangreb. Klimaforandringer.  Vi skal have en kollektiv fantasi til at forestille os, at vores virkelighed kan ændre sig på kort tid.  Det syvende fremskridt handler om, hvordan vi skaber et retfærdigere samfund.  Vi skal sætte ind, hvor forskellene er for store. Og samfundskontrakten for svag. For hvis tilliden slår sprækker, og afmagten slår rod, så mister vi den nødvendige sammenhængskraft.  Hvordan skaber vi reelt lige muligheder i vores samfund?  Hvordan gør vi for eksempel op med den alt for store ulighed i sundhed. Som desværre er et faktum, trods et udbygget offentligt sundhedssystem?  Det næste fremskridt handler om, at vores velfærdssamfund skal være varmere.Jeg kunne kaste mig ud i en lang lovprisning af velfærdssamfundet. Der er meget at rose. Men nu har vi besluttet os for tale om problemerne. Så lad mig sige det, som jeg ser det.  Det er, som om vi alt for mange steder har glemt, hvorfor vi skabte velfærdssamfundet.  Det er, som om noget andet har fået overtaget: Strategier. Detailstyring. Pseudoarbejde.  Vi er i gang med at dræne verdens bedste samfundsmodel for det vigtigste.  Tilliden til, at andre passer deres arbejde. Tilliden til, at mennesker selv kan løse problemer. Tilliden til, at ægte, hjertevarm velfærd skabes i mødet mellem mennesker.  Vi må skrue ned for detailstyring oppefra. Og skrue op for faglighed og ledelse ude på institutionerne.  Det er ikke let. Det vil kræve meget af os alle sammen. Men det er en opgave, vi må og skal tage på os.  Det niende fremskridt er stærkere – vi skal forbedre mulighederne for både land og by.  Urbanisering og centralisering er generelle tendenser. Men også i høj grad resultatet af tidligere beslutninger, der er truffet.  Det sidste fremskridt friere bringer mig tilbage den pointe, jeg indledte med: Vi har behov for en rigtig samtale med hinanden.  Det danske samfund bygger på frihed i dobbelt forstand.  For det første giver økonomisk velstand og et socialt sikkerhedsnet den enkelte frihed til at leve et liv med mange muligheder.  For det andet er kulturel dannelse og demokratisk samtale forudsætninger for et frit samfund.  Derfor skal Danmark ikke kun være rigere rent økonomisk. Vi skal også være rigere på ånd, dannelse og demokratisk engagement.  Krisen har vist, hvor vigtige kunsten, kulturen og vores nationale fællesskab er.  I en sådan grad, at jeg tror, vi har potentialet for en ny guldalder for dansk idræt – det har I vist hele sommeren – og for kunst og kultur.  I samme åndedrag vil jeg opfordre til en guldalder for den danske debatkultur.  De sociale mediers hårde tone er et problem. Vores måde at tale med hinanden på skal ikke dikteres af multinationale selskabers algoritmer.  Vi politikere har et ansvar for, at det små ikke altid bliver det største. Og det største ikke fortoner sig som de små detaljer.  Det ansvar har medierne også.  Alt for ofte opstår der en uheldig spiral af enkeltsager, samråd og forhastet lovgivning – som desværre stjæler opmærksomheden fra det egentlige problem.  Danmark er et fantastisk land. Vi skylder os selv og hinanden at tage fat på de rigtige og vigtige samfundsproblemer. Diskutere dem grundigt og fordomsfrit. Finde løsninger.  Lad arbejdet begynde! Jeg glæder mig!
topics_EN: Mette Frederiksen's speech at conference on the future of Denmark
speeches_EN: Welcome. And thank you for clearing the calendar for a whole day to discuss the future of Denmark. A year and a half ago. In the darkest weeks. Were I not sure that in August 2021 we would be able to be together here in Fredericia - in a Denmark where everyday life and the economy were so strongly on our way back. We said that good and consistent epidemic management would be the best for the Danish economy. We didn't know if we would get right. We got that. The Danish economy is back and is roaring from there. Most are in work again. We are far stronger than we had dared to hope. But. And there is one but. The basic challenges that Denmark faced before the crisis. They are still here. And unfortunately, most people have in common that we have talked about them for decades. Tried to solve them. Without getting to the finish. Me and the government have lots of ideas. Also some good ones. But we also have our limitations. Blind angles if you want. When we did not choose the polarization - as people did not choose the split - but chose the community as a way through the crisis. Why not see if we can agree on which way to go with our society for the next ten years? It requires a better democratic conversation. There are many words in Danish politics. And in the public space. But conversation - it's almost bored. When did we last hear a politician rightly give an opponent right? If we do not soon get started in the conversation, we are guilty of the fact that we and our society will be dumber than we need to be. We need to make each other wiser. Move us. Move Denmark. “The thing is that democracy never lives by law and paragraphs. It lives in and by living people. " This is how Hal Koch wrote in 1945. Back then, Denmark and the world had to rise after World War II. Now we have to move on after the worst crisis since then. Corona confirmed the strength of our social model. An enlightened and strong -willed population that fits in. A competitive business. A responsible trade union movement. Skilled authorities. Change of adaptation institutions. On top of that we have a healthy economy. Durable public finances. Control the debt. Unemployment has not stuck during the crisis. And although unfortunately there are industries that are still having a hard time. Then the general picture is that the Danish economy is back at the level before the pandemic. Employment is record high. Exports are growing. There is optimism. We could stop here. But Denmark can do more. And the way forward has to be: Reforms. Education. More in work. Growth. Innovation. When I look back, I honestly think that in recent decades we have been too powerless towards the great development trends. On the one hand, we mix politicians in everything. An anecdote I have told before: When I became Minister of Employment, I would have unemployment legislation home to read. But it would take three days to print it out and two trucks to bring it out. On the other hand, we have almost given up. Towards centralization. Bureaucracy. The negative consequences of globalization. The Danes' reaction to the corona crisis was in my eyes the first, greatest and most encouraging example of the opposite. We could have let the pandemic rage our country. We chose the opposite. When you can. Then you can do whatever you want. * * It is our common positive starting point when we now have to look forward. With the conference today we will start a broad debate about the future of Denmark. If any of you expect concrete initiatives. Millions of dollars for good causes. Then I must disappoint you. It's not coming today. On the other hand, we will continuously present large and coherent play. The first soon. Others later. The work of the coming years will be to reform Denmark step by step. And in that process, we will engage as many people as possible in the vision for Denmark in ten years. The more that help shape our future, the better it will be. And we will endeavor to put the automatic reactions away. In the publication we publish today, there are more questions than answers. It's an open invitation to you. * * * We are dependent on each other. We need each other. The pandemic has shown us too. That is why we must see social policy, education and culture, the labor market, integration, tax policy, business policy, climate policy, security policy, emergency preparedness, the cohesion of society - all together. We have made ten progress for Denmark for the next ten years. They are on the screen behind me. First, greener. The UN's latest climate report is bleak reading. The climate crisis is the biggest global challenge of our time. The climate crisis needs to be resolved. It requires emergency action from the world community. Denmark must push for ambitious, binding climate agreements internationally and in the EU. We are going on at home. Next stop will be a new agricultural agreement. Denmark must go ahead. The green transition creates new jobs - not fewer. Thus, the green is also an important building block to make us richer - the second progress. But only if we train for the needs the companies have. My best bet is that the biggest obstacle to whether we reach 70 percent is quite different from the one most people point to. We should probably make the necessary decisions. But I think the biggest obstacle is that we're going to lack the skilled workers who have to make it happen in reality. If not we have electricians. Then no wind turbines come up. Digitization, new technology, automation and green transition are emerging and changing job functions, business models and ways of doing business. It places tremendous demands on the labor market. It is also a future that is good for Denmark. And creates new opportunities. But how do we give better conditions to you companies? Not least to the small and medium -sized companies, which account for two out of three jobs in the private sector? And how do we ensure that more research is done at the companies? And what about risk capital? The third progress is more proficient. The Danes' journey through the education system is a huge success story. But when I have to dwell on the problems. As I have said I will. Then there is enough to address too. 45,000 young people aged 15-24 who do nothing. Which has neither an education nor a work after primary school - 45,000. It's a huge disaster. I honestly think that number is coming to the back of many. This is equivalent to all residents here in Fredericia Municipality neither in jobs nor education. Nothing has anything to stand up to. We can't be that familiar. The main road in our education has become that most people take a high school education and then a higher education. But it is skilled labor that companies are going to be missing. Imagine if we can get the young people's climate engagement, education, production and jobs to go into a higher unity. It leads to the next - more diligent. We have to work. More people have to work. And like more. We need to see work as much more than finances and support. Maybe even blow to a new value match. Going to work and earning one's own money must be a focal point for our society. For upcoming reforms. For our culture. We have built Denmark at work. On putting an honor in working. Dignity. Independent. Community. We must never abandon people, expect too little and make too few demands. It is also my entrance to a responsible integration policy. Unfortunately, there are many women in particular with non-Western background who do not have a job to stand up to. Government has acknowledged that problem. But no one has so far managed to solve it. It's unsustainable. The only reasonable requirement is that if you come to Denmark, you do everything to teach our language, get to work, support yourself and your children. The sixth progress safer has gained an unhappy news with the disaster in Afghanistan. A disaster that gives rise to a broader reflection - not whether we should take responsibility, but how we should take responsibility. This is a discussion we need to take with our allies in NATO and in the EU. Denmark is and must be an active and proud member of the world community. We have a long tradition of fighting for our values ​​in the world: People's Government. Solidarity. Women's rights. And at home we need to be prepared for security issues. Not least in relation to new agendas. Health. Technology. Cyber ​​attacks. Climate change. We need to have a collective imagination to imagine that our reality can change in a short time. The seventh progress is about how we create a fairer society. We need to put in where the differences are too big. And the community contract too weak. Because if the confidence beats cracks and the powerlessness is rooted, then we lose the necessary cohesion. How do we really create equal opportunities in our society? How, for example, do we make up with the excessive inequality in health. Which is unfortunately a fact, despite an expanded public health system? The next progress is about our welfare society being warmer. I could throw myself into a long praise of the welfare society. There is a lot to praise. But now we have decided to talk about the problems. So let me say it as I see it. It is as if we have forgotten too many places why we created the welfare society. It is as if something else has been taken over: strategies. Retail control. Pseudo -work. We are in the process of draining the world's best social model for the most important thing. The confidence that others fit their work. The confidence that people can solve problems themselves. The confidence that real, heartwarming welfare is created in the meeting between people. We have to turn down retail control from above. And turn up professionalism and management at the institutions. It is not easy. It will require a lot of all of us. But it is a task we must and must take on. The ninth progress is stronger - we need to improve the opportunities for both country and city. Urbanization and centralization are general trends. But also to a great extent the result of previous decisions made. The last progress freer brings me back the point I started with: We need a real conversation with each other. Danish society is based on freedom in a double sense. First, financial prosperity and a social security network give the individual freedom to live a life with many opportunities. Secondly, cultural education and democratic conversation are the prerequisites for a free society. Therefore, Denmark must not only be richer purely financially. We must also be richer in spirit, formation and democratic commitment. The crisis has shown how important art, culture and our national community are. To such an extent that I think we have the potential for a new golden age for Danish sports - it has shown all summer - and for art and culture. In the same breath, I would call for a golden age for the Danish debate culture. The hard tone of social media is a problem. Our way of talking to each other should not be dictated by the algorithms of multinational corporations. We politicians have a responsibility that the little one is not always the biggest. And the biggest one does not fade like the little details. That responsibility has the media too. Too often, an unfortunate spiral of individual cases, consultation and rushed legislation arises - which unfortunately steals the attention of the real problem. Denmark is a fantastic country. We owe ourselves and each other to address the right and important societal problems. Discuss them thoroughly and prejudiced. Find solutions. Let the work begin! I look forward to!

topics_dk: Mette Frederiksens tale ved Pressemøde om status på coronasituationen
speeches_dk: Det er længe siden, at vi har holdt et pressemøde om corona her i Statsministeriet. Velkommen til. Og når vi holder pressemødet i dag, så er det, fordi vi gerne vil give en status efter sommeren og inden, at vi som land for alvor går ind i efteråret. Hverdagen er heldigvis tilbage langt de fleste steder, og vi har, os der står heroppe, den klare forventning, at vi kan undgå store nationale nedlukninger i fremtiden – ganske enkelt, fordi vi har nu supervåbenet over dem alle, nemlig vaccinerne. Og derfor er det også helt og aldeles afgørende, at vi får de sidste med, hvad angår vaccinationerne, så vi alle sammen kan gå trygge ind i efteråret. Inden vi uddyber dét, så først helt kort om nogle af de andre dagsordener, der optager os netop nu. Internationalt katastrofen i Afghanistan. Evakueringsindsatsen er stadigvæk i fuld gang. Myndighederne arbejder i døgndrift, og indtil nu er det lykkedes at evakuere omkring 650 personer fra Kabul under vilkår, som bliver stadig vanskeligere. Herhjemme begynder vi nu endelig at kunne løfte blikket fra pandemien og ser frem med fornyet styrke. I morgen holder regeringen en stor konference i Fredericia, hvor vi indbyder til en fælles samtale om fremtidens Danmark. Det vil I høre mere om i den kommende tid. Men corona skal stadigvæk have vores fulde opmærksomhed, hvis sygdommen løber fra os, så kan alt andet hurtigt komme i baggrunden igen. Langt de fleste restriktioner er nu væk – ophævet. Det er glædeligt. Det er fantastisk. Vi har fået vores almindelige liv igen. Vi har med andre ord erobret hverdagen tilbage. På mange måder har vi jo haft en forrygende sommer her i Danmark. Mange har holdt familiefester igen, koncerter, EM i fodbold – endda med fans på lægterne. Men i dag til alle jer, der ser med hjemmefra: Vi danskere har meget at takke hinanden for. Økonomien er også tilbage, og den er faktisk mere end dét. Selvom der stadigvæk selvfølgelig er brancher, der har det svært, så er det generelle billede - buldrende beskæftigelse, eksporten vokser og stigende optimisme. Alligevel er der en modsætning i det sted, hvor vi er netop nu i Danmark. På den ene side, der står vi med den værste variant af coronaen hidtil. Den er blevet mere smitsom. Det er dét, der hedder Delta-varianten. På den anden side, så sætter vi samfundet fri af restriktioner. Det er jo på sin egen måde en lidt mærkelig situation. Og den er kun mulig af én eneste årsag, og det er vaccinerne. Tre ud af fire borgere i Danmark har nu modtaget mindst første stik. Og fire millioner er helt færdigvaccinerede. Det svarer til næsten 70 procent af alle i Danmark. Det er helt fantastisk. Og vi er meget taknemmelige os, der står her. Det betyder også, at der er en helt enestående opbakning fra befolkningen. Internationalt ligger Danmark, også på dette her område, blandt de allerbedste. Af alle, som var indlagt med corona i midten af august i uge 32, var fire ud af fem, altså 80 procent, ikke færdigvaccinerede. Vi ser, at vaccinerede også godt kan blive smittede og syge, men risikoen er langt mindre, end hvis man ikke er vaccineret, og vurderingen er faktisk, at selv hvis man som vaccineret skulle blive smittet, så beskytter vaccinen heldigvis for de fleste imod alvorlig sygdom og indlæggelse. Eller sagt på direkte dansk – vaccinerne, de virker. Og til jer, som måske har det indtryk, at det kun er ældre, der bliver alvorligt syge, så passer det altså ikke. Billedet er faktisk nu vendt i Danmark. Før nytår, der udgjorde personer under 40 år kun 13 procent af de indlagte på sygehusene. I dag udgør de halvdelen, 51 procent af alle indlagte. Alene den seneste måned har mere end 300 personer under 40 år været indlagt med corona. Endda nogen af dem, altså yngre, i respirator. Forklaringen, den er faktisk lige for, fordi på trods af den enestående succes med at få vaccineret danskerne, så er der stadigvæk for mange under 40, som ikke er blevet vaccineret endnu. I Danmark, der er det frivilligt, om man ruller ærmet op og får nålen i skulderen, men jeg vil gerne sige meget direkte til jer, som ikke er blevet vaccineret: I løber lige nu en større risiko end på noget andet tidspunkt for at blive smittet med corona, og I risikerer jo også med det, at I måske uforvarende giver sygdommen videre til et andet menneske. Jeg tror, der er flere, der allerede er blevet overrasket over, hvor hårdt coronaen kan slå, også et ungt menneske med jernhelbred. Og vi kan se nu, at den her sygdom kan trække lange spor. Vi kender ikke endnu det fulde billede af senfølgerne, men sundhedsmyndighederne vurderer nu, at omkring hver tiende vil blive ramt af senfølger eller kan blive ramt af senfølger. Derfor sætter myndighederne også alt til og alle kræfter ind på at få vaccinen ud til flere. Sundhedsstyrelsen har et mål om, at ni ud af ti af de danskere, der kan vaccineres, er vaccineret inden 1. oktober. Det er et mål, vi bakker helhjertet op om. Så til dig, der af den ene eller andet grund ikke er blevet vaccineret: Skulle du ikke tage og gøre det nu? Jeg vil stærkt opfordre til, at vi får alle med, inden sommerens gode vejr eller danske sommervejr forsvinder, og inden det bliver efterår. Vi har vacciner, og det er så let, som det kan blive, og sundhedsmyndighederne gør det nu endnu lettere med pop-up vaccinesteder, for eksempel på uddannelsesinstitutioner, og i de boligområder, hvor der desværre er for få mennesker, der er blevet vaccineret. Oven i det bliver der også kørt ud til arbejdspladser, hvor der for eksempel er mange unge ansat. Vaccinen kommer til dig. Du skal ikke engang bestille tid. Det er så let, som det overhovedet kan blive, så sørg nu for at blive vaccineret for din egen skyld, men også for alle vi andres skyld. Det er mit første budskab i dag. Mit andet budskab i dag er, at på grund af vaccinen og på grund af den flotte tilslutning til vaccinen i Danmark, så står vi nu i en anden tid med corona, hvor alt tyder på, at nye nationale nedlukninger ikke bliver nødvendigt. Der er ikke nogen garantier. Selvfølgelig, mutationer og andet kan opstå. Coronaen er her stadig, og den er i øvrigt også i resten af verden, hvor meget færre mennesker jo er blevet vaccinerede. Og derfor vil vi blive ved med at følge pandemien nøje, men vi står et helt andet og meget bedre sted, end vi har stået på noget andet tidspunkt. Og derfor besluttede et flertal i Folketinget inden sommerferien at nedsætte en ekspertgruppe, der skal se på en langsigtet strategi for et genåbnet Danmark. Gruppens medlemmer tæller selvfølgelig både sundhedseksperter og økonomer, og jeg er rigtig glad for, at gruppens formand, Torben M. Andersen, er med her i dag på pressemødet og dermed kan fortælle mere om det arbejde, der er igangsat. Ekspertgruppen skal komme med bud på, hvordan vi kan overvåge coronasituationen med det meget klare mål for øje, at vi skal kunne håndtere smittebølger med corona på en holdbar og effektiv måde, så nedlukninger kan undgås. Eksperterne kommer med deres rapport i løbet af den næste måned. Til sidst vil jeg bare gerne lige have lov til at sige, at jeg godt forstår, at der stadigvæk er mange danskere, der er utrygge og måske bliver endnu mere utrygge nu, når restriktionerne udfases. Coronaen er her nemlig stadig. Og I, trods vaccinen, er jo stadigvæk udsatte. I skal selvfølgelig opleve, at vi andre stadigvæk respekterer dét og er opmærksomme på jer, der er mest sårbare, og stadigvæk viser den nødvendige omsorg. Det oplever jeg heldigvis også, at rigtig mange gør, for vi danskere er rigtige gode til at passe på hinanden. Det håber jeg, vi holder fast i. Men jeg har også tillid til, at vi nu kan bruge vores almindelige sunde fornuft. Vi er dér, hvor vi ikke længere behøver detaljerede retningslinjer om det meste i vores hverdag. Igennem det seneste halvandet år har vi vist hvor meget, vi kan i fællesskab, og det skal vi blive ved med at gøre. Jeg ved godt, der hos nogen er en oplevelse af, at vi har haft mange regler, og det har vi sådan set også, men dét, der for alvor har reddet os igennem denne her krise, det er jo, hvad du og jeg og vi tilsammen har gjort for hinanden. Vi kan ikke lovgive om alt og slet ikke adfærd, og så er det jo altså godt, vi har en dansk befolkning, der både tager ansvar, som har tillid til hinanden, og som har det samfundssind, som er nødvendigt. Så vi står et godt sted. Og vi er klar til de udfordringer, der måtte møde os. Og med de her ord, så giver jeg ordet videre i første omgang til Sundhedsministeren. Værsgo.
topics_EN: Mette Frederiksen's speech at the press conference on the status of the corona situation
speeches_EN: It's been a long time since we've held a press conference on Corona here in the Prime Minister's Office. Welcome to. And when we hold the press conference today, it is because we want to give a status after the summer and before we as a country seriously enter the fall. Fortunately, everyday life is back in most places, and we have, we stand up here, the clear expectation that we can avoid big national shutdowns in the future - simply because we now have super weapon over them all, namely the vaccines. And that is why it is also crucial that we get the latter with regard to the vaccinations so that we can all go safe into the fall. Before we elaborate on that, only briefly about some of the other agendas that are coming up right now. International disaster in Afghanistan. The evacuation effort is still in full swing. Authorities are working 24 hours a day, and so far we have succeeded in evacuating about 650 people from Kabul under conditions, which are becoming increasingly difficult. At home, we are now finally starting to lift the gaze of the pandemic and look forward with renewed strength. Tomorrow, the government will hold a major conference in Fredericia, where we invite a joint conversation about the future of Denmark. You will hear more about that in the coming time. But Corona still has to pay our full attention if the disease runs away from us, then everything else can quickly get back into the background. The vast majority of restrictions are now gone - abolished. It's gratifying. It is fantastic. We've got our ordinary lives again. In other words, we have conquered back everyday life. In many ways we have had a great summer here in Denmark. Many have held family parties again, concerts, the European Championships in football - even with fans on the laths. But today to all of you who look away from home: We Danes have a lot to thank each other for. The economy is also back, and it is actually more than that. Although, of course, there are still industries that are having a hard time, the general picture - roaring employment, exports are growing and rising optimism. Still, there is a contradiction in the place where we are right now in Denmark. On the one hand, we stand with the worst variant of the corona so far. It has become more contagious. That's what is called the Delta variant. On the other hand, we set the community free of restrictions. After all, it is a slightly strange situation in its own way. And it is only for one reason and it is the vaccines. Three out of four citizens in Denmark have now received at least first plugs. And four million are fully vaccinated. This corresponds to almost 70 percent of all in Denmark. It's fantastic. And we are very grateful us who are standing here. It also means that there is a unique support from the population. Internationally, Denmark, also in this area, is among the very best. Of all who were hospitalized with Corona in mid -August in week 32, four out of five, ie 80 percent, were not finalized. We see that vaccinated may also become infected and sick, but the risk is far less than if you are not vaccinated, and the assessment is that even if you, as a vaccinated, are infected, the vaccine fortunately protects for most people against serious illness and hospitalization. Or, in direct Danish, the vaccines they work. And for those of you who may have the impression that only the elderly people get seriously ill, so does not fit. The picture is actually turned in Denmark. Before the New Year, who made up people under 40 only 13 percent of hospitals in hospitals. Today, they make up half, 51 percent of all inpatients. In the past month alone, more than 300 people under 40 have been hospitalized with Corona. Even some of them, ie younger, in the respirator. The explanation, it is actually right, because despite the unique success of getting the Danes vaccinated, there is still for many under 40 who have not been vaccinated yet. In Denmark, it is voluntary if you roll up the sleeve and get the needle in the shoulder, but I would like to say very directly to you who have not been vaccinated: You are currently running a greater risk than at any other time to get infected with Corona, and you also risk with the fact that you may be inadvertently passing on to another human being. I think there are several who have already been surprised at how hard the corona can beat, also a young person with iron heals. And we can see now that this disease can draw long traces. We do not yet know the full picture of the late sequences, but the health authorities now estimate that about every tenth will be affected by late sequelae or may be hit by late sequelae. Therefore, the authorities also make everything and all the effort to get the vaccine out to more. The National Board of Health has a goal that nine out of ten of the Danes who can be vaccinated are vaccinated by October 1st. That's a goal we're backing up wholeheartedly. So to you who, for one reason or another, have not been vaccinated: shouldn't you take and do it now? I would strongly encourage us to get everyone involved before the summer's good weather or Danish summer weather disappears, and before it is autumn. We have vaccines and it is as easy as it can be, and the health authorities are now making it even easier with pop-up vaccine places, for example at educational institutions, and in the residential areas where there are unfortunately too few people who have been vaccinated. On top of that, there are also workplaces where, for example, there are many young people employed. The vaccine is coming to you. Don't even book time. It is as easy as it can be, so make sure you are vaccinated for your own sake, but also for everyone else's sake. That's my first message today. My second message today is that due to the vaccine and because of the great connection to the vaccine in Denmark, we are now in another time with Corona, where all indications are that new national shutdowns will not be necessary. There are no guarantees. Of course, mutations and other things can occur. The corona is still here, and it is also in the rest of the world, where much fewer people have been vaccinated. And that is why we will keep following the pandemic carefully, but we are a completely different and much better place than we have been at any other time. And that is why a majority in the Folketing decided before the summer holidays to set up an expert group to look at a long -term strategy for a reopened Denmark. The group's members, of course, count both health experts and economists, and I am really pleased that the group's chairman, Torben M. Andersen, is here today at the press conference and thus can tell more about the work that has been initiated. The expert group must come up with suggestions on how we can monitor the corona situation with the very clear goal in mind that we should be able to deal with Corona infection waves in a durable and effective way to avoid shutdowns. The experts will come with their report over the next month. In the end, I just want to be allowed to say that I understand that there are still many Danes who are unsafe and maybe even more insecure now when the restrictions are phased out. The corona is still here. And you, despite the vaccine, are still exposed. Of course, you must find that we others still respect that and are aware of you who are most vulnerable and still show the necessary care. Fortunately, I also find that many people do, because we Danes are really good at looking after each other. I hope we hold on to that. But I also trust that we can now use our common sense. We are where we no longer need detailed guidelines about most of our everyday lives. Over the past year and a half we have shown how much we can jointly, and we must continue to do that. I know that in someone there is an experience that we have had many rules, and so have we seen, but what has seriously saved us through this crisis, that is what you and I and we and we have done together for each other. We cannot legislate on everything and not at all behavior, and so it is good, so we have a Danish population that both takes responsibility that has confidence in each other and which has the social mind that is needed. So we stand in a good place. And we are ready for the challenges that may meet us. And with these words, I will give the word in the first place to the Minister of Health. Here you go.

topics_dk: Mette Frederiksens tale ved lukkeceremonien for Worldpride og Eurogames
speeches_dk: Love is never wrong. That is my message for you today. No matter who you are. Or where you live. Or whom you love. Love is never wrong. A message so clear, it goes without saying. But right now, we need to say it. Loud and proud. Love is never wrong. That is what we have done here in Copenhagen during the past ten days. Copenhagen dressed in rainbow colours. People from all over the world – welcome to our capital. Denmark is a pioneer when it comes to LGBTI+ rights. And standing here today, looking at you, I feel both proud and thankful. You lead the way. Thank you. * * * We have come far. Yet, the fight is not over. We step forwards. Unfortunately, sometimes we also step backwards. Also here in Europe. Hateful laws and practices. Discrimination. Hate crimes. The fight is not over. No one should have to hide their love. No one should have to deny who they are. So today, I want to send a clear message to my colleagues in Europe – and the rest of the world: We need to stand up and fight for diversity. This is the time to must stand firm upon Europe’s core values. Dignity. Equality. Solidarity. Respect for human rights. We all have a responsibility to say no to discrimination and hate. For your sake. For the sake of us all. * * * Allow me to say a few words to the Danish audience. Kære alle sammen. Tak for en fuldstændig fantastisk Pride her i København. Tak, fordi I viser vejen for resten af verden. Kampen er ikke slut ude i verden. Og heller ikke herhjemme. Næsten hver tredje LGBTI-person i Danmark har følt sig diskrimineret inden for det seneste år. Mere end hver fjerde oplever, at de ikke altid kan være åbne om deres seksualitet eller kønsidentitet. Og næsten halvdelen har undladt at holde deres partner i hånden i offentligheden. Det går ikke i Danmark. Vi står på skuldrene af dem, der har kæmpet. Lad os love hinanden i dag, at kampen aldrig stopper. Alle har ret til at være den, de er. Alle har ret til at være en del af vores fællesskab. Alle har ret til at elske den, de vil. Love is never wrong. Love is always right. Have a fantastic party tonight!
topics_EN: Mette Frederiksen's speech at the closing ceremony of WorldPride and Eurogames
speeches_EN: LOVE IS NEVER WRONG. That is my message for you today. No Matter Who You Are. Or where you live. Or whom you love. LOVE IS NEVER WRONG. A MESSAGE So Clear, It Goes Without Saying. But right now, we need to say it. Loud and Proud. LOVE IS NEVER WRONG. That is what we have done here in Copenhagen During the Past Ten Days. Copenhagen Dressed in Rainbow Colors. People from all over the World - Welcome to Our Capital. Denmark is a pioneer when it comes to lgbtti+ rights. And Standing Here Today, Looking At You, I Feel Both Proud and Thankful. You lead the way. Thank you. * * * We have come father. Yet, The Fight Is Not Over. We Step Forwards. Unfortunately, Sometimes We Also Step Backwards. Also here in Europe. Hateful Laws and Practices. Discrimination. Hate Crimes. The Fight Is Not Over. No One Should have to Hide Their Love. No one should have to deny who they are. So Today, I WANT TO SEND A CLEAR MESSAGE TO MY COLLEAGUES IN EUROPE - AND THE REST OF THE WORLD: WE NEED TO STAND UP AND FIGHT FOR DIVERSITY. This is the Time to Must Stand Firm Upon Europe's Core Values. DIGNITY. Equality. Solidarity. Respect for Human Rights. We all have a Responsibility to Say No to Discrimination and Hate. For your sake. For The Sake of Us All. * * * ALLOW ME TO SAY A Few Words to the Danish Audience. Dear everyone. Thank you for a fantastic pride here in Copenhagen. Thank you for showing the way for the rest of the world. The fight is not over in the world. And not at home either. Almost every third LGBTI person in Denmark has been discriminated against within the past year. More than one in four feel that they may not always be open about their sexuality or gender identity. And almost half have failed to hold their partner in hand in public. It does not go in Denmark. We stand on the shoulders of those who have fought. Let's promise each other today that the fight never stops. Everyone has the right to be who they are. Everyone has the right to be part of our community. Everyone has the right to love the one they want. LOVE IS NEVER WRONG. LOVE IS ALWAYS RIGHT. Have a Fantastic Party Tonight!

topics_dk: Mette Frederiksens tale ved LGBTI+ Human Rights Conference
speeches_dk: Kære venner! Tak for invitationen til at tale til jer i dag. Om et emne af stor betydning. For os alle sammen. Grundlæggende menneskerettigheder. Og for at sige det meget enkelt: LGBTI+-rettigheder er menneskerettigheder. Retten til at være den du er. Og elske den du elsker. * * * Det gør mig stolt, at Danmark er i spidsen, når det drejer sig om at fremme og beskytte LGBTI+ rettigheder. Vi var det først land i verden, der lovliggjorde registrerede partnerskaber for partnere af samme køn. Det første land i Europa, der tillod juridisk kønsskifte – uden lægelig godkendelse. Og det første land, der besluttede sig for at fjerne transkønnethed fra listen over psykiske sygdomme. Vi er nået langt. Og, alligevel, ved vi. Kampen er ikke forbi. * * * Solidaritet. Ligestilling af kønnene. Ytringsfrihed. Retten til at tage del i samfundet og til at have en familie. Dette er kærneværdier for Danmark. Og at fremme og beskytte disse værdier er meget centralt i Danmarks internationale engagement. I FN, i EU og i civilsamfundet. Lige nu er friheden og menneskerettighederne under pres verden over. Også her i Europa. Efter mange år med fremskridt, går nogle ting nu den forkerte vej. Desværre. Fjendtlige love. Diskrimination. Hadforbrydelser. Vi må følge den nuværende situation nøje. Og vi må ikke blot se passivt til. Nu er tiden kommet – for os alle – hvor vi må stå fast på grundlæggende rettigheder og værdier. Vi må yde modstand og bekæmpe forskelsbehandling. * * * Det er derfor, Copenhagen 2021 er en så vigtig begivenhed. Det er ikke blot en fejring. Det er et engagement. En forpligtelse overfor hinanden, om at ord ikke er nok. Vi er nødt til at handle. Sammen. Og Danmark står klar til at gøre vores del. Jeg vil gerne takke jer alle i dag. For at komme til Danmark. Og for at tilslutte jer denne konference for at diskutere det vigtige emne menneskerettigheder. I viser vejen. Til en mere ligeberettiget og en mere inkluderende fremtid. Tak.
topics_EN: Mette Frederiksen's speech at LGBTI+ Human Rights Conference
speeches_EN: Dear friends! Thank you for the invitation to talk to you today. About a topic of great importance. For all of us. Basic human rights. And to put it very simple: LGBTI+rights are human rights. The right to be who you are. And love the one you love. * * It makes me proud that Denmark is at the forefront when it comes to promoting and protecting LGBTI+ rights. We were the first country in the world that legalized registered partnerships for partners of the same sex. The first country in Europe that allowed legal gender change - without medical approval. And the first country that decided to remove transgenderness from the list of mental illnesses. We have come a long way. And, anyway, we know. The match is not over. * * * Solidarity. Equality of the sexes. Freedom of expression. The right to take part in society and to have a family. This is the core values ​​for Denmark. And to promote and protect these values ​​is very central to Denmark's international commitment. In the UN, in the EU and in civil society. Right now, freedom and human rights are under pressure worldwide. Here too in Europe. After many years of progress, some things are now going the wrong way. Unfortunately. Hostile laws. Discrimination. Hate crimes. We must follow the current situation closely. And we must not just look passively. Now is the time - for all of us - where we must stand firm on fundamental rights and values. We must provide resistance and fight discrimination. * * This is why Copenhagen 2021 is such an important event. It's not just a celebration. It's a commitment. A commitment to each other that words are not enough. We have to act. Together. And Denmark is ready to do our part. I would like to thank you all today. To get to Denmark. And to join this conference to discuss the important topic of human rights. You show the road. To a more equal and a more inclusive future. Thanks.

topics_dk: Mette Frederiksens partiledertale ved Folkemødet
speeches_dk: Tak til Alberte for den smukke sang. Du og dine sange hjalp os igennem krisen. Nu minder du os om den verden, der igen vælter ind. Bøgen er sprunget ud. Fuglene er kommet igen. De lyse nætter er over os.  Og nu står vi her igen. Til demokratiets folkefest – Folkemødet.  Allinge. Du har været savnet.  For i en verden, der ofte gøres sort og hvid.  Hvor nuancerne forsvinder.  Har vi brug for det her. Vi har brug for hinanden.  For nysgerrighed. Nye perspektiver.  Dilemmaer.  For en fælles samtale.  På mange måder har vi aldrig været mere forbundne, end vi er nu.  De samtaler, der før foregik ansigt til ansigt. Eller måske slet ikke fandt sted. De kan nu foregå på video. Det er blevet nemmere at holde liv i gamle venskaber.  På et øjeblik kan millioner af mennesker – eller en hel nation – dele den samme oplevelse. Som i lørdags, da vi knap kunne trække vejret. Og så hele Danmarks Christian Eriksen falde om på banen. Den digitale udvikling har skabt et væld af nye muligheder. Alle kan komme til orde. Man kan hurtigt finde ligesindede. Engagere sig.  Det er godt for vores demokrati.  Samtidig er det sårbart.  Når der spredes had og falske nyheder.  Når helt almindelige mennesker chikaneres, fordi de giver deres mening til kende. Eller bare stiller sig frem.  Som nogle af de unge mennesker, der i år måtte forlade X Factor.  Men som mest af alt var lettede over, at de nu slap for de hadefulde beskeder.  Faktisk gælder det, at en stor del af befolkningen. Over halvdelen af de unge. De undlader at deltage, fordi de heldigvis ikke kan finde sig til rette i den hårde tone.  Hvad der burde være en demokratisering af debatten. Ender med at være en begrænsning.  Sådan skal det jo ikke være!  Der er en særlig udfordring med sociale medier.  Når den udvælgelse, der ligger bag hvilke opslag, man ser, primært bekræfter de holdninger, man selv havde i forvejen.  Og dermed skaber såkaldte ekkokamre. Hvor vi kun mødes med mennesker, der er enige med os selv.  I stedet for at lade meningerne brydes. Så dyrkes forskellene. Dynamikken forsvinder til fordel for retorikken. Og de simple svar tillægges den største værdi. Det bidrager til polarisering i vores samfund. Og udfordrer vores demokrati.  Hal Koch beskrev det så godt allerede i 1945. Det er ikke afstemningerne, der er demokratiets egentlige styrke. Det er samtalen.  Med det følger en forpligtigelse. Til at mødes. På tværs af hver vores standpunkter. Og til at lytte til hinanden.  Ansvaret for, hvordan vi taler med hinanden. Hvad vi skriver til andre.  Det er først og fremmest vores eget.  Men de sociale medier. Tech-giganterne. De har også et ansvar.  I dag udgiver regeringen sin første hvidbog. Om netop tech-giganterne.  Hvor vi beskriver de nye udfordringer, der er fulgt med tech-giganternes udvikling. Og tager hul på de svære spørgsmål, vi som samfund er nødt til at forholde os til.  Det er et forsøg på at starte en samtale. Nuanceret. På en måde, hvor dilemmaerne er med.  Men hvor vi samtidig tager et ansvar på os som samfund. Hvor vi tør stille krav. Og regulere de nye økonomier.  I erkendelse af, at tech-giganternes betydning for vores hverdag næppe kan undervurderes.  Tre ud af fire danskere er på Facebook.  90 pct. af alle internetsøgninger i EU foregår via Google.  Og ja; jeg bruger dem også selv.  Men hvad betyder det, når YouTube blokerer al dansk musik i en tvist om, hvad kunsterne skal betales for deres arbejde? Hvad betyder indsamlingen og den stadig mere målrettede brug af data fra millioner af mennesker?  Og hvad betyder det for vores børn og unge, at de konstant skal være online for at være med?  Tech-giganterne er blevet verdensdominerende virksomheder. De handler med vores tid, engagement og data.  Egentlig er der ikke noget nyt i, at kommercielle interesser konkurrerer om vores opmærksomhed og købekraft.  Det har sådan set skabt en stor del af den vækst, vi alle nyder godt af.  Men som samfund har vi altid insisteret på en kontrakt.  På den ene side har vi sikret frihandel og rammer, der understøtter eksport, innovation og værdiskabelse.  På den anden side har vi krævet ordentlige vilkår for lønmodtagere, tryghed og investeringer i velfærd.  Kort sagt: Du må gerne tjene penge. Men du skal tage et ansvar for det samfund, du er en del af – og som du nyder godt af.  Det gælder os alle hver især.  Det gælder virksomhederne.  Det skal også gælde tech-giganterne.  Og det gør det også i stigende grad.  F.eks. blokerer Facebook en million falske konti – hver dag. Og YouTube har fjernet over ni millioner videoer mellem januar og marts – bare i år.  Som samfund skal vi turde i højere grad at skubbe på den udvikling.  Blandt andet skal vi kræve, at tech-giganterne betaler mere i skat.  I modsætning til mange andre virksomheder kan de operere i et land uden så at sige at være fysisk tilstede. De har bedre mulighed for at placere deres aktiver i lande, hvor skatteforholdene er gunstige.  Det er uholdbart. For det underminerer finansieringen af vores samfund.  Princippet bør være, at man som virksomhed betaler en del af sin skat de steder, man tjener sine penge.  Jeg er ualmindeligt glad for, at den holdning nu deles af nogle af verdens største økonomier. At USA igen er tilbage. Og har sat sig i spidsen for det arbejde.  Det giver håb for, at vi kan finde løsninger på en udvikling, vi i alt for lang tid har stået magtesløse over for.  En udvikling, der nok har gjort os mere forbundne. Og som også har gjort vores hverdag og arbejdsliv nemmere.  Fremskridt, som er blevet en uundværlig del af dagligdagen for mange danske familier og for erhvervslivet.  Alt det skal vi holde fast i.  Samtidig skal vi tackle de udfordringer, der følger med.  Om det gælder sundhed. Medier. Rettigheder. Demokrati.  Når det gælder arbejdsmarkedet. Skattebetaling. Forbrugerbeskyttelse. Konkurrencevilkår.  Og noget nok større: At unge mennesker oplever aldrig at kede sig. At fordybelse er blevet sværere. At mange børn og unge mistrives.  Regeringen kommer ikke med alle svarene.  Med hvidbogen og min tale her i dag vil vi igen rejse debatten. Og vi lancerer ni principper.  For det første skal tech-giganterne underlægges demokratiske rammer.  For det andet skal børn og unge have en tryg barndom – i en god balance mellem den digitale og fysiske verden.  For det tredje skal tech-giganterne understøtte den demokratiske samtale – frem for at undergrave den gennem digitale ekkokamre og polarisering.  For det fjerde skal tech-giganterne tage et større ansvar for indholdet på deres platforme.  For det femte har vi brug for frie og velfungerende medier til at understøtte den demokratiske samtale – og hvor alle får en fair betaling for deres kreative arbejde.  For det sjette skal arbejdstageres rettigheder beskyttes – også på de digitale platforme.  For det syvende skal tech-giganterne bidrage til et retfærdigt skattesystem på linje med alle andre virksomheder.  For det ottende skal konkurrencen være retfærdig, transparent og så forbrugerne kan handle trygt online.  Og endelig – for det niende: Det skal være demokratiet, der sætter rammerne for tech-giganterne. Ikke omvendt. Vi har klaret krisen godt. Når vi kan det. Så kan vi også sætte os for, at tech-giganter og sociale medier skal være godt for både mennesker og samfund.  For er der noget, vi har lært af pandemien. Så er det netop, at vores handlinger hver især – og sammen – har betydning.  At vi selv bestemmer. Ikke bare i det små. Men også stillet overfor udviklinger, der synes uoverkommelige.  Det sidste halvandet år har vi været igennem den største krise siden anden verdenskrig.  Og vi har klaret os godt.  Takket være jeres alles store indsats. Den eminente omstillingsevne i alle dele af samfundet.  Dansk økonomi er i dag et langt bedre sted, end nogen af os havde turde håbe på i de mørke uger i marts sidste år.  Arbejdsløsheden falder. Forbruget stiger. Og eksporten vokser. Næste år forventer vi, at den økonomiske vækst kan blive den største i 15 år.  Vi har et solidt udgangspunkt for at komme videre.  Min tro på, hvad vi kan som samfund, er kun blevet større.  Derfor er det også nu, vi skal kigge fremad. Hæve ambitionerne endnu en gang.  Hvordan skaber vi de bedste rammer for, at flere danskere kommer i arbejde?  At flere unge kommer i uddannelse. Tager en faglært uddannelse. Og at flere kvinder med anden etnisk baggrund bliver en del af arbejdsmarkedet.  At danske virksomheder står endnu stærkere i den internationale konkurrence? Og at vi også i fremtiden har et velorganiseret arbejdsmarked? At den grønne vækst får de bedste betingelser?  At det er demokratiet, der sætter rammerne for tech-giganterne.  Vi glæder os til debatten.  Rigtig godt Folkemøde!
topics_EN: Mette Frederiksen's party leader speech at the National Assembly
speeches_EN: Thanks to Alberta for the beautiful song. You and your songs helped us through the crisis. Now you remind us of the world that is overturning again. The Beech has blossomed. The birds have come again. The bright nights are upon us. And now we stand here again. To the national party of democracy - the National Assembly. Allinge. You've been missed. For in a world that is often made black and white. Where the nuances disappear. Do we need this. We need each other. For curiosity. New perspectives. Dilemmas. For a common conversation. In many ways we have never been more connected than we are now. The conversations that before took place face to face. Or maybe didn't take place at all. They can now take place on video. It has become easier to keep alive old friendships. In a moment, millions of people - or a whole nation - can share the same experience. Like Saturday, when we could barely breathe. And then all of Denmark's Christian Eriksen falls on the field. Digital development has created a wealth of new opportunities. Everyone can come to terms. One can quickly find like -minded people. Become involved. It is good for our democracy. At the same time, it is vulnerable. When hatred and fake news spread. When ordinary people are harassed because they make their opinion known. Or just standing out. Like some of the young people who had to leave X Factor this year. But most of all, they were relieved that they now escaped the hateful messages. In fact, a large part of the population is important. Over half of the young. They fail to participate because fortunately they cannot find themselves in the harsh tone. What should be a democratization of the debate. End up being a limitation. That's not how it should be! There is a special challenge with social media. When the selection behind which posts you see primarily confirm the attitudes you already had. And thus creates so -called echo chambers. Where we only meet with people who agree with ourselves. Instead of letting the opinions break. Then the differences are grown. The dynamics disappear in favor of the rhetoric. And the simple answers are added to the greatest value. It contributes to polarization in our society. And challenges our democracy. Hal Koch described it so well as early as 1945. It is not the polls that are the real strength of democracy. That's the conversation. With that comes an obligation. To meet. Across each our views. And to listen to each other. Responsibility for how we talk to each other. What we write to others. It is first and foremost our own. But the social media. The tech giants. They also have a responsibility. Today, the government publishes its first white book. About just the tech giants. Where we describe the new challenges that have been followed by the development of tech giants. And take on the difficult questions we as a society have to deal with. It's an attempt to start a conversation. Varied. In a way that the dilemmas are included. But where we also take responsibility for us as a society. Where we dare make demands. And regulate the new economies. Recognizing that the importance of tech giants for our everyday lives can hardly be underestimated. Three out of four Danes are on Facebook. 90 per cent. of all Internet searches in the EU are via Google. And yes; I use them myself too. But what does it mean when YouTube blocks all Danish music in a dispute about what the artists should be paid for for their work? What does the collection and the increasingly targeted use of data from millions of people mean? And what does it mean for our children and young people that they have to be constantly online to join? The tech giants have become world-dominant companies. They trade with our time, commitment and data. Actually, there is nothing new about commercial interests competing for our attention and purchasing power. It has thus created a large part of the growth we all enjoy. But as a society, we have always insisted on a contract. On the one hand, we have secured free trade and frameworks that support exports, innovation and value creation. On the other hand, we have required proper conditions for employees, security and investment in welfare. In short: You may make money.
