But you have to take responsibility for the community you are part of - and that you enjoy. This applies to all of us. This applies to companies. It should also apply to the tech giants. And so does so. Eg. Block Facebook a million fake accounts - every day. And YouTube has removed over nine million videos between January and March - just this year. As a society, we must dare to push to this development to a greater extent. Among other things, we must demand that the tech giants pay more in taxes. Unlike many other companies, they can operate in a country without, so to speak, to be physically present. They have a better opportunity to place their assets in countries where tax conditions are favorable. It's unsustainable. For it undermines the funding of our society. The principle should be that as a company you pay part of your taxes in the places you make your money. I am exceptionally pleased that that attitude is now shared by some of the world's largest economies. That the US is back is back. And has been at the forefront of that work. It gives hope that we can find solutions to a development that we have been powerless for far too long. A development that has probably made us more connected. And that has also made our everyday life and working life easier. Progress that has become an indispensable part of the daily life of many Danish families and for business. All that we have to hold on to. At the same time, we have to tackle the challenges that come with it. Whether it applies to health. Media. Rights. Democracy. When it comes to the labor market. Tax payment. Consumer protection. Competition Terms. And something bigger: that young people never feel bored. That immersion has become harder. That many children and young people are distracted. The government does not come with all the answers. With the White Book and my speech here today we will raise the debate again. And we launch nine principles. First, the tech giants must be subject to a democratic framework. Secondly, children and young people must have a safe childhood - in a good balance between the digital and physical world. Third, the tech giants must support the democratic conversation-rather than undermining it through digital echo chambers and polarization. Fourth, the tech giants must take greater responsibility for the content of their platforms. Fifth, we need free and well -functioning media to support the democratic conversation - and where everyone gets a fair payment for their creative work. Sixth, workers' rights must be protected - also on the digital platforms. Seventh, the tech giants must contribute to a fair tax system in line with all other companies. For the eighth, the competition must be fair, transparent and so that consumers can act safely online. And finally-for the ninth: It must be democracy that sets the framework for the tech giants. Not the other way around. We have managed the crisis well. When we can. Then we can also make ourselves that tech giants and social media should be good for both people and communities. For there is something we have learned from the pandemic. Then it is precisely that our actions each - and together - are important. That we decide for ourselves. Not just in the small. But also faced with developments that seem insurmountable. For the past year and a half we have been through the biggest crisis since World War II. And we've done well. Thanks to your great efforts. The eminent adaptability in all parts of society. The Danish economy today is a much better place than any of us had dared to hope for the dark weeks of March last year. Unemployment is falling. Consumption is rising. And exports are growing. Next year, we expect economic growth to be the largest in 15 years. We have a solid starting point to move on. My belief in what we can as a society has only gotten bigger. Therefore, it is also now that we have to look ahead. Raise the ambitions once again. How do we create the best framework for more Danes to come to work? That more young people come in education. Takes a skilled education. And that more women with a different ethnic background become part of the labor market. That Danish companies are even stronger in international competition? And that in the future we also have a well -organized labor market? That green growth gets the best conditions? That it is democracy that sets the framework for the tech giants. We look forward to the debate. Very good People's Meeting!

topics_dk: Mette Frederiksens åbningstale ved Folkemødet
speeches_dk: Bornholm. Blå himmel. Bølgebrus. Hvor er det dejligt at være tilbage! Tak til Anders og Janni for en tour de force gennem ti års folkemødehistorie. Jeg vil forsøge at undgå at gentage mig selv fra tidligere år. For det her er en ny begyndelse. En ny begyndelse for Folkemødet. For samværet. Og for kulturlivet. Derfor kunne årets folkemødetema ikke være mere velvalgt. Hvordan bevæger vi os som samfund fra dvale til drivkraft? Vi er heldigvis allerede på vej. Danmark er næsten helt genåbnet. Vi har smidt mundbindet de fleste steder. Mange flere kan nu samles til kulturarrangementer. Solen skinner. Det lysner. I dag vil jeg gerne have lov at sige en særlig tak til alle jer, der har kæmpet for dansk kunst og kultur. Alle jer, der har tænkt kreativt. Og fundet nye veje. Det har ikke været let under pandemien. Og mange steder er der stadig udfordringer. Regeringen har forsøgt at hjælpe undervejs. Og med den sommerpakke, der er aftalt, sætter vi yderligere initiativer i gang – med masser af aktiviteter i hele Danmark. Hvis der er noget, krisen har vist os – ud over samfundssindet, sammenholdet, fællesskabet og værdien af et stærkt Danmark – så er det, hvad kunsten og kulturen betyder for os. Jeg håber, at vi vil tage det med os. Nu hvor teatre, biografer, museer, biblioteker og spillesteder er åbne igen. Et land er ikke kun bygget af sten. Men endnu mere af ånd, tanke og refleksioner. Vi har brug for kunsten, kulturen og åndslivet. Til at forstå os selv og den tid, som vi lever i. Give os fodfæste. Og skabe rammerne for vores fællesskab. Og vi har behov for det levende ord. En rigtig samtale – ansigt til ansigt. Hvor meninger brydes. Og en fælles forståelse opstår. Hvis der er noget, Folkemødet kan. Så er det præcis det. Muligheden for at møde mennesker, der er anderledes end os selv. Tænker anderledes. Drømmer anderledes. I dag vil jeg sige en særlig tak til alle jer, der ikke står på scenen. Alle jer, der ikke modtager bifaldet. Men som knokler for, at vi andre kan stå her. Håndværkere og produktionsfolk, der bygger scenen. Chauffører og roadies, der transporterer og slæber grejet. Lysteknikere og lydfolk, der holder styr på mikrofoner, højttalere og lamper. Afviklere og logistikfolk, der sørger for, at alt er, hvor det skal være. Og alle jer andre. Koordinatorer, it-folk og planlæggere. Jeg synes, vi skal give jer en hånd. Kulturliv er en holdsport. Det er der også noget andet, der er. Som fodboldlandstræner Kasper Hjulmand siger – også i aften, når Danmark igen går på banen: "Husk at vise, hvem vi er!" Det gjorde vi danskere i lørdags. Hvor hele Danmark stod sammen efter den voldsomme oplevelse i Parken. Vi stod sammen med kærlighed og respekt. Vi hyldede Christian Eriksen og hele fodboldlandsholdet og alle de mange mennesker omkring det. Det er en magisk samlende kraft. Vi kan jo godt, Danmark. Vi har vist nu i mere end et år, at vi evner at stå sammen. At vi kan finde ud af at hjælpe hinanden. Og skabe sammen. Hav et rigtig godt folkemøde og pas godt på hinanden!
topics_EN: Mette Frederiksen's opening speech at the National Assembly
speeches_EN: Bornholm. Blue sky. Waves. Where is it nice to be back! Thanks to Anders and Janni for a Tour de Force through ten years of meeting history. I will try to avoid repeating myself from previous years. For this is a new beginning. A new beginning for the National Assembly. For the get -together. And for cultural life. Therefore, this year's People's Assembly could not be more well -chosen. How do we move as a society from hibernation to driving force? Fortunately, we are already on the way. Denmark is almost completely reopened. We have thrown the mouthwash in most places. Many more can now gather for cultural events. The sun shines. It brightens. Today I would like to be allowed to say a special thank you to all of you who have fought for Danish art and culture. All of you who have been thinking creatively. And found new ways. It has not been easy during the pandemic. And in many places there are still challenges. The government has tried to help along the way. And with the summer package that has been agreed, we start further initiatives - with lots of activities throughout Denmark. If there is anything the crisis has shown us - in addition to the community -minded, unity, the community and the value of a strong Denmark - then that is what art and culture mean to us. I hope we will take it with us. Now that theaters, cinemas, museums, libraries and venues are open again. A country is not only built of stone. But even more of spirit, thought and reflections. We need art, culture and spiritual life. To understand ourselves and the time we live in. Give us a foothold. And create the framework for our community. And we need the living word. A real conversation - face to face. Where opinions are broken. And a common understanding arises. If there is anything the National Assembly can. Then that's exactly that. The opportunity to meet people who are different from ourselves. Thinking differently. Dreaming differently. Today I would like to say a special thank you to all of you who are not on stage. All of you who do not receive the applause. But who knuckles that we can stand here. Craftsmen and production people who build the scene. Drivers and roadies that carry and drag the gear. Lighting technicians and sound people who keep track of microphones, speakers and lamps. Developers and logistics people who make sure everything is where it should be. And all of you others. Coordinators, IT people and planners. I think we should give you a hand. Cultural life is a team sport. There is also something else that is. As football coach Kasper Hjulmand says - even tonight when Denmark goes on the field again: "Remember to show who we are!" We did so on Saturday. Where all of Denmark stood together after the violent experience in the park. We stood together with love and respect. We paid tribute to Christian Eriksen and the whole football national team and all the many people around it. It is a magical unifying force. We can do well, Denmark. We have now shown for more than a year that we are able to stand together. That we can find out how to help each other. And create together. Have a really good People's Meeting and take good care of each other!

topics_dk: Mette Frederiksens tale ved genforeningsfejring i Sønderborg
speeches_dk: Deres Majestæt. Forbundspræsident Frank-Walter Steinmeier Kære gæster! Kære sønderjyder! Sønderjylland blev genforenet med Danmark. Nationen blev helet. Sønderjyderne kom hjem. Det skete ikke med vold og magt, med splid og polarisering, men ved en fredelig og pragmatisk folkeafstemning. At løse en grænsestrid på den måde. Demokratisk. I samarbejdets ånd. Med respekt for de mennesker, den direkte vedrører. Det burde være en selvfølge. Men det er helt enestående. Genforeningen er en vigtig del af vores fælles historie. Tak for et fantastisk show. Tak til alle jer, der har optrådt. Tak til jer, der er med her eller ser med hjemmefra. Tak til alle jer, der har lagt et kæmpe arbejde i fejringen af 100-året. Den blev ikke, som I havde troet. Til gengæld har den strakt sig over næsten to år. Når vi hylder fortiden, så hylder vi også nutiden og fremtiden. Det er ikke alene historien, der er noget særligt. Grænselandet, som vi kender det i dag, er helt enestående. Det er det takket være jer, som bor her. I tænker måske ikke over det til daglig. Men ved den måde, I lever på. Hvor I bærer jeres rødder, traditioner og sprog med stolthed. Uden at lukke jer om jer selv. Så viser I os alle sammen – at når et mindretal vil flertallet. Og når identitet og forskelle bruges til fælles bedste. Så styrker man fællesskabet. Så styrker man hinanden. I er forbilledet. Og en inspiration for hele verden. I så høj grad, at vi har indgivet en fælles ansøgning om at få mindretalsmodellen anerkendt som kulturarv af UNESCO. Den anerkendelse fortjener I. Fejringen i dag har også givet os mulighed for at invitere det officielle Tyskland til Sønderjylland. Herr Bundespräsident Steinmeier, Frau Büdenbender und Herr Ministerpräsident Günther. Vielen Dank, dass Sie heute hier sind. Das freut mich sehr. Jeres deltagelse markerer, ud over vores venskab, som mennesker, som lande, som folk, også afrundingen på det dansk-tyske venskabsår. Nu skal vi bygge videre på de styrkede dansk-tyske relationer. Kulturen. Samhandelen. Samarbejdet. Det gode naboskab. Her har vi igen brug for jer i grænselandet. I kan bevæge jer på to sprog og i to kulturer. I er vores brobyggere. Pandemien har udfordret os alle. Jeg ved, at det har været særligt vanskeligt her. Men vi har vist, hvad vi kan, når vi står sammen. Lad os tage den beslutsomhed og handlekraft med ind i vores fælles fremtid. Nu går vi endelig lysere tider i møde. I hele Danmark er der en ny optimisme. Og et mod til at se frem. Vi har haft et dejligt besøg her i dag. Og til jer, der ser med fra andre steder i landet: Kom og oplev Sønderjylland! Historiens vingesus. Det smukke grænseland. Kulturen. Og ikke mindst – sønderjyderne. Fortsat god aften, alle sammen!
topics_EN: Mette Frederiksen's speech at reunification celebration in Sønderborg
speeches_EN: Your Majesty. Federal President Frank-Walter Steinmeier Dear Guests! Dear Sønderjyder! Southern Jutland was reunited with Denmark. The nation was healed. The Southern Jews came home. It did not happen with violence and power, with divide and polarization, but by a peaceful and pragmatic referendum. To solve a border battle that way. Democratic. In the spirit of cooperation. With respect for the people it directly relates. It should be a matter of course. But it is absolutely unique. The reunion is an important part of our shared history. Thanks for a great show. Thank you to all of you who have appeared. Thank you to you who are here or watch from home. Thank you to all of you who have put a huge job in the celebration of the 100th anniversary. It was not as you thought. On the other hand, it has stretched over almost two years. When we pay tribute to the past, we also pay tribute to the present and the future. It is not only the story that is something special. The border country, as we know it today, is absolutely unique. That's it thanks to you who live here. You may not think about it on a daily basis. But by the way you live. Where you carry your roots, traditions and language with pride. Without closing you around yourself. Then you all show us - that when a minority will the majority. And when identity and differences are used for common good. Then you strengthen the community. Then you strengthen each other. You are the model. And an inspiration for the whole world. To such an extent that we have submitted a joint application to have the minority model recognized as a cultural heritage of UNESCO. That recognition deserves I. The celebration today has also allowed us to invite official Germany to Southern Jutland. Mr Bundespräsident Steinmeier, Frau Büdenbender and Mr. Minister of Minister Priesty Günther. Vielen Dank, Dass Sie Heute Hier Mind. Das Freut Mich Sehr. Your participation marks, in addition to our friendship, as people, as countries, like people, also the rounding of the Danish-German friendship year. Now we have to build on the strengthened Danish-German relationships. The culture. The trade. The collaboration. The good neighborhood. Here we again need you in the border country. You can move in two languages ​​and in two cultures. You are our bridge builders. The pandemic has challenged us all. I know it has been particularly difficult here. But we have shown what we can do when we stand together. Let's take that determination and acting power into our common future. Now we finally meet brighter times. Throughout Denmark there is a new optimism. And a courage to look forward. We have had a nice visit here today. And to you who are watching from other places in the country: Come and experience Southern Jutland! The breath of history. The beautiful borderland. The culture. And not least - the Southern Jews. Still good evening, everyone!

topics_dk: Mette Frederiksens tale ved mindehøjtidelighed for Poul Schlüter
speeches_dk: Kære Mie, Anne Marie, Søren, Peter, Carina og Niclas.  Mine varmeste tanker går i dag til jer.  Kære alle her i salen. Og alle jer andre, som ser med lige nu.  Danmark har mistet en folkekær politiker og en ægte statsmand.  Det er med ydmyghed, at jeg i dag på danskernes vegne vil forsøge at sætte ord på vores fælles afsked med Poul Schlüter.  Han var og er en af de store skikkelser i moderne Danmarkshistorie.  En respekteret og enestående dygtig politiker, der brændte for vores fædreland.  Og en statsminister, som påtog sig ansvaret for vores land i mere end et årti.  1980’erne var præget af store opbrud, herhjemme og ude i verden.  Poul Schlüter var statsminister, da Berlinmuren faldt, og en ny tid begyndte i Europa.  I en periode med store og svære beslutninger vil han blive husket for den pragmatisme – som på tværs af holdninger og interesser – skabte resultater, der står klippefast.   Afgørende samfundsbeslutninger. Også af økonomisk karakter.  Storebæltsbroen og Øresundsforbindelsen. Der helt konkret vidner om udvikling og fremskridt.   En stærk opbakning til NATO, da andre snublede. Og vigtigst: Arbejdsmarkedspensionerne. Deres betydning – for os alle sammen – kan ikke undervurderes.  Det er den pensionsopsparing, som millioner af danskere – mange af jer, der ser med i dag – kan se på lønsedlen hver måned.  Og som giver tryghed, når man bliver ældre. Det er fantastisk, at de fleste lønmodtagere kan gå på pension med en opsparing i millionklassen.  Danmark er et af de lande i verden, hvor der er den bedste pension for mennesker med helt almindelige indtægter.  Alt det takket være den aftale, som Schlüters regering indgik med fagforeninger og arbejdsgivere i 1987.  Arbejdsmarkedspensionerne er den mest langsigtede velfærdsreform i årtier.  Poul Schlüter erklærede selv, at det var hans største bedrift. Og det siger nogle vigtige ting om hans lederskab.  For det første en eminent evne til at række ud og samarbejde bredt. Udogmatisk. Med de konkrete løsninger for øje.  For det andet en forståelse for den betydning, velfærdssamfundet har for Danmark og dermed for os danskere.  For det tredje en udtalt pragmatisme. Poul Schlüter var ikke så konservativ, at det gjorde noget. Og i øvrigt var ideologi noget bras.  Jo, han forstod at sige tingene. Så vi husker dem.  Han forvaltede magten med en uimponeret og egentlig meget dansk tilgang.  Den undertippede sønderjyde blev den længst siddende statsminister siden Stauning.   Til stor overraskelse for mange. Måske også for ham selv. Lidt som det danske landshold i fodbold, der kom med på et afbud, fandt det bedste i sig selv og vandt guldet og æren.  Eller som du sagde det, Søren, i din gode tale – den grimme ælling, der bliver til en svane.  Han var statsminister i en tid uden livvagter. Hvor der blev drukket whisky og røget pibe på kontoret. Og grundlaget for regeringen blev klapret ned af manden selv, med fynd og klem på en skrivemaskine af mærket Torpedo. Det lyste ud af ham, at han elskede sit arbejde. Han har sagt, at det er svært at blive statsminister. Han har ofte givet udtryk for, at det var svært at holde op med at være statsminister.  Men at være statsminister. Om det har han kort og godt sagt "Det er dejligt," og tilføjet: "Alle skulle have lov til at prøve det!" Han havde en dyb forståelse for den drivkraft, det giver at have en positiv tilgang.  I sin sidste nytårstale sagde han: "Den brydningstid, vi lever i, skal ikke være skumring, men gry." Med den reference til en gammel sang – ramte han noget særligt i sin egen tid.  Og i vores tid i dag.  Ikke skumring, men gry.  Lige nu står vi ved afslutningen af en historisk krise. Der har været omkostninger for mange. Men det kunne have været meget værre, og jeg har grundlæggende en stor tro på Danmarks modstandskraft.  Pessimismen kan et land, der tragter efter udvikling, ikke bruge til noget. Det er heldigvis heller ikke den, der dominerer i Danmark. Det er med optimisme og fremtidstro, at vi igen skal se fremad.  Her kan vi lade os inspirere af Poul Schlüter, der nærmest havde optimismen som et princip.  Han var et musisk menneske. Med humor og livsglæde.   Som kunne svare journalister med et afvæbnende modspørgsmål: ”Hvad synes du selv?”  Man skal ikke dyrke uenigheden. Men respektere sine politiske modstandere. Det var hans filosofi.  I dag er grundlovsdag. Og jeg kan ikke forestille mig en mere velvalgt dag at tage afsked med et af de helt store egetræer i demokratiets skov.  Også i dag har vi brug for et bredt demokratisk rum. På tværs af mennesker og holdninger.  Ikke kun i politik. Men i hele vores samfund.  Evnen til at se en sag fra flere sider.  Så vi kan starte en fælles samtale om de afgørende spørgsmål.  Ikke splittelse. Men samtale.  Med blik for balancerne og nuancerne.  Det er demokratiets kerne.  Det blik havde Poul Schlüter.  Charmerende, underspillet, med glimt i øjet.  Men tag ikke fejl. Poul Schlüter var en stærk statsminister. Et stort menneske.  Dertil en elegant sprogkunstner. Jeg kan ærlig talt godt engang imellem savne den lune og det vid i den offentlige debat.  Der er mange gode og rammende citater. Nu kommer der ikke flere. Det sidste punktum er sat. Poul Schlüter vil blive savnet. Nu er hans plads i vores fælles historiebog.  Æret være Poul Schlüters minde.
topics_EN: Mette Frederiksen's speech at commemoration of Poul Schlüter
speeches_EN: Dear Mie, Anne Marie, Søren, Peter, Carina and Niclas. My warmest thoughts are going to you today. Dear everyone here in the hall. And all of you others who are watching right now. Denmark has lost a popular politician and a real statesman. It is with humility that today on behalf of the Danes I will try to put words into our joint parting with Poul Schlüter. He was and is one of the great figures in modern history of Denmark. A respected and uniquely skilled politician who burned for our homeland. And a prime minister who assumed responsibility for our country for more than a decade. The 1980s were characterized by great break -ups, at home and out in the world. Poul Schlüter was prime minister when the Berlin Wall fell and a new era began in Europe. During a period of large and difficult decisions, he will be remembered for the pragmatism - which across attitudes and interests - created results that are rock -solid. Crucial social decisions. Also of economic nature. The Great Belt Bridge and the Øresund connection. Specifically, testify to development and progress. A strong support for NATO when others stumbled. And most importantly: The labor market pensions. Their significance - to all of us - cannot be underestimated. It is the pension savings that millions of Danes - many of you who watch today - can look at the paycheck every month. And that provides security as you get older. It's great that most employees can retire with a million -class savings. Denmark is one of the countries in the world where there is the best pension for people with ordinary income. All that thanks to the agreement that Schlüter's government signed with unions and employers in 1987. The labor market pensions are the most long -term welfare reform for decades. Poul Schlüter himself declared that it was his biggest achievement. And it says some important things about his leadership. First, an eminent ability to reach out and cooperate broadly. Udogmatic. With the concrete solutions in mind. Secondly, an understanding of the importance of the welfare society has for Denmark and thus for us Danes. Third, a pronounced pragmatism. Poul Schlüter was not so conservative that it did something. And by the way, ideology was something bras. Yes, he understood how to say things. So we remember them. He managed power with an unimpressed and really very Danish approach. The under -tipped South Jew became the longest -sitting prime minister since Stauning. To the great surprise of many. Maybe for himself too. A bit like the Danish national team in football, who joined a cancellation, found the best in itself and won the gold and honor. Or, as you said, Søren, in your good speech - the ugly duckling that turns into a swan. He was prime minister for a time without bodyguards. Where whiskey was drunk and smoked pipe in the office. And the foundation of the government was clapped down by the man himself, with the bargain and squeezing on a typewriter by the Torpedo brand. It shone out of him that he loved his work. He has said it's hard to become prime minister. He has often stated that it was difficult to stop being prime minister. But to be prime minister. Whether he has briefly said "it's nice," and added, "Everyone should be allowed to try it!" He had a deep understanding of the driving force it gives to have a positive approach. In his last New Year's speech, he said, "The time of wrestling we live in shall not be dusk but dawn." With that reference to an old song - he hit something special in his own time. And in our time today. Not dusk but dawn. Right now we are at the end of a historic crisis. There have been costs for many. But it could have been much worse, and I basically have a great belief in Denmark's resilience. Pessimism, a country that is traging after development, cannot use for anything. Fortunately, it is also not the one that dominates in Denmark. It is with optimism and future faith that we have to look ahead again. Here we can be inspired by Poul Schlüter, who almost had optimism as a principle. He was a musical human being. With humor and joy of life. Who could answer journalists with a disarming counter -question: "What do you think?" One should not cultivate the disagreement. But respect his political opponents. It was his philosophy. Today is Constitution Day. And I can't imagine a more well -chosen day to say goodbye to one of the great oak trees in the forest of democracy. Even today we need a broad democratic space. Across people and attitudes. Not just in politics. But in our entire community. The ability to see a case from several sides. So we can start a joint conversation about the crucial questions. Not split. But conversation. With a look at the balances and nuances. It is the core of democracy. Poul Schlüter had that look. Charming, understated, with a twinkle in the eye. But make no mistake. Poul Schlüter was a strong prime minister. A great human being. In addition, an elegant language artist. I can honestly sometimes miss the warm and the wide in the public debate. There are many good and striking quotes. Now there are no more. The last sentence is set. Poul Schlüter will be missed. Now his place is in our shared history book. Honor to be Poul Schlüter's memory.

topics_dk: Mette Frederiksens tale ved Folketingets afslutningsdebat
speeches_dk: I sidste måned besøgte jeg en erhvervsskole i Hvidovre. Eleverne var tilbage. Det var de glade for. Det er svært at lære at skifte bremser på en bil hjemme fra sofaen uden at have værktøjet mellem hænderne. Eller blive bygningsmaler uden konkret at stå med pensel og malerbøtter. Og det er op ad bakke at lære om strøm og ledninger uden at være til stede fysisk. Også her har coronaen haft konsekvenser. Hvad gør man så? En af lærerne – Daniel Svendsen – underviser på hovedforløbet personvognsmekaniker. Han fortalte – med smittende entusiasme bag mundbindet – at han mødte ind tre kvarter tidligere om morgenen og forventede det samme af sine elever. De, der ville indhente det forsømte, kunne troppe op klokken 7.30. Måske brokkede nogle sig lidt. Men de fleste stod tidligt op og var klar. Ærligt talt, så tabte jeg mit hjerte, da jeg hørte den historie. Det er lærere som Daniel, der skaber vores samfund. Som gør forskellen. Det er den handlekraft, jeg oplever mange steder i Danmark lige nu. En kampgejst. En optimisme. En vilje til at arbejde hårdere for at nå længere. Vi har klaret os godt gennem pandemien. Takket være befolkningens store indsats. Den eminente omstillingsevne i alle dele af samfundet. Erhvervslivet, myndighederne, sundhedsvæsenet. Og det solide samarbejde her i Folketinget om en resolut krisehåndtering. Tak til alle jer her i salen for det. Som fællesskab står Danmark stærkere end i mange år. Vi har gjort det godt. Hvad gør vi nu? Vi kunne vælge at stille os tilfredse. Sige til hinanden, at vi klarede den. Læne os tilbage. Lade udviklingen gå sin gang. Justere lidt hen ad vejen. Den mulighed er der. Men det er ikke den, vi skal vælge. Vi skal gå den modsatte vej. Reformer, innovation, uddannelse, jobskabelse og vækst. Lige nu har vi et bedre udgangspunkt, end nogen turde håbe på i de mørke uger i foråret 2020. Vi har styrken. Nu skal vi finde den politiske vilje. Til forandring. Vores danske håndtering af pandemien viser først og fremmest, at der altid er et valg. Vi valgte rigtigt. Den her gang. Nu skal vi videre. Vi skal bruge den erfaring. Vi tæmmede tigeren. Når vi kan bekæmpe en global pandemi. Fordi vi beslutter os for det. Så kan vi meget mere end det. Tænk, hvis vi går til samfundets andre store udfordringer med samme beslutsomhed. Hvis vi tør stille spørgsmål. Også ved etablerede sandheder. Som for eksempel den påstand, at vi intet kan stille op over for centraliseringen. Eller at uligheden bare stiger. Hvis vi gemmer automatreaktionerne væk. Gør op med de falske modsætninger. Og for eksempel insisterer på, at den grønne omstilling både skal skabe et mere bæredygtigt samfund og skabe arbejdspladser – i stedet for at sende dem ud af landet. Hvis vi for alvor finder modet til at tage fat på de udfordringer, vi har forsøgt at løse i årtier. Den globale klimakrise. Den fejlslagne integration. Bureaukratiet i den offentlige sektor. De unge, der aldrig får en uddannelse. I stedet for at lade os slå ud af, at det har andre forsøgt før os. Så lad os gå til opgaven. Uforfærdede. Med en genvunden tro på, at svaret ikke er givet på forhånd. At politik ikke kun er drift, administration og at skrue lidt på en knap i maskinrummet. Men at politik handler om drømme. Visioner. Håb. Om et stærkere, grønnere og mere retfærdigt Danmark. Vi har en unik mulighed for at bygge videre på det Danmark, som viste sit værd under krisen. Men det kræver, at vi gør som læreren og eleverne på Vestegnen: Står tidligere op. * * * En statsministers tale ved Folketingets afslutningsdebat plejer at se tilbage på folketingsåret.  I år vil jeg gøre det anderledes. Jeg vil se frem. Regeringen forbereder nu et ambitiøst reformprogram. Vi vil øge væksten og velstanden. Gøre Danmark til et både rigere og grønnere samfund. Først og fremmest: Dygtigere. Vi vil sætte reformarbejdet i gang med et 10-årigt perspektiv. Vi kommer til at tage fat på de afgørende strukturelle udfordringer for dansk økonomi og for vores samfund som et hele. Danmark har et stærkt velfærdssamfund. Sådan skal det være. Tryghed og frihed gennem hele livet. Arne fik sin pension. Det er retfærdigt. Vores samfundsmodel er unik. Men velfærdssamfundet kommer ikke af sig selv. Velfærden er betinget af høj beskæftigelse. Det er helt afgørende, at mange mennesker arbejder, at vi er veluddannede, og at virksomhederne har gode vilkår. I dag vil jeg fokusere på tre udfordringer, som er vidt forskellige, men som ved dagens udgang handler om det samme: At flere skal i arbejde. For den enkeltes skyld. At have et arbejde og bidrage til samfundet, er nu engang noget af det vigtigste i et menneskes liv. Og for økonomiens skyld. Høj beskæftigelse er en afgørende forudsætning for fortsat vækst og velstand. Derfor må vi aldrig som samfund opgive mennesker, forvente for lidt og stille for få krav. Det gælder uddannelserne. Hvor for mange unge bliver tabt. Og vi ikke uddanner nok til de jobs, der er brug for. Det gælder på arbejdsmarkedet, som for nogle bliver mere usikkert og mindre organiseret. Og det gælder de desværre for mange mennesker, særligt med ikke-vestlig baggrund, som går derhjemme på kontanthjælp og uden et arbejde at stå op til. * * * Først de unge og uddannelserne. På den ene side en enorm succeshistorie. Stadig flere tager en uddannelse. Stadig flere tager en lang uddannelse. Vores børn bliver dygtigere, end vi selv er. På den anden side en historie om nederlag og modløshed. Alt for sjældent taler vi om de unge, der hverken er i gang med at uddanne sig eller har et job. Hver femte unge står som 25-årig uden en uddannelse. Og næsten 50.000 unge under 25 år og er hverken i uddannelse eller job og har ikke afsluttet en ungdomsuddannelse. Nogle gange bliver de kaldt ”restgruppen”. Egentlig et skrækkeligt ord. En besked til de så mange unge mennesker om, at de blev tilovers. Opgivet af et samfund, hvor alle andre kører videre. Hvis nogle af jer unge ser med i dag: Vi har brug for jer. Det er ikke jer, der er det dårlige selskab. Det er ikke jer, der har en svag karakter. Det er os andre, der har en billig fantasi. Fordi vi i alt for mange år har accepteret dén ulighed. At nogle står udenfor. Når vi taler om ulighed, er der ofte et snævert fokus på de økonomiske forskelle. Og økonomisk ulighed er selvsagt vigtigt. Og det bekymrer også mig, at de forskelle vokser – at toppen stikker af. Men uligheden. I sundhed – og i uddannelse. Den begrænser. Den indskrænker. Den holder tilbage. Den er uretfærdig. Den er forkert. For nogle år siden besøgte jeg VUC i Struer. Jeg talte med en gruppe af yngre kvinder. Flere af dem enlige mødre. Nogle af dem måtte køre langt i bil for at komme til undervisning. Og ligeså langt hjem igen, når de skulle hente børn. De tog en uddannelse på trods. De havde én eneste forudsætning: Deres viljestyrke. Men på et tidspunkt. Hvis det bliver for svært at uddanne sig. For eksempel fordi der bliver for langt derhen. Så vil flere give op. Jeg nævner det, fordi jeg synes, at det perspektiv har manglet i den diskussion, der har været i kølvandet på regeringens forslag om at udflytte uddannelser. Det er ikke en kamp mellem uddannelser eller mellem land og by. Jeg har selv en lang, videregående uddannelse. Vi har brug for stærke studie- og forskningsmiljøer. For dygtige videnskabsmænd og -kvinder, for højtuddannede specialister, for videnarbejdere. Samtidig har vi altså også brug for, at man kan bo og uddanne sig i hele Danmark. Det kræver, at vi tør træffe politiske valg. Som ikke alle steder vil være lige populære. Men alternativet er, at en skæv udvikling – som ingen politikere i øvrigt nogensinde har spurgt danskerne, om de er enige i – får lov at fortsætte. At centraliseringen løber os over ende. Det skal vi ikke tillade. Vi skal vende udviklingen. Det skal vi også på et andet punkt. Allerede nu er situationen, at vi ikke i tilstrækkelig grad uddanner til de jobs, der er i både den offentlige og den private sektor. Det er ikke alene et problem for den virksomhed, der ikke kan skaffe smede og elektrikere til produktionen. Eller det plejehjem, der mangler en sosu-assistent til at tage nattevagterne. Det er et problem for os alle sammen. Det risikerer at hæmme væksten. Bremse fremgangen. Spænde ben for den fremtid, der ellers tegner lys. Vi risikerer at komme til at mangle arbejdskraft. Givetvis allerede i år, fordi det går så godt for dansk økonomi. Og det vil blive et større problem for hvert år, der går. Særligt faglært arbejdskraft. Hvorfor er det et stort problem? Lad mig illustrere det med den grønne omstilling. Danmark har medvind på den grønne dagsorden. Vi viser verden, at en grøn omstilling ikke sker på bekostning af samfundets udvikling. Men tværtimod udvikler samfundet. Skaber vækst. Og lokale arbejdspladser. Klima og miljø er det område, hvor Danmark kan gøre den absolut største forskel for klodens fremtid. Vi har et forspring og en mulighed for, at fremtidens grønne løsninger og teknologier bliver udviklet her i Danmark. I efteråret indgik vi et unikt grønt strategisk partnerskab med Indien. For få dage siden styrkede vi vores strategiske partnerskab med Sydkorea, og danske virksomheder indgik flere nye grønne aftaler. I efteråret vil der komme en satsning på det tyske marked. Så snart det bliver muligt, vil jeg sætte mig i spidsen for et grønt erhvervsfremstød til USA. Og i EU har vi besluttet, at den økonomiske genopretning efter corona skal være både grøn og digital. Der er nu afsat flere tusind milliarder offentlige kroner til grøn genopretning i hele Europa. Her er gode muligheder for danske løsninger. Dem skal vi gribe. Til november er Storbritannien vært for det globale klimatopmøde - COP26 i Glasgow. Her vil der også blive lagt mærke til Danmark. Vi gør meget herhjemme. Men i virkeligheden er Danmarks fingeraftryk ude i verden langt større end det. Vi leverer grønne løsninger inden for energi og energieffektivitet til de største lande: USA, Kina og Indien. Aldrig har vi stået stærkere. Men vi risikerer, at vi ikke kan høste gevinsterne af Danmarks grønne forspring, hvis vi mangler faglærte. Vi har brug for vindmølleteknikere til at bygge og servicere vindmøller. Elektrikere til at opstille ladestandere. Tømrere og murere til at klimarenovere bygninger og anlæg. VVS’ere til at opstille varmepumper. Automationsteknikere til at udvikle anlæg til produktion af grøn brint i Kolding. Mekanikere til at samle gearkasser på vindmøllerne på Lindøværftet på Fyn. Smede til et nyt bioraffinaderi i Hirtshals. Ja, ernæringsassistenter til at varetage den bæredygtige omstilling i de professionelle køkkener. Den grønne omstilling kræver faglært arbejdskraft. Det samme gør omstilling og fremgang inden for andre vigtige styrkepositioner: Medicinalindustrien og fødevareerhvervet. Men virkeligheden er, at store årgange af faglærte går på pension i de kommende år. Og vi har ikke nok nyuddannede til at erstatte dem alle. Kun hver femte elev, der forlader grundskolen, søger direkte ind på en erhvervsuddannelse. Det er langt fra det mål, som et bredt flertal i Folketinget har sat. Og det er næppe en ny reform af erhvervsuddannelserne, der kommer til at løse det problem. Vi har forsøgt. Skiftende regeringer. Det blev til små hop på stedet. Jeg tror, vi er nødt til at tage hul på en mere grundlæggende diskussion af vores uddannelser. For nogle børn er vores skole blevet for akademisk. Alt for teoretisk. Det begynder allerede i grundskolen. På den første skoledag møder alle børn ind med ny skoletaske på ryggen og gåpåmod i hjertet. Det er ikke alle, der forlader skolegården med samme energi og glæde. Langt fra. Vi kender dem alle sammen. Drengen, der ikke kan sidde stille. Pigen – ja, det kan også være en pige – der ikke kan få bogstaverne til at give mening på linjen i kladdehæftet. Er sandheden måske den, at selvom vi på mange måder har en god skole. Så passer den ikke lige godt til alle? Måske skal vi lade nogle børn starte senere? Måske skal de, der bliver mest skoletrætte, gå i skole på en anden måde? Med bedre mulighed for at komme ud på en arbejdsplads undervejs? Få en tilknytning til arbejdsmarkedet tidligere? Som jeg ser det – og her kommer jeg til en positiv pointe – så har vores erhvervsskoler lige nu en kæmpe mulighed. Danmarks ungdom er dybt engagerede i klimakampen. Erhvervsskolerne kan tilbyde de unge uddannelser, hvor de kan gøre en forskel. En stolthed ved at bruge sit fag til at løse fremtidens problemer. De faglærte bliver den grønne omstillings kernetropper. Erhvervsuddannelserne er løftestangen for den grønne omstilling. Vi skal bygge broen mellem klima-kampen og de unges uddannelsesvalg. * * * Den næste udfordring handler om vores arbejdsmarked. På mange måder et velreguleret arbejdsmarked. Ordentlige løn- og arbejdsvilkår. En økonomisk sikkerhed, hvis man i en periode mister sit arbejde. Sådan er det for de fleste. Men ikke for alle. I dag er det næsten hver tredje, som ikke arbejder i en fast fuldtidsstilling. Løst ansatte, tilkaldevikarer, platformsarbejdere, nultimekontrakter, ulønnet praktik. Det kan være tjenere eller chauffører. Men det kan også være unge arkitekter, journalister eller kunstnere. Og flere andre. Og der kan ligge mange årsager bag. Men der er en bagside. Blandt andet for unge, der lige er på vej ind i arbejdslivet. Usikker indkomst. Ingen eller ringe pensionsordninger. Dårlige barselsvilkår. Ingen efteruddannelse. Ringe dækning ved arbejdsskader. Vi ved, hvor sårbart det kan være for den enkelte. Hvor galt det kan gå, når uheldet er ude. Hvis man har mistet sit arbejde og sin indkomst fra den ene dag til den anden – og ikke bliver grebet. Den danske model er i høj grad bygget til lønmodtagerne på fuldtid. Men realiteten er, at arbejdsmarkedet ændrer sig. Selvfølgelig. Og den danske model skal følge med. Som den har gjort det før. For hvis udviklingen løber fra os, så kan en stadig større gruppe komme til at stå udenfor. Alle dem, der arbejder på andre måder, end vi har været vant til. Corona-krisen har vist, at mange har det, vi tidligere kaldte atypiske ansættelser. Måske noget som lønmodtager. Noget som selvstændigt. Noget midt i mellem. Ikke mindst på kulturområdet. Når det atypiske bliver typisk, udfordrer det os på en helt anden måde. Derfor skal vi have løst den udfordring: At vi er klar til at gribe fremtiden. Give vores virksomheder muligheder for at finde nye forretningsmodeller. Tiltrække investeringer. Men samtidig, at grundlaget for den danske model er et velorganiseret arbejdsmarked. Barsel og pension. Arbejdsmiljø og en ordentlig løn. Og som samfund har vi brug for vores unikke danske model, hvor arbejdsmarkedets parter tager et stort medansvar. Tænk bare på de 17 trepartsaftaler, som blev indgået under cornakrisen. Tak til fagforeningerne og arbejdsgiverne for den indsats. * * * Den danske befolkning har en stærk tilknytning til arbejdsmarkedet. Og de fleste unge tager en uddannelse. Hvis man stiller ti danskere mellem 18 og 59 år op på række, så har de otte et job eller er i gang med en uddannelse. Der er mange til at løfte. Sådan skal det være. Ellers hænger økonomien og samfundskontrakten ikke sammen. Men sådan er det ikke for en del af befolkningen, der har rødder i andre, primært ikke-vestlige, lande. Især ikke for kvinderne. Det er den tredje store udfordring, jeg vil uddybe i dag. Ud af ti kvinder med baggrund i Mellemøsten, Nordafrika, Afghanistan, Pakistan eller Tyrkiet er der kun fire, som er i arbejde. Kun fire ud af ti. Fra den her talerstol har statsminister efter statsminister sagt, at flere indvandrerkvinder skal i arbejde. Uden at problemet er løst. Nu stiller jeg mig op i rækken. Med bevidstheden om, at det kræver svære beslutninger. Og med det håb, at Folketinget vil tage et ansvar på sig. Det er ikke nok at sige nej. Fordi vi nu gennem årtier har accepteret, at mange kvinder med indvandrerbaggrund er derhjemme i stedet for at have et job uden for hjemmet – så skal det ikke blive ved med at være sådan. Der har været for stor fokus på alt det, man har ret til i Danmark. Og for lidt fokus på alt det, man har pligt til. Det siger jeg ikke mindst i forhold til den diskussion, der står foran os omkring ydelserne. I stedet for kun at fokusere på, hvordan vi indretter kontanthjælpssystemet. Så handler det først som sidst om at få folk i arbejde. Derfor: Hvad om vi vender hele tankegangen? Og lægger til grund, at alle voksne selvfølgelig kan bidrage med en egentlig arbejdsindsats. At samfundet udtrykker den forventning – klart. Vi står for foden af et opsving. Det er nu, vi har muligheden for at give flere mennesker et fodfæste på arbejdsmarkedet. Insistere på, at når man har fået ophold i Danmark, så skal man selvfølgelig forsørge sig selv. Og hvis det i en periode alligevel ikke kan lade sig gøre, vil regeringen foreslå, at man – til gengæld for sin ydelse – som det helt klare udgangspunkt får pligt til at bidrage med, hvad der svarer til en almindelig arbejdsuge på 37 timer. Møder man ikke op, når man skal, får man ikke sin betaling. Vi vil indføre den arbejdslogik. * * * Fremtidens Danmark skal bygges nu. Vi skal være hænder og hoveder nok – og dygtige nok – til at løse opgaverne i samfundet. De reformer, regeringen vil fremlægge, vil kræve meget af os alle sammen. Men vi har også meget at vinde. Når vi ser fem-ti år frem, vil den digitale revolution forandre arbejdsmarkedet og virksomhederne. Det vil stille nye krav til vores uddannelser. Efterspørgslen på grønne løsninger vil stige. Der åbner sig nye og attraktive markeder. Den fremtid ligger godt til Danmark.  Vores stærke position på digitalisering skal understøttes af en ny digitaliseringsstrategi for både det private og det offentlige. Og en langsigtet, bred og ambitiøs plan for at imødegå cybertruslen. De stolte produktionsvirksomheder, der skaber arbejdspladser herhjemme – i alle dele af landet – ved at sælge dansk topkvalitet ude i verden: I skal have de bedste vilkår. Danmark var, er og skal fortsat være et produktionsland. Ligesom Danmark er rigt på små selvstændige servicevirksomheder. Og jer – der har skabt en lille virksomhed fra bunden – måske har et par ansatte. Det har ikke været let under pandemien. Og hold da op, hvor I fortjener mere anerkendelse, end I får til hverdag. I er en afgørende del af vores erhvervsstruktur. Regeringen vil se bredt på at styrke Danmarks konkurrencekraft. Ny viden og erhvervsliv skal knyttes tættere sammen. Derfor har vi øget forsknings- og udviklingsfradraget for virksomhederne. Hævet de grønne forskningsmidler markant. Erhvervspolitikken står helt centralt i regeringens økonomisk politik. Fremtidens teknologier. Eksporten. Arbejdspladserne. Vi herhjemme lever af alt det, I udretter i verden.  Heldigvis er flere lande ved at ryste coronaens åg af skuldrene. Eksportmarkederne er på vej tilbage. Danske virksomheder skal være klar. Det er nu, det gælder. Og vi har et solidt udgangspunkt for at komme videre. Vi valgte at føre en konsekvent krisepolitik. En ekspansiv finanspolitik. Og en politik, som i al væsentlighed er anderledes end den, der blev ført efter finanskrisen. Det var klogt. Nu ser vi resultaterne. Dansk økonomi har klaret sig godt gennem krisen. Arbejdsløsheden er faldet siden genåbningen. Forbruget stiger. Eksporten vokser. Og næste år forventer vi den højeste økonomiske vækst – i femten år. Samtidig havde Danmark i 2020 – på trods af coronakrisen – det relativt set laveste underskud på de offentlige finanser i hele EU. Og Danmark har stadig den højeste internationale kreditvurdering – AAA-rating. Den økonomiske politik er ansvarlig. Der vil stadig være udgifter til at holde smitten nede. Til vacciner, når vi forventeligt skal vaccineres igen. Og måske igen. Investeringer i vores beredskab. Og til test, hvis det er nødvendigt. Der vil stadig være behov for målrettet hjælp til nogle brancher. Et fagligt efterslæb, der skal indhentes. Men det står samtidig klart nu. At der ikke er behov for en egentlig økonomisk genopretning ovenpå corona Derfor er opgaven en anden. Vi skal investere. Gøre Danmark stærkere. At vi kan det – skyldes de beslutninger, vi har truffet sammen. Under pandemien har 330.000 mennesker været hjemsendt med lønkompensation. Virksomhederne har bidraget med noget af lønudgiften. Medarbejderne med feriedage. Og indtil nu har staten udbetalt 17 milliarder kroner til lønkompensation. Til gengæld har mange mennesker undgået en fyreseddel. De udgifter, det ville have medført. Til dagpenge, kontanthjælp. For ikke at tale om de menneskelige omkostninger. Risikoen for at miste fodfæste på arbejdsmarkedet. De omkostninger havde været større for samfundet. Og virksomhederne. De har nu den fordel, at de ikke skal ud at ansætte nye folk. Ikke oplære forfra. De har stadig erfarne medarbejdere. Vi har allerede nu en konkurrencefordel over for mange andre lande. Det forspring skal vi udnytte og skabe det, der kan blive et helt unikt væksteventyr. Dansk erhvervsliv er klar til at rykke. Det skal hele Danmark være. Dét er den primære opgave nu. I dag har jeg taget fat på tre vigtige samfundsudfordringer. Regeringen vil præsentere sit bud på flere vigtige udfordringer i løbet af sommeren. Vi vil bruge tid på at dvæle ved udfordringerne og finde de mest bæredygtige svar. I samarbejde med hele samfundet. Vi kommer ikke til at hævde, at vi har alle svarene. Men vi vil finde dem. Sammen. Jeg håber, at alle vil tage del i debatten. * * * Et andet område, hvor vi inviterer til et endnu tættere samarbejde er i rigsfællesskabet. Interessen for Arktis og Nordatlanten stiger. I rigsfællesskabet har vi et fælles mål om lavspænding i Arktis. Lige nu er den målsætning under pres. Det forholder vi os til – sammen. Jeg glæder mig over, at vi er enige om, at vi skal passe på vores åbne og demokratiske samfund. Og om, at vi skal sætte værn op mod dem, der ikke vil os det godt. Fundamentet for vores sikkerhed udgøres af samarbejdet med USA og i NATO. Noget alle parter i rigsfællesskabet havde lejlighed til at drøfte med USA’s udenrigsminister Blinken, da han besøgte Danmark for nylig. Men i den nuværende sikkerhedspolitiske virkelighed er truslerne sjældent entydige. De går ofte på tværs af politikområder. Det betyder også, at det bliver vanskeligere at skelne mellem det, der er færøsk og grønlandsk ansvar. Og det, der er dansk ansvar. Det stiller krav om endnu tættere dialog og samarbejde om udenrigs-, sikkerheds- og forsvarspolitiske spørgsmål. Det inviterer regeringen til. Jeg ser frem til fortsat at udvikle samarbejdet i rigsfællesskabet – i tæt dialog med både Færøernes landsstyre og Grønlands nye Naalakkersuisut. Og sammen med de nordatlantiske medlemmer her i Folketinget. Tak til jer for et godt samarbejde. Og så glæder jeg mig selvfølgelig til et gensyn med Færøerne og Grønland, så snart situationen tillader det. * * * Siden regeringen trådte til for næsten to år siden, har vi indgået 185 aftaler hen over midten her i Folketinget. Aftaler om grøn omstilling. Om økonomi. Om velfærd. Og om håndteringen af pandemien. Tak til alle jer partier her i salen for det gode og brede samarbejde. Danmark stod samlet, da det gjaldt. Og en særlig tak til SF. Radikale Venstre. Enhedslisten. For to år siden satte vi os ned sammen og skrev vores fælles vision for en ny retfærdig retning for Danmark. Tænk, at det kun er to år siden. Der er sket en hel del på de to år. Og her tænker jeg ikke kun på corona. Vi lovede hinanden, at vi ville gå forrest i kampen mod klimakrisen. Vi satte et mål, som nogle kaldte urealistisk. Men som har vist sig at blive den ambition, der driver en grøn omstilling fremad i hele samfundet. Energiøer. Arbejde med CO2-skat. En natur- og biodiversitetspakke. Stop for olie i Nordsøen. Tredobling af afgiften på bæreposer og engangsservice. Genanvendelse af affald. Flere elbiler. Senest har vi foreslået skærpede regler for miljøzoner i byerne. Listen over initiativer er lang. Der var længe en diskussion om ”hockeystaven”. At vi først tæt på 2030 skulle træffe de svære beslutninger. Her – kun ét år efter, at vi vedtog klimaloven – har vi allerede truffet beslutninger, som, sammen med landsbrugsudspillet og erhvervslivets beslutninger, bringer os næsten halvdelen af vejen. Halvdelen! Og vi har indgået en ambitiøs aftale om et mål i 2025. Hvis der nogensinde var en hockeystav. Så kan vi vist godt konstatere, at den er knækket. Vi lovede at styrke vores velfærd. Det er en stor opgave. Men vi er i gang. Minimumsnormeringer. 1000 nye sygeplejersker. Løft af psykiatrien. Kommunale budgetter med mere plads til velfærd. Bedre rettigheder og mere tryghed til udsatte børn. Og pengene følger med, når der bliver flere børn og ældre. Vi har leveret en milliardinvestering i uddannelse. Vi har afskaffet omprioriteringsbidraget. Gjort op med uddannelsesloftet. Afsat penge til flere lærere i folkeskolen. Investeret i opkvalificering og efteruddannelse af ufaglærte. I bedre ungdomsuddannelser. Og flere studiepladser på velfærdsuddannelserne under corona. Dertil er der sat gang i oprensning af generationsforureninger. Bedre barselsvilkår for selvstændige. Og at sex selvfølgelig altid skal være baseret på samtykke. Det skrev vi i forståelsespapiret. Nu står det i loven. Der er meget at være stolte over. * * * Danmark står stærkt. Men vi kan endnu mere. Vi skal huske, hvordan Danmark er blevet et af verdens rigeste og tryggeste lande. I efterkrigstiden tog erhvervsudviklingen fart. Industrien voksede. Danske virksomheder kom ud på eksportmarkederne. Kvinderne strømmede ud på arbejdsmarkedet. Alt det var muligt, fordi vi som samfund besluttede at investere i velfærd, i uddannelse, i mennesker. Ud fra en fælles erkendelse af, at når vi er flere til at trække. Og dygtigere til at yde. Så bliver samfundskagen større. I 1990’erne banede en offensiv erhvervspolitik vejen for nye arbejdspladser. En aktiv arbejdsmarkedspolitik med fokus på ret og pligt fik flere i arbejde. Mere efteruddannelse betød, at flere kunne bestride de nye jobs. Og en fremsynet miljøpolitik lagde de første sten til Danmarks grønne eventyr. Nu skal vi sammen skrive det næste store kapitel om vores land. Vi kan vende afvikling til udvikling. Hensigter til handlinger. Politik betyder noget. Det har vi vist. Vi skal tage ansvaret på os og udfordre os selv og hinanden. Gennemføre omfattende investeringer i Danmarks fremtid. En høj andel af befolkningen, som arbejder. Uddannelser til samfundets behov. Et erhvervsliv i omstilling og med udsyn til verden. Jeg vil ønske Folketinget og alle andre i Danmark en velfortjent sommerferie, når vi kommer dertil. Det varer lidt endnu. Efter sommerferien får vi igen travlt. Jeg håber, at mange vil byde ind til det omfattende reformarbejde, vi nu går i gang med. Vi skal træffe de beslutninger, der vil stille Danmark så stærkt som overhovedet muligt. Hvor vi er som samfund om ti år. Det bestemmer vi selv.
topics_EN: Mette Frederiksen's speech at the Folketing's closing debate
speeches_EN: Last month I visited a business school in Hvidovre. The students were back. They were happy about that. It's hard to learn how to change brakes on a car at home from the couch without having the tool between your hands. Or become a building painter without concrete to stand with brush and paint buckets. And it is uphill to learn about power and wires without being physically present. Here, too, the corona has had consequences. Then what do you do? One of the teachers - Daniel Svendsen - teaches on the main course of passenger car mechanic. He told - with infectious enthusiasm behind his mouth - that he met three blocks earlier in the morning and expected the same from his students. Those who would catch up on the neglected could step up at 7.30. Maybe some people complained a little. But most people got up early and were ready. Honestly, I lost my heart when I heard that story. It is teachers like Daniel who create our society. Which makes the difference. It is the power of action I experience in many places in Denmark right now. A fighting spirit. An optimism. A willingness to work harder to reach longer. We have done well through the pandemic. Thanks to the great efforts of the population. The eminent adaptability in all parts of society. Business, authorities, health care. And the solid cooperation here in the Folketing on a resolute crisis management. Thanks to all of you here in the hall for that. As a community, Denmark stands stronger than for many years. We've done well. What do we do now? We could choose to be satisfied. Say to each other that we managed it. Lean back. Let the development go its way. Adjust a little along the way. That option is there. But that's not the one we have to choose. We need to go the opposite way. Reforms, innovation, education, job creation and growth. Right now we have a better starting point than anyone dared to hope for in the dark weeks of the spring of 2020. We have the strength. Now we have to find the political will. For change. Our Danish handling of the pandemic shows first and foremost that there is always a choice. We chose right. This time. Now we have to move on. We need that experience. We tamed the tiger. When we can fight a global pandemic. Because we decide on it. Then we can do much more than that. Imagine if we go to the other major challenges of society with the same determination. If we dare ask questions. Also by established truths. Like, for example, the claim that we can do nothing against centralization. Or that inequality just rises. If we save the automatic reactions away. Make up with the false contradictions. And, for example, insists that the green transition should both create a more sustainable society and create jobs - instead of sending them out of the country. If we really find the courage to address the challenges we have been trying to solve for decades. The global climate crisis. The failed integration. The bureaucracy in the public sector. The young people who never get an education. Instead of letting us strike out that others have tried before us. So let's go to the task. Unmistled. With a recovered belief that the answer is not given in advance. That politics is not just operation, administration and to turn a little on a button in the engine room. But that politics is about dreams. Visions. Hope. About a stronger, greener and fairer Denmark. We have a unique opportunity to build on the Denmark that showed its worth during the crisis. But it requires us to do as the teacher and the students at Vestegnen: Standing up earlier. * * * A Prime Minister's Speech at the Folketing's closing debate usually look back on the parliamentary year. This year I will do it differently. I will look forward. The government is now preparing an ambitious reform program. We will increase growth and prosperity. Make Denmark a richer and greener society. First and foremost: more proficient. We will start the reform work with a 10-year perspective. We are going to address the crucial structural challenges for the Danish economy and for our society as a whole. Denmark has a strong welfare society. Thats how it should be. Security and freedom throughout life. Arne got his pension. It's fair. Our social model is unique. But the welfare society does not come by itself. Welfare is contingent on high employment. It is crucial that many people work, that we are well educated and that companies have good conditions. Today I will focus on three challenges that are vastly different, but which at the end of the day are about the same: that more people have to work. For the sake of the individual. Having a job and contributing to society is now one of the most important things in a person's life. And for the sake of the economy. High employment is a crucial prerequisite for continued growth and prosperity. Therefore, as a society, we must never abandon people, expect too little and make too few demands. This applies to the programs. Where too many young people are lost. And we don't train enough for the jobs needed. This is true in the labor market, which for some becomes more uncertain and less organized. And unfortunately, they apply to many people, especially with non-Western background, which goes home on cash assistance and without a job to stand up to. * * * First the young and education. On the one hand a huge success story. More and more people are taking an education. More and more people are taking a long education. Our children become more proficient than we ourselves are. On the other hand, a story of defeat and discouragement. Too rarely are we talking about the young people who are neither in the process of educating themselves nor have a job. Every fifth young people stand as a 25-year-old without an education. And almost 50,000 young people under 25 and are neither in education nor jobs and has not completed a youth education. Sometimes they are called the "residual group". Really a terrible word. A message to the so many young people that they were left over. Abandoned by a society where everyone else is moving on. If some of you young people watch today: We need you. It is not you who are the bad company. It is not you who have a weak character. It is us others who have a cheap fantasy. Because we have accepted that inequality for too many years. That some are standing outside. When we talk about inequality, there is often a narrow focus on the financial differences. And economic inequality is of course important. And it also worries me that the differences are growing - that the top is rising. But inequality. In health - and in education. It limits. It restricts. It holds back. It's unfair. It's wrong. A few years ago I visited VUC in Struer. I was talking to a group of younger women. Several of them single mothers. Some of them had to drive far by car to get to teaching. And just as far back home when they had to pick up children. They took an education despite. They had a single prerequisite: their willpower. But at some point. If it becomes too difficult to educate. For example, because there is too far there. Then more will give up. I mention it because I think that perspective has been lacking in the discussion that has been in the wake of the government's proposal to relocate education. It is not a struggle between education or between country and city. I myself have a long, higher education. We need strong study and research environments. For skilled scientists and women, for highly educated specialists, for knowledge workers. At the same time, we also need to live and educate throughout Denmark. It requires that we dare to make political choices. As not all places will be equally popular. But the alternative is that a skewed development - which no politicians have ever asked the Danes if they agree - will be allowed to continue. That centralization runs us over end. We should not allow that. We must reverse the development. We must also at another point. Already, the situation is that we do not adequately train for the jobs that are in both the public and the private sectors. It is not only a problem for the company that cannot provide blacksmiths and electricians for production. Or the nursing home that lacks a sosu assistant to take the night guards. It's a problem for all of us. It risks inhibiting growth. Slow down progress. Tightening legs for the future that otherwise draws light. We risk getting missing labor. Of course already this year, because it is going so well for the Danish economy. And it will be a bigger problem for each year that goes. Particularly skilled labor. Why is that a big problem? Let me illustrate it with the green transition. Denmark has headwinds on the green agenda. We show the world that a green transition does not happen at the expense of society's development. But on the contrary, society develops. Creates growth. And local workplaces. Climate and the environment are the area where Denmark can make the absolute biggest difference for the future of the globe. We have a lead and an opportunity for the green solutions and technologies of the future to be developed here in Denmark. In the fall we entered into a unique green strategic partnership with India. A few days ago we strengthened our strategic partnership with South Korea, and Danish companies entered into several new green agreements. In the fall there will be a bet in the German market. As soon as possible, I will be at the forefront of a green business promotion to the United States. And in the EU we have decided that the financial recovery after Corona should be both green and digital. Thousands of billions of public dollars have now been allocated for green recovery throughout Europe. Here are good opportunities for Danish solutions. We have to seize them. For November, the UK hosts the global climate summit - COP26 in Glasgow. Here, Denmark will also be noticed. We do a lot at home. But in reality, Denmark's fingerprints around the world are far greater than that. We provide green solutions in energy and energy efficiency to the largest countries: USA, China and India. Never have we been stronger. But we risk that we cannot harvest the winnings of Denmark's green lead if we lack skilled workers. We need wind turbine technicians to build and service wind turbines. Electricians to set up charging stations. Carpenters and masons to climate -renovate buildings and facilities. Plumbing to set up heat pumps. Automation technicians to develop plants for the production of green hydrogen in Kolding. Mechanics to collect gearboxes on the wind turbines at the Lindø yard on Funen. Blacksmiths for a new biorefinery in Hirtshals. Yes, nutrition assistants to handle the sustainable transition in the professional kitchens. The green transition requires skilled labor. The same is true of transition and progress in other important positions of strength: the pharmaceutical industry and the food industry. But the reality is that great vintages of skilled workers retire in the coming years. And we don't have enough new graduates to replace them all. Only every fifth student leaving primary school searches directly into a vocational education. This is far from the goal that a broad majority in the Folketing has set. And it is hardly a new reform of vocational education that is going to solve that problem. We have tried. Changing governments. It turned into small jumps on site. I think we need to start a more basic discussion of our education. For some children, our school has become too academic. Too theoretically. It already begins in elementary school. On the first day of school, all children meet with a new school bag on their backs and walking in the heart. Not everyone leaves the school yard with the same energy and joy. Far from. We all know them. The boy who can't sit still. The girl - yes, it can also be a girl - who can't make the letters make sense on the line in the draft booklet. Is the truth perhaps that although we have a good school in many ways. So doesn't it fit well with everyone? Maybe we should let some kids start later? Maybe those who become the most school -weary should go to school in a different way? With a better opportunity to get out to a workplace along the way? Get an affiliation with the labor market earlier? As I see it - and here I come to a positive point - our business schools right now have a huge opportunity. Denmark's youth is deeply engaged in the climate fight. Business schools can offer the young education where they can make a difference. A pride in using his profession to solve the problems of the future. The skilled workers become the green transition core troops. Vocational education is the lever for the green transition. We must build the bridge between the climate struggle and the young people's educational choices. * * * The next challenge is about our labor market. In many ways a well -regulated labor market. Proper pay and working conditions. A financial security if you lose your job for a period of time. This is how it is for most people. But not for everyone. Today, almost every third is not working in a fixed full -time position. Resolved employees, callers, platform workers, zero contracts, unpaid internship. It may be servants or drivers. But it can also be young architects, journalists or artists. And several others. And there can be many causes behind. But there is a back. Among other things, for young people who are just heading into working life. Uncertain income. No or poor pension schemes. Bad maternity conditions. No continuing education. Poor coverage of work injuries. We know how vulnerable it can be for the individual. How wrong it can go when the accident is out. If you have lost your work and your income from one day to the next - and are not gripped. The Danish model is largely built for full -time employees. But the reality is that the labor market is changing. Of course. And the Danish model must follow. As it has done it before. Because if the development is running away from us, then an ever larger group may stand outside. All those who work in other ways than we have been used to. The Corona crisis has shown that many have what we previously called atypical hires. Maybe something as an employee. Something like independent. Something in the middle. Not least in the field of culture. When the atypical becomes typical, it challenges us in a completely different way. Therefore, we must have solved that challenge: That we are ready to seize the future. Give our companies opportunities to find new business models. Attract investments. But at the same time, the foundation of the Danish model is a well -organized labor market. Maternity and Pension. Work environment and a proper salary. And as a society, we need our unique Danish model, where the social partners take a great deal of co -responsibility. Just think of the 17 tripartite agreements that were entered into during the corna crisis. Thanks to the unions and employers for that effort. * * * The Danish population has a strong connection to the labor market. And most young people take an education. If you set up ten Danes between the ages of 18 and 59, they have eight a job or are in the process of education. There are many to lift. Thats how it should be. Otherwise, the economy and the social contract are not related. But this is not the case for a part of the population that has roots in others, primarily non-Western countries. Especially not for the women. It is the third major challenge I want to elaborate today. Out of ten women with a background in the Middle East, North Africa, Afghanistan, Pakistan or Turkey, only four are in work. Only four out of ten. From this pulpit, prime minister after Prime Minister has said that more immigrant women are going to work. Without the problem being resolved. Now I stand up in the series. With the awareness that it requires difficult decisions. And with the hope that the Folketing will take responsibility. It's not enough to say no. Because we have now accepted for decades that many women with immigrant backgrounds are at home instead of having a job outside the home - so it shouldn't keep being like that. There has been too much focus on everything that is entitled to in Denmark. And too little focus on everything you have a duty. I say that not least in relation to the discussion that is ahead of us about the services. Instead of focusing only on how we design the cash assistance system. Then, like last, it's about getting people to work. Therefore: What if we turn the whole mindset? And assumes that all adults can of course contribute to an actual work effort. That society expresses that expectation - clearly. We stand at the foot of a recovery. It is now that we have the opportunity to give more people a foothold in the labor market. Insist that when you have been staying in Denmark, you must of course support yourself. And if for a period of time it is not possible, the government will suggest that - in return for its service - as the clear starting point will be obliged to contribute what corresponds to a regular work week of 37 hours. If you do not meet when you have to, you do not get your payment. We will introduce that work logic. * * * The future of Denmark must be built now. We need to be hands and heads enough - and skilled enough - to solve the tasks in the community. The reforms the government will present will require much of us all. But we also have a lot to win. When we see five to ten years ahead, the digital revolution will change the labor market and businesses. It will make new requirements for our education. The demand for green solutions will increase. New and attractive markets are opening up. That future is good for Denmark. Our strong position on digitization must be supported by a new digitization strategy for both the private and the public. And a long -term, broad and ambitious plan to counter the cyber threat. The proud production companies that create jobs at home - in all parts of the country - by selling Danish top quality around the world: You must have the best conditions. Denmark was, is and must continue to be a production country. Just as Denmark is rich in small independent service companies. And you - who have created a small business from scratch - may have a few employees. It has not been easy during the pandemic. And then stop where you deserve more recognition than you get everyday. You are a crucial part of our business structure. The government will look broadly at strengthening Denmark's competitiveness. New knowledge and business must be linked closer. That is why we have increased the research and development deduction for the companies. Raised the green research funding significantly. Business policy is central to the government's economic policy. The technologies of the future. Exports. The workplaces. We at home live by all that you do in the world. Fortunately, several countries are shaking the Corona's yoke off his shoulders. The export markets are on their way back. Danish companies must be ready. It is now that it applies. And we have a solid starting point to move on. We chose to pursue a consistent crisis policy. An expansive fiscal policy. And a policy that is essentially different from the one that was led after the financial crisis. It was wise. Now we see the results. The Danish economy has done well through the crisis. Unemployment has fallen since the reopening. Consumption is rising. Exports are growing. And next year we expect the highest economic growth - in fifteen years. At the same time, in 2020 - despite the corona crisis - Denmark had the relatively lowest deficit on public finances throughout the EU. And Denmark still has the highest international credit rating-AAA rating. Economic policy is responsible. There will still be expenses to keep the infection down. For vaccines when we are expected to be vaccinated again. And maybe again. Investments in our readiness. And to test if needed. There will still be a need for targeted help with some industries. A professional backlog that needs to be obtained. But at the same time it is clear now. That there is no need for an actual financial recovery on top of Corona therefore the task is another. We need to invest. Make Denmark stronger. That we can - is due to the decisions we have made together. During the pandemic, 330,000 people have been returned with salary compensation. The companies have contributed some of the salary expenses. The employees with holiday days. And so far, the state has paid out DKK 17 billion for salary compensation. In turn, many people have avoided a guy's note. The expenses it would have resulted in. For unemployment benefit, cash assistance. Not to mention the human costs. The risk of losing a foothold in the labor market. Those costs had been greater for society. And the companies. They now have the advantage that they are not going to hire new people. Not training from the front. They still have experienced employees. We already have a competitive advantage to many other countries. We need to exploit that lead and create what can become a truly unique growth adventure. Danish business is ready to move. It must be all of Denmark. That is the primary task now. Today I have addressed three important societal challenges. The government will present its bid for several important challenges during the summer. We will spend time dwelling on the challenges and finding the most sustainable answers. In collaboration with the entire community. We are not going to claim that we have all the answers. But we will find them. Together. I hope everyone will take part in the debate. * * * Another area where we invite to an even closer cooperation is in the Kingdom community. The interest in the Arctic and the North Atlantic is rising. In the Kingdom community we have a common goal of low voltage in the Arctic. Right now, that goal is under pressure. We relate to that - together. I am delighted that we agree that we must look after our open and democratic communities. And that we need to put up protection against those who do not want us well. The foundation of our security is made up of cooperation with the US and in NATO. Something all parties in the national community had the opportunity to discuss with the US Secretary of State Blink when he recently visited Denmark. But in the current security policy reality, the threats are rarely clear. They often go across policy areas. It also means that it becomes more difficult to distinguish between what is Faroese and Greenlandic responsibilities. And what is Danish responsibility. It requires even closer dialogue and cooperation on foreign, security and defense policy issues. It invites the government to. I look forward to continuing to develop the cooperation in the Kingdom community - in close dialogue with both the Faroe Islands Government and Greenland's new Naalakkersuisut. And together with the North Atlantic members here in the Parliament. Thanks to you for a good collaboration. And then of course I look forward to a reunion with the Faroe Islands and Greenland as soon as the situation permits. * * * Since the government resigned almost two years ago, we have entered into 185 agreements across the middle here in the Parliament. Agreements on Green Change. About economics. About welfare. And about the handling of the pandemic. Thank you to all of you parties here in the hall for the good and broad cooperation. Denmark stood together when it applied. And a special thanks to SF. Radical Left. The Device List. Two years ago, we sat down together and wrote our common vision for a new fair direction for Denmark. Think it's only two years ago. A great deal has happened in the two years. And here I'm not just thinking about Corona. We promised each other that we would take the lead in the fight against the climate crisis. We set a goal that some called unrealistic. But which has proven to be the ambition that drives a green transition forward throughout the community. Energy Islands. Work with CO2 tax. A natural and biodiversity package. Stop for oil in the North Sea. Triple the tax on carrier bags and one -time service. Recycling of waste. More electric cars. Most recently, we have proposed stricter rules for environmental zones in the cities. The list of initiatives is long. There was a long discussion about the "Hockey Garden". That we only had to make the difficult decisions close to 2030. Here - only one year after we adopted the Climate Act - we have already made decisions which, together with the agricultural proposal and the decisions of business, bring us almost half the road. Half! And we have entered into an ambitious agreement on a goal in 2025. If there was ever a hockey stake. Then we can see that it is broken. We promised to strengthen our welfare. It's a big task. But we are in the process. Minimum standards. 1000 new nurses. Lifting of psychiatry. Municipal budgets with more space for welfare. Better rights and more security for vulnerable children. And the money comes along when there are more children and the elderly. We have delivered a billion investment in education. We have abolished the re -prioritization contribution. Made up with the education ceiling. Devoted money to more teachers in primary school. Invested in qualification and continuing education of unskilled workers. In better youth education.
